29 #ifndef NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
30 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HPP
31 
32 #include <algorithm> // all_of, copy, fill, find, for_each, generate_n, none_of, remove, reverse, transform
33 #include <array> // array
34 #include <cassert> // assert
35 #include <ciso646> // and, not, or
36 #include <clocale> // lconv, localeconv
37 #include <cmath> // isfinite, labs, ldexp, signbit
38 #include <cstddef> // nullptr_t, ptrdiff_t, size_t
39 #include <cstdint> // int64_t, uint64_t
40 #include <cstdlib> // abort, strtod, strtof, strtold, strtoul, strtoll, strtoull
41 #include <cstring> // memcpy, strlen
42 #include <forward_list> // forward_list
43 #include <functional> // function, hash, less
44 #include <initializer_list> // initializer_list
45 #include <iomanip> // hex
46 #include <iosfwd> // istream, ostream
47 #include <iterator> // advance, begin, back_inserter, bidirectional_iterator_tag, distance, end, inserter, iterator, iterator_traits, next, random_access_iterator_tag, reverse_iterator
48 #include <limits> // numeric_limits
49 #include <locale> // locale
50 #include <map> // map
51 #include <memory> // addressof, allocator, allocator_traits, unique_ptr
52 #include <numeric> // accumulate
53 #include <sstream> // stringstream
54 #include <string> // getline, stoi, string, to_string
55 #include <type_traits> // add_pointer, conditional, decay, enable_if, false_type, integral_constant, is_arithmetic, is_base_of, is_const, is_constructible, is_convertible, is_default_constructible, is_enum, is_floating_point, is_integral, is_nothrow_move_assignable, is_nothrow_move_constructible, is_pointer, is_reference, is_same, is_scalar, is_signed, remove_const, remove_cv, remove_pointer, remove_reference, true_type, underlying_type
56 #include <utility> // declval, forward, make_pair, move, pair, swap
57 #include <valarray> // valarray
58 #include <vector> // vector
59 
60 // exclude unsupported compilers
61 #if defined(__clang__)
62  #if (__clang_major__ * 10000 + __clang_minor__ * 100 + __clang_patchlevel__) < 30400
63  #error "unsupported Clang version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
64  #endif
65 #elif defined(__GNUC__)
66  #if (__GNUC__ * 10000 + __GNUC_MINOR__ * 100 + __GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__) < 40900
67  #error "unsupported GCC version - see https://github.com/nlohmann/json#supported-compilers"
68  #endif
69 #endif
70 
71 // disable float-equal warnings on GCC/clang
72 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
73  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
74  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wfloat-equal"
75 #endif
76 
77 // disable documentation warnings on clang
78 #if defined(__clang__)
79  #pragma GCC diagnostic push
80  #pragma GCC diagnostic ignored "-Wdocumentation"
81 #endif
82 
83 // allow for portable deprecation warnings
84 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
85  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __attribute__((deprecated))
86 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
87  #define JSON_DEPRECATED __declspec(deprecated)
88 #else
89  #define JSON_DEPRECATED
90 #endif
91 
92 // allow to disable exceptions
93 #if (defined(__cpp_exceptions) || defined(__EXCEPTIONS) || defined(_CPPUNWIND)) && not defined(JSON_NOEXCEPTION)
94  #define JSON_THROW(exception) throw exception
95  #define JSON_TRY try
96  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) catch(exception)
97 #else
98  #define JSON_THROW(exception) std::abort()
99  #define JSON_TRY if(true)
100  #define JSON_CATCH(exception) if(false)
101 #endif
102 
103 // manual branch prediction
104 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
105  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 1)
106  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) __builtin_expect(!!(x), 0)
107 #else
108  #define JSON_LIKELY(x) x
109  #define JSON_UNLIKELY(x) x
110 #endif
111 
117 namespace nlohmann
118 {
119 template<typename = void, typename = void>
120 struct adl_serializer;
121 
122 // forward declaration of basic_json (required to split the class)
123 template<template<typename U, typename V, typename... Args> class ObjectType =
124  std::map,
125  template<typename U, typename... Args> class ArrayType = std::vector,
126  class StringType = std::string, class BooleanType = bool,
127  class NumberIntegerType = std::int64_t,
128  class NumberUnsignedType = std::uint64_t,
129  class NumberFloatType = double,
130  template<typename U> class AllocatorType = std::allocator,
131  template<typename T, typename SFINAE = void> class JSONSerializer =
132  adl_serializer>
133 class basic_json;
134 
135 // Ugly macros to avoid uglier copy-paste when specializing basic_json
136 // This is only temporary and will be removed in 3.0
137 
138 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION \
139  template<template<typename, typename, typename...> class ObjectType, \
140  template<typename, typename...> class ArrayType, \
141  class StringType, class BooleanType, class NumberIntegerType, \
142  class NumberUnsignedType, class NumberFloatType, \
143  template<typename> class AllocatorType, \
144  template<typename, typename = void> class JSONSerializer>
145 
146 #define NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL \
147  basic_json<ObjectType, ArrayType, StringType, BooleanType, \
148  NumberIntegerType, NumberUnsignedType, NumberFloatType, \
149  AllocatorType, JSONSerializer>
150 
151 
160 namespace detail
161 {
163 // exceptions //
165 
194 class exception : public std::exception
195 {
196  public:
198  const char* what() const noexcept override
199  {
200  return m.what();
201  }
202 
204  const int id;
205 
206  protected:
207  exception(int id_, const char* what_arg) : id(id_), m(what_arg) {}
208 
209  static std::string name(const std::string& ename, int id)
210  {
211  return "[json.exception." + ename + "." + std::to_string(id) + "] ";
212  }
213 
214  private:
216  std::runtime_error m;
217 };
218 
262 class parse_error : public exception
263 {
264  public:
273  static parse_error create(int id, std::size_t byte_, const std::string& what_arg)
274  {
275  std::string w = exception::name("parse_error", id) + "parse error" +
276  (byte_ != 0 ? (" at " + std::to_string(byte_)) : "") +
277  ": " + what_arg;
278  return parse_error(id, byte_, w.c_str());
279  }
280 
290  const std::size_t byte;
291 
292  private:
293  parse_error(int id_, std::size_t byte_, const char* what_arg)
294  : exception(id_, what_arg), byte(byte_) {}
295 };
296 
334 class invalid_iterator : public exception
335 {
336  public:
337  static invalid_iterator create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
338  {
339  std::string w = exception::name("invalid_iterator", id) + what_arg;
340  return invalid_iterator(id, w.c_str());
341  }
342 
343  private:
344  invalid_iterator(int id_, const char* what_arg)
345  : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
346 };
347 
385 class type_error : public exception
386 {
387  public:
388  static type_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
389  {
390  std::string w = exception::name("type_error", id) + what_arg;
391  return type_error(id, w.c_str());
392  }
393 
394  private:
395  type_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
396 };
397 
428 class out_of_range : public exception
429 {
430  public:
431  static out_of_range create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
432  {
433  std::string w = exception::name("out_of_range", id) + what_arg;
434  return out_of_range(id, w.c_str());
435  }
436 
437  private:
438  out_of_range(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
439 };
440 
466 class other_error : public exception
467 {
468  public:
469  static other_error create(int id, const std::string& what_arg)
470  {
471  std::string w = exception::name("other_error", id) + what_arg;
472  return other_error(id, w.c_str());
473  }
474 
475  private:
476  other_error(int id_, const char* what_arg) : exception(id_, what_arg) {}
477 };
478 
479 
480 
482 // JSON type enumeration //
484 
509 enum class value_t : uint8_t
510 {
511  null,
512  object,
513  array,
514  string,
515  boolean,
516  number_integer,
517  number_unsigned,
518  number_float,
519  discarded
520 };
521 
531 inline bool operator<(const value_t lhs, const value_t rhs) noexcept
532 {
533  static constexpr std::array<uint8_t, 8> order = {{
534  0, // null
535  3, // object
536  4, // array
537  5, // string
538  1, // boolean
539  2, // integer
540  2, // unsigned
541  2, // float
542  }
543  };
544 
545  // discarded values are not comparable
546  return lhs != value_t::discarded and rhs != value_t::discarded and
547  order[static_cast<std::size_t>(lhs)] < order[static_cast<std::size_t>(rhs)];
548 }
549 
550 
552 // helpers //
554 
555 template<typename> struct is_basic_json : std::false_type {};
556 
557 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
558 struct is_basic_json<NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL> : std::true_type {};
559 
560 // alias templates to reduce boilerplate
561 template<bool B, typename T = void>
562 using enable_if_t = typename std::enable_if<B, T>::type;
563 
564 template<typename T>
565 using uncvref_t = typename std::remove_cv<typename std::remove_reference<T>::type>::type;
566 
567 // implementation of C++14 index_sequence and affiliates
568 // source: https://stackoverflow.com/a/32223343
569 template<std::size_t... Ints>
570 struct index_sequence
571 {
572  using type = index_sequence;
573  using value_type = std::size_t;
574  static constexpr std::size_t size() noexcept
575  {
576  return sizeof...(Ints);
577  }
578 };
579 
580 template<class Sequence1, class Sequence2>
581 struct merge_and_renumber;
582 
583 template<std::size_t... I1, std::size_t... I2>
584 struct merge_and_renumber<index_sequence<I1...>, index_sequence<I2...>>
585  : index_sequence < I1..., (sizeof...(I1) + I2)... >
586  {};
587 
588 template<std::size_t N>
589 struct make_index_sequence
590  : merge_and_renumber < typename make_index_sequence < N / 2 >::type,
591  typename make_index_sequence < N - N / 2 >::type >
592 {};
593 
594 template<> struct make_index_sequence<0> : index_sequence<> { };
595 template<> struct make_index_sequence<1> : index_sequence<0> { };
596 
597 template<typename... Ts>
598 using index_sequence_for = make_index_sequence<sizeof...(Ts)>;
599 
600 /*
601 Implementation of two C++17 constructs: conjunction, negation. This is needed
602 to avoid evaluating all the traits in a condition
603 
604 For example: not std::is_same<void, T>::value and has_value_type<T>::value
605 will not compile when T = void (on MSVC at least). Whereas
606 conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, T>>, has_value_type<T>>::value will
607 stop evaluating if negation<...>::value == false
608 
609 Please note that those constructs must be used with caution, since symbols can
610 become very long quickly (which can slow down compilation and cause MSVC
611 internal compiler errors). Only use it when you have to (see example ahead).
612 */
613 template<class...> struct conjunction : std::true_type {};
614 template<class B1> struct conjunction<B1> : B1 {};
615 template<class B1, class... Bn>
616 struct conjunction<B1, Bn...> : std::conditional<bool(B1::value), conjunction<Bn...>, B1>::type {};
617 
618 template<class B> struct negation : std::integral_constant < bool, !B::value > {};
619 
620 // dispatch utility (taken from ranges-v3)
621 template<unsigned N> struct priority_tag : priority_tag < N - 1 > {};
622 template<> struct priority_tag<0> {};
623 
624 
626 // constructors //
628 
629 template<value_t> struct external_constructor;
630 
631 template<>
632 struct external_constructor<value_t::boolean>
633 {
634  template<typename BasicJsonType>
635  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t b) noexcept
636  {
637  j.m_type = value_t::boolean;
638  j.m_value = b;
639  j.assert_invariant();
640  }
641 };
642 
643 template<>
644 struct external_constructor<value_t::string>
645 {
646  template<typename BasicJsonType>
647  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
648  {
649  j.m_type = value_t::string;
650  j.m_value = s;
651  j.assert_invariant();
652  }
653 
654  template<typename BasicJsonType>
655  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
656  {
657  j.m_type = value_t::string;
658  j.m_value = std::move(s);
659  j.assert_invariant();
660  }
661 };
662 
663 template<>
664 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_float>
665 {
666  template<typename BasicJsonType>
667  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t val) noexcept
668  {
669  j.m_type = value_t::number_float;
670  j.m_value = val;
671  j.assert_invariant();
672  }
673 };
674 
675 template<>
676 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>
677 {
678  template<typename BasicJsonType>
679  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t val) noexcept
680  {
681  j.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
682  j.m_value = val;
683  j.assert_invariant();
684  }
685 };
686 
687 template<>
688 struct external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>
689 {
690  template<typename BasicJsonType>
691  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t val) noexcept
692  {
693  j.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
694  j.m_value = val;
695  j.assert_invariant();
696  }
697 };
698 
699 template<>
700 struct external_constructor<value_t::array>
701 {
702  template<typename BasicJsonType>
703  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
704  {
705  j.m_type = value_t::array;
706  j.m_value = arr;
707  j.assert_invariant();
708  }
709 
710  template<typename BasicJsonType>
711  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
712  {
713  j.m_type = value_t::array;
714  j.m_value = std::move(arr);
715  j.assert_invariant();
716  }
717 
718  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
719  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleArrayType,
720  typename BasicJsonType::array_t>::value,
721  int> = 0>
722  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
723  {
724  using std::begin;
725  using std::end;
726  j.m_type = value_t::array;
727  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
728  j.assert_invariant();
729  }
730 
731  template<typename BasicJsonType>
732  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& arr)
733  {
734  j.m_type = value_t::array;
735  j.m_value = value_t::array;
736  j.m_value.array->reserve(arr.size());
737  for (bool x : arr)
738  {
739  j.m_value.array->push_back(x);
740  }
741  j.assert_invariant();
742  }
743 
744  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
745  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
746  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const std::valarray<T>& arr)
747  {
748  using std::begin;
749  using std::end;
750  j.m_type = value_t::array;
751  j.m_value = value_t::array;
752  j.m_value.array = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::array_t>(begin(arr), end(arr));
753  j.assert_invariant();
754  }
755 };
756 
757 template<>
758 struct external_constructor<value_t::object>
759 {
760  template<typename BasicJsonType>
761  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const typename BasicJsonType::object_t& obj)
762  {
763  j.m_type = value_t::object;
764  j.m_value = obj;
765  j.assert_invariant();
766  }
767 
768  template<typename BasicJsonType>
769  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
770  {
771  j.m_type = value_t::object;
772  j.m_value = std::move(obj);
773  j.assert_invariant();
774  }
775 
776  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
777  enable_if_t<not std::is_same<CompatibleObjectType,
778  typename BasicJsonType::object_t>::value, int> = 0>
779  static void construct(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
780  {
781  using std::begin;
782  using std::end;
783 
784  j.m_type = value_t::object;
785  j.m_value.object = j.template create<typename BasicJsonType::object_t>(begin(obj), end(obj));
786  j.assert_invariant();
787  }
788 };
789 
790 
792 // has_/is_ functions //
794 
805 #define NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(type) \
806  template<typename T> struct has_##type { \
807  private: \
808  template<typename U, typename = typename U::type> \
809  static int detect(U &&); \
810  static void detect(...); \
811  public: \
812  static constexpr bool value = \
813  std::is_integral<decltype(detect(std::declval<T>()))>::value; \
814  }
815 
816 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(mapped_type);
817 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(key_type);
818 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(value_type);
819 NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER(iterator);
820 
821 #undef NLOHMANN_JSON_HAS_HELPER
822 
823 
824 template<bool B, class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
825 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl : std::false_type {};
826 
827 template<class RealType, class CompatibleObjectType>
828 struct is_compatible_object_type_impl<true, RealType, CompatibleObjectType>
829 {
830  static constexpr auto value =
831  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::key_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::key_type>::value and
832  std::is_constructible<typename RealType::mapped_type, typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>::value;
833 };
834 
835 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleObjectType>
836 struct is_compatible_object_type
837 {
838  static auto constexpr value = is_compatible_object_type_impl <
839  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleObjectType>>,
840  has_mapped_type<CompatibleObjectType>,
841  has_key_type<CompatibleObjectType>>::value,
842  typename BasicJsonType::object_t, CompatibleObjectType >::value;
843 };
844 
845 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
846 struct is_basic_json_nested_type
847 {
848  static auto constexpr value = std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::iterator>::value or
849  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_iterator>::value or
850  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::reverse_iterator>::value or
851  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::const_reverse_iterator>::value;
852 };
853 
854 template<class BasicJsonType, class CompatibleArrayType>
855 struct is_compatible_array_type
856 {
857  static auto constexpr value =
858  conjunction<negation<std::is_same<void, CompatibleArrayType>>,
859  negation<is_compatible_object_type<
860  BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
861  negation<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
862  CompatibleArrayType>>,
863  negation<is_basic_json_nested_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>>,
864  has_value_type<CompatibleArrayType>,
865  has_iterator<CompatibleArrayType>>::value;
866 };
867 
868 template<bool, typename, typename>
869 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl : std::false_type {};
870 
871 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
872 struct is_compatible_integer_type_impl<true, RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
873 {
874  // is there an assert somewhere on overflows?
875  using RealLimits = std::numeric_limits<RealIntegerType>;
876  using CompatibleLimits = std::numeric_limits<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>;
877 
878  static constexpr auto value =
879  std::is_constructible<RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
880  CompatibleLimits::is_integer and
881  RealLimits::is_signed == CompatibleLimits::is_signed;
882 };
883 
884 template<typename RealIntegerType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType>
885 struct is_compatible_integer_type
886 {
887  static constexpr auto value =
888  is_compatible_integer_type_impl <
889  std::is_integral<CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value and
890  not std::is_same<bool, CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value,
891  RealIntegerType, CompatibleNumberIntegerType > ::value;
892 };
893 
894 
895 // trait checking if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&, udt&) exists
896 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
897 struct has_from_json
898 {
899  private:
900  // also check the return type of from_json
901  template<typename U, typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<void, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(
902  std::declval<BasicJsonType>(), std::declval<T&>()))>::value>>
903  static int detect(U&&);
904  static void detect(...);
905 
906  public:
907  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(
908  detect(std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
909 };
910 
911 // This trait checks if JSONSerializer<T>::from_json(json const&) exists
912 // this overload is used for non-default-constructible user-defined-types
913 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
914 struct has_non_default_from_json
915 {
916  private:
917  template <
918  typename U,
919  typename = enable_if_t<std::is_same<
920  T, decltype(uncvref_t<U>::from_json(std::declval<BasicJsonType>()))>::value >>
921  static int detect(U&&);
922  static void detect(...);
923 
924  public:
925  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
926  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
927 };
928 
929 // This trait checks if BasicJsonType::json_serializer<T>::to_json exists
930 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
931 struct has_to_json
932 {
933  private:
934  template<typename U, typename = decltype(uncvref_t<U>::to_json(
935  std::declval<BasicJsonType&>(), std::declval<T>()))>
936  static int detect(U&&);
937  static void detect(...);
938 
939  public:
940  static constexpr bool value = std::is_integral<decltype(detect(
941  std::declval<typename BasicJsonType::template json_serializer<T, void>>()))>::value;
942 };
943 
944 
946 // to_json //
948 
949 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, enable_if_t<
950  std::is_same<T, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value, int> = 0>
951 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T b) noexcept
952 {
953  external_constructor<value_t::boolean>::construct(j, b);
954 }
955 
956 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleString,
957  enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<typename BasicJsonType::string_t,
958  CompatibleString>::value, int> = 0>
959 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleString& s)
960 {
961  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, s);
962 }
963 
964 template <typename BasicJsonType>
965 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t&& s)
966 {
967  external_constructor<value_t::string>::construct(j, std::move(s));
968 }
969 
970 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename FloatType,
971  enable_if_t<std::is_floating_point<FloatType>::value, int> = 0>
972 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, FloatType val) noexcept
973 {
974  external_constructor<value_t::number_float>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>(val));
975 }
976 
977 template <
978  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberUnsignedType,
979  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t,
980  CompatibleNumberUnsignedType>::value, int> = 0 >
981 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberUnsignedType val) noexcept
982 {
983  external_constructor<value_t::number_unsigned>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>(val));
984 }
985 
986 template <
987  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleNumberIntegerType,
988  enable_if_t<is_compatible_integer_type<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t,
989  CompatibleNumberIntegerType>::value, int> = 0 >
990 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleNumberIntegerType val) noexcept
991 {
992  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>(val));
993 }
994 
995 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
996  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
997 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, EnumType e) noexcept
998 {
999  using underlying_type = typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type;
1000  external_constructor<value_t::number_integer>::construct(j, static_cast<underlying_type>(e));
1001 }
1002 
1003 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1004 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::vector<bool>& e)
1005 {
1006  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, e);
1007 }
1008 
1009 template <
1010  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1011  enable_if_t <
1012  is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value or
1013  std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value,
1014  int > = 0 >
1015 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1016 {
1017  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
1018 }
1019 
1020 template <typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1021  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<T, BasicJsonType>::value, int> = 0>
1022 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, std::valarray<T> arr)
1023 {
1024  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
1025 }
1026 
1027 template <typename BasicJsonType>
1028 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t&& arr)
1029 {
1030  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, std::move(arr));
1031 }
1032 
1033 template <
1034  typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1035  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value,
1036  int> = 0 >
1037 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1038 {
1039  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, obj);
1040 }
1041 
1042 template <typename BasicJsonType>
1043 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::object_t&& obj)
1044 {
1045  external_constructor<value_t::object>::construct(j, std::move(obj));
1046 }
1047 
1048 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N,
1049  enable_if_t<not std::is_constructible<
1050  typename BasicJsonType::string_t, T (&)[N]>::value,
1051  int> = 0>
1052 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, T (&arr)[N])
1053 {
1054  external_constructor<value_t::array>::construct(j, arr);
1055 }
1056 
1057 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1058 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::pair<Args...>& p)
1059 {
1060  j = {p.first, p.second};
1061 }
1062 
1063 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
1064 void to_json_tuple_impl(BasicJsonType& j, const Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...>)
1065 {
1066  j = {std::get<Idx>(t)...};
1067 }
1068 
1069 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1070 void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, const std::tuple<Args...>& t)
1071 {
1072  to_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
1073 }
1074 
1076 // from_json //
1078 
1079 // overloads for basic_json template parameters
1080 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1081  enable_if_t<std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1082  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType,
1083  typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1084  int> = 0>
1085 void get_arithmetic_value(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1086 {
1087  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1088  {
1089  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1090  {
1091  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1092  break;
1093  }
1094  case value_t::number_integer:
1095  {
1096  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1097  break;
1098  }
1099  case value_t::number_float:
1100  {
1101  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1102  break;
1103  }
1104 
1105  default:
1106  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1107  }
1108 }
1109 
1110 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1111 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t& b)
1112 {
1113  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_boolean()))
1114  {
1115  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1116  }
1117  b = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>();
1118 }
1119 
1120 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1121 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::string_t& s)
1122 {
1123  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_string()))
1124  {
1125  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be string, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1126  }
1127  s = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::string_t*>();
1128 }
1129 
1130 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1131 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t& val)
1132 {
1133  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1134 }
1135 
1136 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1137 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t& val)
1138 {
1139  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1140 }
1141 
1142 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1143 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t& val)
1144 {
1145  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1146 }
1147 
1148 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename EnumType,
1149  enable_if_t<std::is_enum<EnumType>::value, int> = 0>
1150 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, EnumType& e)
1151 {
1152  typename std::underlying_type<EnumType>::type val;
1153  get_arithmetic_value(j, val);
1154  e = static_cast<EnumType>(val);
1155 }
1156 
1157 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1158 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, typename BasicJsonType::array_t& arr)
1159 {
1160  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1161  {
1162  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1163  }
1164  arr = *j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::array_t*>();
1165 }
1166 
1167 // forward_list doesn't have an insert method
1168 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, typename Allocator,
1169  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1170 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::forward_list<T, Allocator>& l)
1171 {
1172  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1173  {
1174  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1175  }
1176  std::transform(j.rbegin(), j.rend(),
1177  std::front_inserter(l), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1178  {
1179  return i.template get<T>();
1180  });
1181 }
1182 
1183 // valarray doesn't have an insert method
1184 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T,
1185  enable_if_t<std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, T>::value, int> = 0>
1186 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::valarray<T>& l)
1187 {
1188  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1189  {
1190  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1191  }
1192  l.resize(j.size());
1193  for (size_t i = 0; i < j.size(); ++i)
1194  {
1195  l[i] = j[i];
1196  }
1197 }
1198 
1199 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
1200 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/)
1201 {
1202  using std::end;
1203 
1204  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1205  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1206  {
1207  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1208  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1209  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
1210  });
1211 }
1212 
1213 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType>
1214 auto from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/)
1215 -> decltype(
1216  arr.reserve(std::declval<typename CompatibleArrayType::size_type>()),
1217  void())
1218 {
1219  using std::end;
1220 
1221  arr.reserve(j.size());
1222  std::transform(j.begin(), j.end(),
1223  std::inserter(arr, end(arr)), [](const BasicJsonType & i)
1224  {
1225  // get<BasicJsonType>() returns *this, this won't call a from_json
1226  // method when value_type is BasicJsonType
1227  return i.template get<typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>();
1228  });
1229 }
1230 
1231 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T, std::size_t N>
1232 void from_json_array_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, std::array<T, N>& arr, priority_tag<2> /*unused*/)
1233 {
1234  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < N; ++i)
1235  {
1236  arr[i] = j.at(i).template get<T>();
1237  }
1238 }
1239 
1240 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType,
1241  enable_if_t<is_compatible_array_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleArrayType>::value and
1242  std::is_convertible<BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleArrayType::value_type>::value and
1243  not std::is_same<typename BasicJsonType::array_t, CompatibleArrayType>::value, int> = 0>
1244 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleArrayType& arr)
1245 {
1246  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_array()))
1247  {
1248  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be array, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1249  }
1250 
1251  from_json_array_impl(j, arr, priority_tag<2> {});
1252 }
1253 
1254 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CompatibleObjectType,
1255  enable_if_t<is_compatible_object_type<BasicJsonType, CompatibleObjectType>::value, int> = 0>
1256 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, CompatibleObjectType& obj)
1257 {
1258  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
1259  {
1260  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be object, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1261  }
1262 
1263  auto inner_object = j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::object_t*>();
1264  using value_type = typename CompatibleObjectType::value_type;
1265  std::transform(
1266  inner_object->begin(), inner_object->end(),
1267  std::inserter(obj, obj.begin()),
1268  [](typename BasicJsonType::object_t::value_type const & p)
1269  {
1270  return value_type(p.first, p.second.template get<typename CompatibleObjectType::mapped_type>());
1271  });
1272 }
1273 
1274 // overload for arithmetic types, not chosen for basic_json template arguments
1275 // (BooleanType, etc..); note: Is it really necessary to provide explicit
1276 // overloads for boolean_t etc. in case of a custom BooleanType which is not
1277 // an arithmetic type?
1278 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ArithmeticType,
1279  enable_if_t <
1280  std::is_arithmetic<ArithmeticType>::value and
1281  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t>::value and
1282  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t>::value and
1283  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t>::value and
1284  not std::is_same<ArithmeticType, typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t>::value,
1285  int> = 0>
1286 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, ArithmeticType& val)
1287 {
1288  switch (static_cast<value_t>(j))
1289  {
1290  case value_t::number_unsigned:
1291  {
1292  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t*>());
1293  break;
1294  }
1295  case value_t::number_integer:
1296  {
1297  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t*>());
1298  break;
1299  }
1300  case value_t::number_float:
1301  {
1302  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t*>());
1303  break;
1304  }
1305  case value_t::boolean:
1306  {
1307  val = static_cast<ArithmeticType>(*j.template get_ptr<const typename BasicJsonType::boolean_t*>());
1308  break;
1309  }
1310 
1311  default:
1312  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be number, but is " + std::string(j.type_name())));
1313  }
1314 }
1315 
1316 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename A1, typename A2>
1317 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::pair<A1, A2>& p)
1318 {
1319  p = {j.at(0).template get<A1>(), j.at(1).template get<A2>()};
1320 }
1321 
1322 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename Tuple, std::size_t... Idx>
1323 void from_json_tuple_impl(const BasicJsonType& j, Tuple& t, index_sequence<Idx...>)
1324 {
1325  t = std::make_tuple(j.at(Idx).template get<typename std::tuple_element<Idx, Tuple>::type>()...);
1326 }
1327 
1328 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename... Args>
1329 void from_json(const BasicJsonType& j, std::tuple<Args...>& t)
1330 {
1331  from_json_tuple_impl(j, t, index_sequence_for<Args...> {});
1332 }
1333 
1334 struct to_json_fn
1335 {
1336  private:
1337  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1338  auto call(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const noexcept(noexcept(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val))))
1339  -> decltype(to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val)), void())
1340  {
1341  return to_json(j, std::forward<T>(val));
1342  }
1343 
1344  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1345  void call(BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T&& /*unused*/, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
1346  {
1347  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1348  "could not find to_json() method in T's namespace");
1349  }
1350 
1351  public:
1352  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1353  void operator()(BasicJsonType& j, T&& val) const
1354  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<to_json_fn>().call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {})))
1355  {
1356  return call(j, std::forward<T>(val), priority_tag<1> {});
1357  }
1358 };
1359 
1360 struct from_json_fn
1361 {
1362  private:
1363  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1364  auto call(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val, priority_tag<1> /*unused*/) const
1365  noexcept(noexcept(from_json(j, val)))
1366  -> decltype(from_json(j, val), void())
1367  {
1368  return from_json(j, val);
1369  }
1370 
1371  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1372  void call(const BasicJsonType& /*unused*/, T& /*unused*/, priority_tag<0> /*unused*/) const noexcept
1373  {
1374  static_assert(sizeof(BasicJsonType) == 0,
1375  "could not find from_json() method in T's namespace");
1376  }
1377 
1378  public:
1379  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename T>
1380  void operator()(const BasicJsonType& j, T& val) const
1381  noexcept(noexcept(std::declval<from_json_fn>().call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {})))
1382  {
1383  return call(j, val, priority_tag<1> {});
1384  }
1385 };
1386 
1387 // taken from ranges-v3
1388 template<typename T>
1389 struct static_const
1390 {
1391  static constexpr T value{};
1392 };
1393 
1394 template<typename T>
1395 constexpr T static_const<T>::value;
1396 
1398 // input adapters //
1400 
1402 struct input_adapter_protocol
1403 {
1404  virtual int get_character() = 0;
1405  virtual std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) = 0;
1406  virtual ~input_adapter_protocol() = default;
1407 };
1408 
1410 using input_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<input_adapter_protocol>;
1411 
1413 template<std::size_t BufferSize>
1414 class cached_input_stream_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
1415 {
1416  public:
1417  explicit cached_input_stream_adapter(std::istream& i)
1418  : is(i), start_position(is.tellg())
1419  {
1420  fill_buffer();
1421 
1422  // skip byte order mark
1423  if (fill_size >= 3 and buffer[0] == '\xEF' and buffer[1] == '\xBB' and buffer[2] == '\xBF')
1424  {
1425  buffer_pos += 3;
1426  processed_chars += 3;
1427  }
1428  }
1429 
1430  ~cached_input_stream_adapter() override
1431  {
1432  // clear stream flags
1433  is.clear();
1434  // We initially read a lot of characters into the buffer, and we may
1435  // not have processed all of them. Therefore, we need to "rewind" the
1436  // stream after the last processed char.
1437  is.seekg(start_position);
1438  is.ignore(static_cast<std::streamsize>(processed_chars));
1439  // clear stream flags
1440  is.clear();
1441  }
1442 
1443  int get_character() override
1444  {
1445  // check if refilling is necessary and possible
1446  if (buffer_pos == fill_size and not eof)
1447  {
1448  fill_buffer();
1449 
1450  // check and remember that filling did not yield new input
1451  if (fill_size == 0)
1452  {
1453  eof = true;
1454  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
1455  }
1456 
1457  // the buffer is ready
1458  buffer_pos = 0;
1459  }
1460 
1461  ++processed_chars;
1462  assert(buffer_pos < buffer.size());
1463  return buffer[buffer_pos++] & 0xFF;
1464  }
1465 
1466  std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) override
1467  {
1468  // create buffer
1469  std::string result(length, '\0');
1470 
1471  // save stream position
1472  const auto current_pos = is.tellg();
1473  // save stream flags
1474  const auto flags = is.rdstate();
1475 
1476  // clear stream flags
1477  is.clear();
1478  // set stream position
1479  is.seekg(static_cast<std::streamoff>(offset));
1480  // read bytes
1481  is.read(&result[0], static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
1482 
1483  // reset stream position
1484  is.seekg(current_pos);
1485  // reset stream flags
1486  is.setstate(flags);
1487 
1488  return result;
1489  }
1490 
1491  private:
1492  void fill_buffer()
1493  {
1494  // fill
1495  is.read(buffer.data(), static_cast<std::streamsize>(buffer.size()));
1496  // store number of bytes in the buffer
1497  fill_size = static_cast<size_t>(is.gcount());
1498  }
1499 
1501  std::istream& is;
1502 
1504  std::size_t processed_chars = 0;
1506  std::size_t buffer_pos = 0;
1507 
1509  bool eof = false;
1511  std::size_t fill_size = 0;
1512 
1514  const std::streampos start_position;
1515 
1517  std::array<char, BufferSize> buffer{{}};
1518 };
1519 
1521 class input_buffer_adapter : public input_adapter_protocol
1522 {
1523  public:
1524  input_buffer_adapter(const char* b, const std::size_t l)
1525  : cursor(b), limit(b + l), start(b)
1526  {
1527  // skip byte order mark
1528  if (l >= 3 and b[0] == '\xEF' and b[1] == '\xBB' and b[2] == '\xBF')
1529  {
1530  cursor += 3;
1531  }
1532  }
1533 
1534  // delete because of pointer members
1535  input_buffer_adapter(const input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
1536  input_buffer_adapter& operator=(input_buffer_adapter&) = delete;
1537 
1538  int get_character() noexcept override
1539  {
1540  if (JSON_LIKELY(cursor < limit))
1541  {
1542  return *(cursor++) & 0xFF;
1543  }
1544 
1545  return std::char_traits<char>::eof();
1546  }
1547 
1548  std::string read(std::size_t offset, std::size_t length) override
1549  {
1550  // avoid reading too many characters
1551  const auto max_length = static_cast<size_t>(limit - start);
1552  return std::string(start + offset, (std::min)(length, max_length - offset));
1553  }
1554 
1555  private:
1557  const char* cursor;
1559  const char* limit;
1561  const char* start;
1562 };
1563 
1564 class input_adapter
1565 {
1566  public:
1567  // native support
1568 
1570  input_adapter(std::istream& i)
1571  : ia(std::make_shared<cached_input_stream_adapter<16384>>(i)) {}
1572 
1574  input_adapter(std::istream&& i)
1575  : ia(std::make_shared<cached_input_stream_adapter<16384>>(i)) {}
1576 
1578  template<typename CharT,
1579  typename std::enable_if<
1580  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
1581  std::is_integral<
1582  typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
1583  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
1584  int>::type = 0>
1585  input_adapter(CharT b, std::size_t l)
1586  : ia(std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b), l)) {}
1587 
1588  // derived support
1589 
1591  template<typename CharT,
1592  typename std::enable_if<
1593  std::is_pointer<CharT>::value and
1594  std::is_integral<
1595  typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type>::value and
1596  sizeof(typename std::remove_pointer<CharT>::type) == 1,
1597  int>::type = 0>
1598  input_adapter(CharT b)
1599  : input_adapter(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b),
1600  std::strlen(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(b))) {}
1601 
1603  template<class IteratorType,
1604  typename std::enable_if<
1605  std::is_same<typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category,
1606  std::random_access_iterator_tag>::value,
1607  int>::type = 0>
1608  input_adapter(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
1609  {
1610  // assertion to check that the iterator range is indeed contiguous,
1611  // see http://stackoverflow.com/a/35008842/266378 for more discussion
1612  assert(std::accumulate(
1613  first, last, std::pair<bool, int>(true, 0),
1614  [&first](std::pair<bool, int> res, decltype(*first) val)
1615  {
1616  res.first &= (val == *(std::next(std::addressof(*first), res.second++)));
1617  return res;
1618  }).first);
1619 
1620  // assertion to check that each element is 1 byte long
1621  static_assert(
1622  sizeof(typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::value_type) == 1,
1623  "each element in the iterator range must have the size of 1 byte");
1624 
1625  const auto len = static_cast<size_t>(std::distance(first, last));
1626  if (JSON_LIKELY(len > 0))
1627  {
1628  // there is at least one element: use the address of first
1629  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(reinterpret_cast<const char*>(&(*first)), len);
1630  }
1631  else
1632  {
1633  // the address of first cannot be used: use nullptr
1634  ia = std::make_shared<input_buffer_adapter>(nullptr, len);
1635  }
1636  }
1637 
1639  template<class T, std::size_t N>
1640  input_adapter(T (&array)[N])
1641  : input_adapter(std::begin(array), std::end(array)) {}
1642 
1644  template <
1645  class ContiguousContainer,
1646  typename std::enable_if <
1647  not std::is_pointer<ContiguousContainer>::value and
1648  std::is_base_of<std::random_access_iterator_tag,
1649  typename std::iterator_traits<decltype(std::begin(std::declval<ContiguousContainer const>()))>::iterator_category>::value,
1650  int >::type = 0 >
1651  input_adapter(const ContiguousContainer& c)
1652  : input_adapter(std::begin(c), std::end(c)) {}
1653 
1654  operator input_adapter_t()
1655  {
1656  return ia;
1657  }
1658 
1659  private:
1661  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
1662 };
1663 
1665 // lexer and parser //
1667 
1673 template<typename BasicJsonType>
1674 class lexer
1675 {
1676  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
1677  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
1678  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
1679 
1680  public:
1682  enum class token_type
1683  {
1684  uninitialized,
1685  literal_true,
1686  literal_false,
1687  literal_null,
1688  value_string,
1689  value_unsigned,
1690  value_integer,
1691  value_float,
1692  begin_array,
1693  begin_object,
1694  end_array,
1695  end_object,
1696  name_separator,
1697  value_separator,
1698  parse_error,
1699  end_of_input,
1700  literal_or_value
1701  };
1702 
1704  static const char* token_type_name(const token_type t) noexcept
1705  {
1706  switch (t)
1707  {
1708  case token_type::uninitialized:
1709  return "<uninitialized>";
1710  case token_type::literal_true:
1711  return "true literal";
1712  case token_type::literal_false:
1713  return "false literal";
1714  case token_type::literal_null:
1715  return "null literal";
1716  case token_type::value_string:
1717  return "string literal";
1718  case lexer::token_type::value_unsigned:
1719  case lexer::token_type::value_integer:
1720  case lexer::token_type::value_float:
1721  return "number literal";
1722  case token_type::begin_array:
1723  return "'['";
1724  case token_type::begin_object:
1725  return "'{'";
1726  case token_type::end_array:
1727  return "']'";
1728  case token_type::end_object:
1729  return "'}'";
1730  case token_type::name_separator:
1731  return "':'";
1732  case token_type::value_separator:
1733  return "','";
1734  case token_type::parse_error:
1735  return "<parse error>";
1736  case token_type::end_of_input:
1737  return "end of input";
1738  case token_type::literal_or_value:
1739  return "'[', '{', or a literal";
1740  default: // catch non-enum values
1741  return "unknown token"; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
1742  }
1743  }
1744 
1745  explicit lexer(detail::input_adapter_t adapter)
1746  : ia(std::move(adapter)), decimal_point_char(get_decimal_point()) {}
1747 
1748  // delete because of pointer members
1749  lexer(const lexer&) = delete;
1750  lexer& operator=(lexer&) = delete;
1751 
1752  private:
1754  // locales
1756 
1758  static char get_decimal_point() noexcept
1759  {
1760  const auto loc = localeconv();
1761  assert(loc != nullptr);
1762  return (loc->decimal_point == nullptr) ? '.' : loc->decimal_point[0];
1763  }
1764 
1766  // scan functions
1768 
1784  int get_codepoint()
1785  {
1786  // this function only makes sense after reading `\u`
1787  assert(current == 'u');
1788  int codepoint = 0;
1789 
1790  const auto factors = { 12, 8, 4, 0 };
1791  for (const auto factor : factors)
1792  {
1793  get();
1794 
1795  if (current >= '0' and current <= '9')
1796  {
1797  codepoint += ((current - 0x30) << factor);
1798  }
1799  else if (current >= 'A' and current <= 'F')
1800  {
1801  codepoint += ((current - 0x37) << factor);
1802  }
1803  else if (current >= 'a' and current <= 'f')
1804  {
1805  codepoint += ((current - 0x57) << factor);
1806  }
1807  else
1808  {
1809  return -1;
1810  }
1811  }
1812 
1813  assert(0x0000 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0xFFFF);
1814  return codepoint;
1815  }
1816 
1826  bool next_byte_in_range(std::initializer_list<int> ranges)
1827  {
1828  assert(ranges.size() == 2 or ranges.size() == 4 or ranges.size() == 6);
1829  add(current);
1830 
1831  for (auto range = ranges.begin(); range != ranges.end(); ++range)
1832  {
1833  get();
1834  if (JSON_LIKELY(*range <= current and current <= *(++range)))
1835  {
1836  add(current);
1837  }
1838  else
1839  {
1840  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
1841  return false;
1842  }
1843  }
1844 
1845  return true;
1846  }
1847 
1862  token_type scan_string()
1863  {
1864  // reset yytext (ignore opening quote)
1865  reset();
1866 
1867  // we entered the function by reading an open quote
1868  assert(current == '\"');
1869 
1870  while (true)
1871  {
1872  // get next character
1873  switch (get())
1874  {
1875  // end of file while parsing string
1876  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
1877  {
1878  error_message = "invalid string: missing closing quote";
1879  return token_type::parse_error;
1880  }
1881 
1882  // closing quote
1883  case '\"':
1884  {
1885  // terminate yytext
1886  add('\0');
1887  --yylen;
1888  return token_type::value_string;
1889  }
1890 
1891  // escapes
1892  case '\\':
1893  {
1894  switch (get())
1895  {
1896  // quotation mark
1897  case '\"':
1898  add('\"');
1899  break;
1900  // reverse solidus
1901  case '\\':
1902  add('\\');
1903  break;
1904  // solidus
1905  case '/':
1906  add('/');
1907  break;
1908  // backspace
1909  case 'b':
1910  add('\b');
1911  break;
1912  // form feed
1913  case 'f':
1914  add('\f');
1915  break;
1916  // line feed
1917  case 'n':
1918  add('\n');
1919  break;
1920  // carriage return
1921  case 'r':
1922  add('\r');
1923  break;
1924  // tab
1925  case 't':
1926  add('\t');
1927  break;
1928 
1929  // unicode escapes
1930  case 'u':
1931  {
1932  int codepoint;
1933  const int codepoint1 = get_codepoint();
1934 
1935  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint1 == -1))
1936  {
1937  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
1938  return token_type::parse_error;
1939  }
1940 
1941  // check if code point is a high surrogate
1942  if (0xD800 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDBFF)
1943  {
1944  // expect next \uxxxx entry
1945  if (JSON_LIKELY(get() == '\\' and get() == 'u'))
1946  {
1947  const int codepoint2 = get_codepoint();
1948 
1949  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(codepoint2 == -1))
1950  {
1951  error_message = "invalid string: '\\u' must be followed by 4 hex digits";
1952  return token_type::parse_error;
1953  }
1954 
1955  // check if codepoint2 is a low surrogate
1956  if (JSON_LIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint2 and codepoint2 <= 0xDFFF))
1957  {
1958  codepoint =
1959  // high surrogate occupies the most significant 22 bits
1960  (codepoint1 << 10)
1961  // low surrogate occupies the least significant 15 bits
1962  + codepoint2
1963  // there is still the 0xD800, 0xDC00 and 0x10000 noise
1964  // in the result so we have to subtract with:
1965  // (0xD800 << 10) + DC00 - 0x10000 = 0x35FDC00
1966  - 0x35FDC00;
1967  }
1968  else
1969  {
1970  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
1971  return token_type::parse_error;
1972  }
1973  }
1974  else
1975  {
1976  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must be followed by U+DC00..U+DFFF";
1977  return token_type::parse_error;
1978  }
1979  }
1980  else
1981  {
1982  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(0xDC00 <= codepoint1 and codepoint1 <= 0xDFFF))
1983  {
1984  error_message = "invalid string: surrogate U+DC00..U+DFFF must follow U+D800..U+DBFF";
1985  return token_type::parse_error;
1986  }
1987 
1988  // only work with first code point
1989  codepoint = codepoint1;
1990  }
1991 
1992  // result of the above calculation yields a proper codepoint
1993  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
1994 
1995  // translate code point to bytes
1996  if (codepoint < 0x80)
1997  {
1998  // 1-byte characters: 0xxxxxxx (ASCII)
1999  add(codepoint);
2000  }
2001  else if (codepoint <= 0x7ff)
2002  {
2003  // 2-byte characters: 110xxxxx 10xxxxxx
2004  add(0xC0 | (codepoint >> 6));
2005  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2006  }
2007  else if (codepoint <= 0xffff)
2008  {
2009  // 3-byte characters: 1110xxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2010  add(0xE0 | (codepoint >> 12));
2011  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2012  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2013  }
2014  else
2015  {
2016  // 4-byte characters: 11110xxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx 10xxxxxx
2017  add(0xF0 | (codepoint >> 18));
2018  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 12) & 0x3F));
2019  add(0x80 | ((codepoint >> 6) & 0x3F));
2020  add(0x80 | (codepoint & 0x3F));
2021  }
2022 
2023  break;
2024  }
2025 
2026  // other characters after escape
2027  default:
2028  error_message = "invalid string: forbidden character after backslash";
2029  return token_type::parse_error;
2030  }
2031 
2032  break;
2033  }
2034 
2035  // invalid control characters
2036  case 0x00:
2037  case 0x01:
2038  case 0x02:
2039  case 0x03:
2040  case 0x04:
2041  case 0x05:
2042  case 0x06:
2043  case 0x07:
2044  case 0x08:
2045  case 0x09:
2046  case 0x0a:
2047  case 0x0b:
2048  case 0x0c:
2049  case 0x0d:
2050  case 0x0e:
2051  case 0x0f:
2052  case 0x10:
2053  case 0x11:
2054  case 0x12:
2055  case 0x13:
2056  case 0x14:
2057  case 0x15:
2058  case 0x16:
2059  case 0x17:
2060  case 0x18:
2061  case 0x19:
2062  case 0x1a:
2063  case 0x1b:
2064  case 0x1c:
2065  case 0x1d:
2066  case 0x1e:
2067  case 0x1f:
2068  {
2069  error_message = "invalid string: control character must be escaped";
2070  return token_type::parse_error;
2071  }
2072 
2073  // U+0020..U+007F (except U+0022 (quote) and U+005C (backspace))
2074  case 0x20:
2075  case 0x21:
2076  case 0x23:
2077  case 0x24:
2078  case 0x25:
2079  case 0x26:
2080  case 0x27:
2081  case 0x28:
2082  case 0x29:
2083  case 0x2a:
2084  case 0x2b:
2085  case 0x2c:
2086  case 0x2d:
2087  case 0x2e:
2088  case 0x2f:
2089  case 0x30:
2090  case 0x31:
2091  case 0x32:
2092  case 0x33:
2093  case 0x34:
2094  case 0x35:
2095  case 0x36:
2096  case 0x37:
2097  case 0x38:
2098  case 0x39:
2099  case 0x3a:
2100  case 0x3b:
2101  case 0x3c:
2102  case 0x3d:
2103  case 0x3e:
2104  case 0x3f:
2105  case 0x40:
2106  case 0x41:
2107  case 0x42:
2108  case 0x43:
2109  case 0x44:
2110  case 0x45:
2111  case 0x46:
2112  case 0x47:
2113  case 0x48:
2114  case 0x49:
2115  case 0x4a:
2116  case 0x4b:
2117  case 0x4c:
2118  case 0x4d:
2119  case 0x4e:
2120  case 0x4f:
2121  case 0x50:
2122  case 0x51:
2123  case 0x52:
2124  case 0x53:
2125  case 0x54:
2126  case 0x55:
2127  case 0x56:
2128  case 0x57:
2129  case 0x58:
2130  case 0x59:
2131  case 0x5a:
2132  case 0x5b:
2133  case 0x5d:
2134  case 0x5e:
2135  case 0x5f:
2136  case 0x60:
2137  case 0x61:
2138  case 0x62:
2139  case 0x63:
2140  case 0x64:
2141  case 0x65:
2142  case 0x66:
2143  case 0x67:
2144  case 0x68:
2145  case 0x69:
2146  case 0x6a:
2147  case 0x6b:
2148  case 0x6c:
2149  case 0x6d:
2150  case 0x6e:
2151  case 0x6f:
2152  case 0x70:
2153  case 0x71:
2154  case 0x72:
2155  case 0x73:
2156  case 0x74:
2157  case 0x75:
2158  case 0x76:
2159  case 0x77:
2160  case 0x78:
2161  case 0x79:
2162  case 0x7a:
2163  case 0x7b:
2164  case 0x7c:
2165  case 0x7d:
2166  case 0x7e:
2167  case 0x7f:
2168  {
2169  add(current);
2170  break;
2171  }
2172 
2173  // U+0080..U+07FF: bytes C2..DF 80..BF
2174  case 0xc2:
2175  case 0xc3:
2176  case 0xc4:
2177  case 0xc5:
2178  case 0xc6:
2179  case 0xc7:
2180  case 0xc8:
2181  case 0xc9:
2182  case 0xca:
2183  case 0xcb:
2184  case 0xcc:
2185  case 0xcd:
2186  case 0xce:
2187  case 0xcf:
2188  case 0xd0:
2189  case 0xd1:
2190  case 0xd2:
2191  case 0xd3:
2192  case 0xd4:
2193  case 0xd5:
2194  case 0xd6:
2195  case 0xd7:
2196  case 0xd8:
2197  case 0xd9:
2198  case 0xda:
2199  case 0xdb:
2200  case 0xdc:
2201  case 0xdd:
2202  case 0xde:
2203  case 0xdf:
2204  {
2205  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF})))
2206  {
2207  return token_type::parse_error;
2208  }
2209  break;
2210  }
2211 
2212  // U+0800..U+0FFF: bytes E0 A0..BF 80..BF
2213  case 0xe0:
2214  {
2215  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0xA0, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2216  {
2217  return token_type::parse_error;
2218  }
2219  break;
2220  }
2221 
2222  // U+1000..U+CFFF: bytes E1..EC 80..BF 80..BF
2223  // U+E000..U+FFFF: bytes EE..EF 80..BF 80..BF
2224  case 0xe1:
2225  case 0xe2:
2226  case 0xe3:
2227  case 0xe4:
2228  case 0xe5:
2229  case 0xe6:
2230  case 0xe7:
2231  case 0xe8:
2232  case 0xe9:
2233  case 0xea:
2234  case 0xeb:
2235  case 0xec:
2236  case 0xee:
2237  case 0xef:
2238  {
2239  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2240  {
2241  return token_type::parse_error;
2242  }
2243  break;
2244  }
2245 
2246  // U+D000..U+D7FF: bytes ED 80..9F 80..BF
2247  case 0xed:
2248  {
2249  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x9F, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2250  {
2251  return token_type::parse_error;
2252  }
2253  break;
2254  }
2255 
2256  // U+10000..U+3FFFF F0 90..BF 80..BF 80..BF
2257  case 0xf0:
2258  {
2259  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x90, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2260  {
2261  return token_type::parse_error;
2262  }
2263  break;
2264  }
2265 
2266  // U+40000..U+FFFFF F1..F3 80..BF 80..BF 80..BF
2267  case 0xf1:
2268  case 0xf2:
2269  case 0xf3:
2270  {
2271  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2272  {
2273  return token_type::parse_error;
2274  }
2275  break;
2276  }
2277 
2278  // U+100000..U+10FFFF F4 80..8F 80..BF 80..BF
2279  case 0xf4:
2280  {
2281  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not (next_byte_in_range({0x80, 0x8F, 0x80, 0xBF, 0x80, 0xBF}))))
2282  {
2283  return token_type::parse_error;
2284  }
2285  break;
2286  }
2287 
2288  // remaining bytes (80..C1 and F5..FF) are ill-formed
2289  default:
2290  {
2291  error_message = "invalid string: ill-formed UTF-8 byte";
2292  return token_type::parse_error;
2293  }
2294  }
2295  }
2296  }
2297 
2298  static void strtof(float& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2299  {
2300  f = std::strtof(str, endptr);
2301  }
2302 
2303  static void strtof(double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2304  {
2305  f = std::strtod(str, endptr);
2306  }
2307 
2308  static void strtof(long double& f, const char* str, char** endptr) noexcept
2309  {
2310  f = std::strtold(str, endptr);
2311  }
2312 
2353  token_type scan_number()
2354  {
2355  // reset yytext to store the number's bytes
2356  reset();
2357 
2358  // the type of the parsed number; initially set to unsigned; will be
2359  // changed if minus sign, decimal point or exponent is read
2360  token_type number_type = token_type::value_unsigned;
2361 
2362  // state (init): we just found out we need to scan a number
2363  switch (current)
2364  {
2365  case '-':
2366  {
2367  add(current);
2368  goto scan_number_minus;
2369  }
2370 
2371  case '0':
2372  {
2373  add(current);
2374  goto scan_number_zero;
2375  }
2376 
2377  case '1':
2378  case '2':
2379  case '3':
2380  case '4':
2381  case '5':
2382  case '6':
2383  case '7':
2384  case '8':
2385  case '9':
2386  {
2387  add(current);
2388  goto scan_number_any1;
2389  }
2390 
2391  default:
2392  {
2393  // all other characters are rejected outside scan_number()
2394  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
2395  }
2396  }
2397 
2398 scan_number_minus:
2399  // state: we just parsed a leading minus sign
2400  number_type = token_type::value_integer;
2401  switch (get())
2402  {
2403  case '0':
2404  {
2405  add(current);
2406  goto scan_number_zero;
2407  }
2408 
2409  case '1':
2410  case '2':
2411  case '3':
2412  case '4':
2413  case '5':
2414  case '6':
2415  case '7':
2416  case '8':
2417  case '9':
2418  {
2419  add(current);
2420  goto scan_number_any1;
2421  }
2422 
2423  default:
2424  {
2425  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '-'";
2426  return token_type::parse_error;
2427  }
2428  }
2429 
2430 scan_number_zero:
2431  // state: we just parse a zero (maybe with a leading minus sign)
2432  switch (get())
2433  {
2434  case '.':
2435  {
2436  add(decimal_point_char);
2437  goto scan_number_decimal1;
2438  }
2439 
2440  case 'e':
2441  case 'E':
2442  {
2443  add(current);
2444  goto scan_number_exponent;
2445  }
2446 
2447  default:
2448  goto scan_number_done;
2449  }
2450 
2451 scan_number_any1:
2452  // state: we just parsed a number 0-9 (maybe with a leading minus sign)
2453  switch (get())
2454  {
2455  case '0':
2456  case '1':
2457  case '2':
2458  case '3':
2459  case '4':
2460  case '5':
2461  case '6':
2462  case '7':
2463  case '8':
2464  case '9':
2465  {
2466  add(current);
2467  goto scan_number_any1;
2468  }
2469 
2470  case '.':
2471  {
2472  add(decimal_point_char);
2473  goto scan_number_decimal1;
2474  }
2475 
2476  case 'e':
2477  case 'E':
2478  {
2479  add(current);
2480  goto scan_number_exponent;
2481  }
2482 
2483  default:
2484  goto scan_number_done;
2485  }
2486 
2487 scan_number_decimal1:
2488  // state: we just parsed a decimal point
2489  number_type = token_type::value_float;
2490  switch (get())
2491  {
2492  case '0':
2493  case '1':
2494  case '2':
2495  case '3':
2496  case '4':
2497  case '5':
2498  case '6':
2499  case '7':
2500  case '8':
2501  case '9':
2502  {
2503  add(current);
2504  goto scan_number_decimal2;
2505  }
2506 
2507  default:
2508  {
2509  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after '.'";
2510  return token_type::parse_error;
2511  }
2512  }
2513 
2514 scan_number_decimal2:
2515  // we just parsed at least one number after a decimal point
2516  switch (get())
2517  {
2518  case '0':
2519  case '1':
2520  case '2':
2521  case '3':
2522  case '4':
2523  case '5':
2524  case '6':
2525  case '7':
2526  case '8':
2527  case '9':
2528  {
2529  add(current);
2530  goto scan_number_decimal2;
2531  }
2532 
2533  case 'e':
2534  case 'E':
2535  {
2536  add(current);
2537  goto scan_number_exponent;
2538  }
2539 
2540  default:
2541  goto scan_number_done;
2542  }
2543 
2544 scan_number_exponent:
2545  // we just parsed an exponent
2546  number_type = token_type::value_float;
2547  switch (get())
2548  {
2549  case '+':
2550  case '-':
2551  {
2552  add(current);
2553  goto scan_number_sign;
2554  }
2555 
2556  case '0':
2557  case '1':
2558  case '2':
2559  case '3':
2560  case '4':
2561  case '5':
2562  case '6':
2563  case '7':
2564  case '8':
2565  case '9':
2566  {
2567  add(current);
2568  goto scan_number_any2;
2569  }
2570 
2571  default:
2572  {
2573  error_message =
2574  "invalid number; expected '+', '-', or digit after exponent";
2575  return token_type::parse_error;
2576  }
2577  }
2578 
2579 scan_number_sign:
2580  // we just parsed an exponent sign
2581  switch (get())
2582  {
2583  case '0':
2584  case '1':
2585  case '2':
2586  case '3':
2587  case '4':
2588  case '5':
2589  case '6':
2590  case '7':
2591  case '8':
2592  case '9':
2593  {
2594  add(current);
2595  goto scan_number_any2;
2596  }
2597 
2598  default:
2599  {
2600  error_message = "invalid number; expected digit after exponent sign";
2601  return token_type::parse_error;
2602  }
2603  }
2604 
2605 scan_number_any2:
2606  // we just parsed a number after the exponent or exponent sign
2607  switch (get())
2608  {
2609  case '0':
2610  case '1':
2611  case '2':
2612  case '3':
2613  case '4':
2614  case '5':
2615  case '6':
2616  case '7':
2617  case '8':
2618  case '9':
2619  {
2620  add(current);
2621  goto scan_number_any2;
2622  }
2623 
2624  default:
2625  goto scan_number_done;
2626  }
2627 
2628 scan_number_done:
2629  // unget the character after the number (we only read it to know that
2630  // we are done scanning a number)
2631  --chars_read;
2632  next_unget = true;
2633 
2634  // terminate token
2635  add('\0');
2636  --yylen;
2637 
2638  char* endptr = nullptr;
2639  errno = 0;
2640 
2641  // try to parse integers first and fall back to floats
2642  if (number_type == token_type::value_unsigned)
2643  {
2644  const auto x = std::strtoull(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
2645 
2646  // we checked the number format before
2647  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
2648 
2649  if (errno == 0)
2650  {
2651  value_unsigned = static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(x);
2652  if (value_unsigned == x)
2653  {
2654  return token_type::value_unsigned;
2655  }
2656  }
2657  }
2658  else if (number_type == token_type::value_integer)
2659  {
2660  const auto x = std::strtoll(yytext.data(), &endptr, 10);
2661 
2662  // we checked the number format before
2663  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
2664 
2665  if (errno == 0)
2666  {
2667  value_integer = static_cast<number_integer_t>(x);
2668  if (value_integer == x)
2669  {
2670  return token_type::value_integer;
2671  }
2672  }
2673  }
2674 
2675  // this code is reached if we parse a floating-point number or if an
2676  // integer conversion above failed
2677  strtof(value_float, yytext.data(), &endptr);
2678 
2679  // we checked the number format before
2680  assert(endptr == yytext.data() + yylen);
2681 
2682  return token_type::value_float;
2683  }
2684 
2690  token_type scan_literal(const char* literal_text, const std::size_t length,
2691  token_type return_type)
2692  {
2693  assert(current == literal_text[0]);
2694  for (std::size_t i = 1; i < length; ++i)
2695  {
2696  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(get() != literal_text[i]))
2697  {
2698  error_message = "invalid literal";
2699  return token_type::parse_error;
2700  }
2701  }
2702  return return_type;
2703  }
2704 
2706  // input management
2708 
2710  void reset() noexcept
2711  {
2712  yylen = 0;
2713  start_pos = chars_read - 1;
2714  }
2715 
2717  int get()
2718  {
2719  ++chars_read;
2720  return next_unget ? (next_unget = false, current)
2721  : (current = ia->get_character());
2722  }
2723 
2725  void add(int c)
2726  {
2727  // resize yytext if necessary; this condition is deemed unlikely,
2728  // because we start with a 1024-byte buffer
2729  if (JSON_UNLIKELY((yylen + 1 > yytext.capacity())))
2730  {
2731  yytext.resize(2 * yytext.capacity(), '\0');
2732  }
2733  assert(yylen < yytext.size());
2734  yytext[yylen++] = static_cast<char>(c);
2735  }
2736 
2737  public:
2739  // value getters
2741 
2743  constexpr number_integer_t get_number_integer() const noexcept
2744  {
2745  return value_integer;
2746  }
2747 
2749  constexpr number_unsigned_t get_number_unsigned() const noexcept
2750  {
2751  return value_unsigned;
2752  }
2753 
2755  constexpr number_float_t get_number_float() const noexcept
2756  {
2757  return value_float;
2758  }
2759 
2761  const std::string get_string()
2762  {
2763  // yytext cannot be returned as char*, because it may contain a null
2764  // byte (parsed as "\u0000")
2765  return std::string(yytext.data(), yylen);
2766  }
2767 
2769  // diagnostics
2771 
2773  constexpr std::size_t get_position() const noexcept
2774  {
2775  return chars_read;
2776  }
2777 
2779  std::string get_token_string() const
2780  {
2781  // get the raw byte sequence of the last token
2782  std::string s = ia->read(start_pos, chars_read - start_pos);
2783 
2784  // escape control characters
2785  std::string result;
2786  for (auto c : s)
2787  {
2788  if (c == '\0' or c == std::char_traits<char>::eof())
2789  {
2790  // ignore EOF
2791  continue;
2792  }
2793  else if ('\x00' <= c and c <= '\x1f')
2794  {
2795  // escape control characters
2796  std::stringstream ss;
2797  ss << "<U+" << std::setw(4) << std::uppercase << std::setfill('0')
2798  << std::hex << static_cast<int>(c) << ">";
2799  result += ss.str();
2800  }
2801  else
2802  {
2803  // add character as is
2804  result.push_back(c);
2805  }
2806  }
2807 
2808  return result;
2809  }
2810 
2812  constexpr const char* get_error_message() const noexcept
2813  {
2814  return error_message;
2815  }
2816 
2818  // actual scanner
2820 
2821  token_type scan()
2822  {
2823  // read next character and ignore whitespace
2824  do
2825  {
2826  get();
2827  }
2828  while (current == ' ' or current == '\t' or current == '\n' or current == '\r');
2829 
2830  switch (current)
2831  {
2832  // structural characters
2833  case '[':
2834  return token_type::begin_array;
2835  case ']':
2836  return token_type::end_array;
2837  case '{':
2838  return token_type::begin_object;
2839  case '}':
2840  return token_type::end_object;
2841  case ':':
2842  return token_type::name_separator;
2843  case ',':
2844  return token_type::value_separator;
2845 
2846  // literals
2847  case 't':
2848  return scan_literal("true", 4, token_type::literal_true);
2849  case 'f':
2850  return scan_literal("false", 5, token_type::literal_false);
2851  case 'n':
2852  return scan_literal("null", 4, token_type::literal_null);
2853 
2854  // string
2855  case '\"':
2856  return scan_string();
2857 
2858  // number
2859  case '-':
2860  case '0':
2861  case '1':
2862  case '2':
2863  case '3':
2864  case '4':
2865  case '5':
2866  case '6':
2867  case '7':
2868  case '8':
2869  case '9':
2870  return scan_number();
2871 
2872  // end of input (the null byte is needed when parsing from
2873  // string literals)
2874  case '\0':
2875  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
2876  return token_type::end_of_input;
2877 
2878  // error
2879  default:
2880  error_message = "invalid literal";
2881  return token_type::parse_error;
2882  }
2883  }
2884 
2885  private:
2887  detail::input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
2888 
2890  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
2891 
2893  bool next_unget = false;
2894 
2896  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
2898  std::size_t start_pos = 0;
2899 
2901  std::vector<char> yytext = std::vector<char>(1024, '\0');
2903  std::size_t yylen = 0;
2904 
2906  const char* error_message = "";
2907 
2908  // number values
2909  number_integer_t value_integer = 0;
2910  number_unsigned_t value_unsigned = 0;
2911  number_float_t value_float = 0;
2912 
2914  const char decimal_point_char = '.';
2915 };
2916 
2922 template<typename BasicJsonType>
2923 class parser
2924 {
2925  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
2926  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
2927  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
2928  using lexer_t = lexer<BasicJsonType>;
2929  using token_type = typename lexer_t::token_type;
2930 
2931  public:
2932  enum class parse_event_t : uint8_t
2933  {
2935  object_start,
2937  object_end,
2939  array_start,
2941  array_end,
2943  key,
2945  value
2946  };
2947 
2948  using parser_callback_t =
2949  std::function<bool(int depth, parse_event_t event, BasicJsonType& parsed)>;
2950 
2952  explicit parser(detail::input_adapter_t adapter,
2953  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
2954  const bool allow_exceptions_ = true)
2955  : callback(cb), m_lexer(adapter), allow_exceptions(allow_exceptions_)
2956  {}
2957 
2968  void parse(const bool strict, BasicJsonType& result)
2969  {
2970  // read first token
2971  get_token();
2972 
2973  parse_internal(true, result);
2974  result.assert_invariant();
2975 
2976  // in strict mode, input must be completely read
2977  if (strict)
2978  {
2979  get_token();
2980  expect(token_type::end_of_input);
2981  }
2982 
2983  // in case of an error, return discarded value
2984  if (errored)
2985  {
2986  result = value_t::discarded;
2987  return;
2988  }
2989 
2990  // set top-level value to null if it was discarded by the callback
2991  // function
2992  if (result.is_discarded())
2993  {
2994  result = nullptr;
2995  }
2996  }
2997 
3004  bool accept(const bool strict = true)
3005  {
3006  // read first token
3007  get_token();
3008 
3009  if (not accept_internal())
3010  {
3011  return false;
3012  }
3013 
3014  // strict => last token must be EOF
3015  return not strict or (get_token() == token_type::end_of_input);
3016  }
3017 
3018  private:
3025  void parse_internal(bool keep, BasicJsonType& result)
3026  {
3027  // never parse after a parse error was detected
3028  assert(not errored);
3029 
3030  // start with a discarded value
3031  if (not result.is_discarded())
3032  {
3033  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3034  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3035  }
3036 
3037  switch (last_token)
3038  {
3039  case token_type::begin_object:
3040  {
3041  if (keep and (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::object_start, result)))))
3042  {
3043  // explicitly set result to object to cope with {}
3044  result.m_type = value_t::object;
3045  result.m_value = value_t::object;
3046  }
3047 
3048  // read next token
3049  get_token();
3050 
3051  // closing } -> we are done
3052  if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
3053  {
3054  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
3055  {
3056  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3057  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3058  }
3059  break;
3060  }
3061 
3062  // parse values
3063  std::string key;
3064  BasicJsonType value;
3065  while (true)
3066  {
3067  // store key
3068  if (not expect(token_type::value_string))
3069  {
3070  return;
3071  }
3072  key = m_lexer.get_string();
3073 
3074  bool keep_tag = false;
3075  if (keep)
3076  {
3077  if (callback)
3078  {
3079  BasicJsonType k(key);
3080  keep_tag = callback(depth, parse_event_t::key, k);
3081  }
3082  else
3083  {
3084  keep_tag = true;
3085  }
3086  }
3087 
3088  // parse separator (:)
3089  get_token();
3090  if (not expect(token_type::name_separator))
3091  {
3092  return;
3093  }
3094 
3095  // parse and add value
3096  get_token();
3097  value.m_value.destroy(value.m_type);
3098  value.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3099  parse_internal(keep, value);
3100 
3101  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(errored))
3102  {
3103  return;
3104  }
3105 
3106  if (keep and keep_tag and not value.is_discarded())
3107  {
3108  result.m_value.object->emplace(std::move(key), std::move(value));
3109  }
3110 
3111  // comma -> next value
3112  get_token();
3113  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3114  {
3115  get_token();
3116  continue;
3117  }
3118 
3119  // closing }
3120  if (not expect(token_type::end_object))
3121  {
3122  return;
3123  }
3124  break;
3125  }
3126 
3127  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::object_end, result))
3128  {
3129  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3130  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3131  }
3132  break;
3133  }
3134 
3135  case token_type::begin_array:
3136  {
3137  if (keep and (not callback or ((keep = callback(depth++, parse_event_t::array_start, result)))))
3138  {
3139  // explicitly set result to object to cope with []
3140  result.m_type = value_t::array;
3141  result.m_value = value_t::array;
3142  }
3143 
3144  // read next token
3145  get_token();
3146 
3147  // closing ] -> we are done
3148  if (last_token == token_type::end_array)
3149  {
3150  if (callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
3151  {
3152  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3153  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3154  }
3155  break;
3156  }
3157 
3158  // parse values
3159  BasicJsonType value;
3160  while (true)
3161  {
3162  // parse value
3163  value.m_value.destroy(value.m_type);
3164  value.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3165  parse_internal(keep, value);
3166 
3167  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(errored))
3168  {
3169  return;
3170  }
3171 
3172  if (keep and not value.is_discarded())
3173  {
3174  result.m_value.array->push_back(std::move(value));
3175  }
3176 
3177  // comma -> next value
3178  get_token();
3179  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3180  {
3181  get_token();
3182  continue;
3183  }
3184 
3185  // closing ]
3186  if (not expect(token_type::end_array))
3187  {
3188  return;
3189  }
3190  break;
3191  }
3192 
3193  if (keep and callback and not callback(--depth, parse_event_t::array_end, result))
3194  {
3195  result.m_value.destroy(result.m_type);
3196  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3197  }
3198  break;
3199  }
3200 
3201  case token_type::literal_null:
3202  {
3203  result.m_type = value_t::null;
3204  break;
3205  }
3206 
3207  case token_type::value_string:
3208  {
3209  result.m_type = value_t::string;
3210  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_string();
3211  break;
3212  }
3213 
3214  case token_type::literal_true:
3215  {
3216  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
3217  result.m_value = true;
3218  break;
3219  }
3220 
3221  case token_type::literal_false:
3222  {
3223  result.m_type = value_t::boolean;
3224  result.m_value = false;
3225  break;
3226  }
3227 
3228  case token_type::value_unsigned:
3229  {
3230  result.m_type = value_t::number_unsigned;
3231  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_unsigned();
3232  break;
3233  }
3234 
3235  case token_type::value_integer:
3236  {
3237  result.m_type = value_t::number_integer;
3238  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_integer();
3239  break;
3240  }
3241 
3242  case token_type::value_float:
3243  {
3244  result.m_type = value_t::number_float;
3245  result.m_value = m_lexer.get_number_float();
3246 
3247  // throw in case of infinity or NAN
3248  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not std::isfinite(result.m_value.number_float)))
3249  {
3250  if (allow_exceptions)
3251  {
3252  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(406, "number overflow parsing '" +
3253  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'"));
3254  }
3255  expect(token_type::uninitialized);
3256  }
3257  break;
3258  }
3259 
3260  case token_type::parse_error:
3261  {
3262  // using "uninitialized" to avoid "expected" message
3263  if (not expect(token_type::uninitialized))
3264  {
3265  return;
3266  }
3267  break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
3268  }
3269 
3270  default:
3271  {
3272  // the last token was unexpected; we expected a value
3273  if (not expect(token_type::literal_or_value))
3274  {
3275  return;
3276  }
3277  break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
3278  }
3279  }
3280 
3281  if (keep and callback and not callback(depth, parse_event_t::value, result))
3282  {
3283  result.m_type = value_t::discarded;
3284  }
3285  }
3286 
3297  bool accept_internal()
3298  {
3299  switch (last_token)
3300  {
3301  case token_type::begin_object:
3302  {
3303  // read next token
3304  get_token();
3305 
3306  // closing } -> we are done
3307  if (last_token == token_type::end_object)
3308  {
3309  return true;
3310  }
3311 
3312  // parse values
3313  while (true)
3314  {
3315  // parse key
3316  if (last_token != token_type::value_string)
3317  {
3318  return false;
3319  }
3320 
3321  // parse separator (:)
3322  get_token();
3323  if (last_token != token_type::name_separator)
3324  {
3325  return false;
3326  }
3327 
3328  // parse value
3329  get_token();
3330  if (not accept_internal())
3331  {
3332  return false;
3333  }
3334 
3335  // comma -> next value
3336  get_token();
3337  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3338  {
3339  get_token();
3340  continue;
3341  }
3342 
3343  // closing }
