3344  return (last_token == token_type::end_object);
3345  }
3346  }
3347 
3348  case token_type::begin_array:
3349  {
3350  // read next token
3351  get_token();
3352 
3353  // closing ] -> we are done
3354  if (last_token == token_type::end_array)
3355  {
3356  return true;
3357  }
3358 
3359  // parse values
3360  while (true)
3361  {
3362  // parse value
3363  if (not accept_internal())
3364  {
3365  return false;
3366  }
3367 
3368  // comma -> next value
3369  get_token();
3370  if (last_token == token_type::value_separator)
3371  {
3372  get_token();
3373  continue;
3374  }
3375 
3376  // closing ]
3377  return (last_token == token_type::end_array);
3378  }
3379  }
3380 
3381  case token_type::value_float:
3382  {
3383  // reject infinity or NAN
3384  return std::isfinite(m_lexer.get_number_float());
3385  }
3386 
3387  case token_type::literal_false:
3388  case token_type::literal_null:
3389  case token_type::literal_true:
3390  case token_type::value_integer:
3391  case token_type::value_string:
3392  case token_type::value_unsigned:
3393  return true;
3394 
3395  default: // the last token was unexpected
3396  return false;
3397  }
3398  }
3399 
3401  token_type get_token()
3402  {
3403  return (last_token = m_lexer.scan());
3404  }
3405 
3409  bool expect(token_type t)
3410  {
3411  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t != last_token))
3412  {
3413  errored = true;
3414  expected = t;
3415  if (allow_exceptions)
3416  {
3417  throw_exception();
3418  }
3419  else
3420  {
3421  return false;
3422  }
3423  }
3424 
3425  return true;
3426  }
3427 
3428  [[noreturn]] void throw_exception() const
3429  {
3430  std::string error_msg = "syntax error - ";
3431  if (last_token == token_type::parse_error)
3432  {
3433  error_msg += std::string(m_lexer.get_error_message()) + "; last read: '" +
3434  m_lexer.get_token_string() + "'";
3435  }
3436  else
3437  {
3438  error_msg += "unexpected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(last_token));
3439  }
3440 
3441  if (expected != token_type::uninitialized)
3442  {
3443  error_msg += "; expected " + std::string(lexer_t::token_type_name(expected));
3444  }
3445 
3446  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(101, m_lexer.get_position(), error_msg));
3447  }
3448 
3449  private:
3451  int depth = 0;
3453  const parser_callback_t callback = nullptr;
3455  token_type last_token = token_type::uninitialized;
3457  lexer_t m_lexer;
3459  bool errored = false;
3461  token_type expected = token_type::uninitialized;
3463  const bool allow_exceptions = true;
3464 };
3465 
3467 // iterators //
3469 
3479 class primitive_iterator_t
3480 {
3481  public:
3482  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
3483 
3484  constexpr difference_type get_value() const noexcept
3485  {
3486  return m_it;
3487  }
3488 
3490  void set_begin() noexcept
3491  {
3492  m_it = begin_value;
3493  }
3494 
3496  void set_end() noexcept
3497  {
3498  m_it = end_value;
3499  }
3500 
3502  constexpr bool is_begin() const noexcept
3503  {
3504  return m_it == begin_value;
3505  }
3506 
3508  constexpr bool is_end() const noexcept
3509  {
3510  return m_it == end_value;
3511  }
3512 
3513  friend constexpr bool operator==(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3514  {
3515  return lhs.m_it == rhs.m_it;
3516  }
3517 
3518  friend constexpr bool operator<(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3519  {
3520  return lhs.m_it < rhs.m_it;
3521  }
3522 
3523  primitive_iterator_t operator+(difference_type i)
3524  {
3525  auto result = *this;
3526  result += i;
3527  return result;
3528  }
3529 
3530  friend constexpr difference_type operator-(primitive_iterator_t lhs, primitive_iterator_t rhs) noexcept
3531  {
3532  return lhs.m_it - rhs.m_it;
3533  }
3534 
3535  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& os, primitive_iterator_t it)
3536  {
3537  return os << it.m_it;
3538  }
3539 
3540  primitive_iterator_t& operator++()
3541  {
3542  ++m_it;
3543  return *this;
3544  }
3545 
3546  primitive_iterator_t operator++(int)
3547  {
3548  auto result = *this;
3549  m_it++;
3550  return result;
3551  }
3552 
3553  primitive_iterator_t& operator--()
3554  {
3555  --m_it;
3556  return *this;
3557  }
3558 
3559  primitive_iterator_t operator--(int)
3560  {
3561  auto result = *this;
3562  m_it--;
3563  return result;
3564  }
3565 
3566  primitive_iterator_t& operator+=(difference_type n)
3567  {
3568  m_it += n;
3569  return *this;
3570  }
3571 
3572  primitive_iterator_t& operator-=(difference_type n)
3573  {
3574  m_it -= n;
3575  return *this;
3576  }
3577 
3578  private:
3579  static constexpr difference_type begin_value = 0;
3580  static constexpr difference_type end_value = begin_value + 1;
3581 
3583  difference_type m_it = std::numeric_limits<std::ptrdiff_t>::min();
3584 };
3585 
3592 template<typename BasicJsonType> struct internal_iterator
3593 {
3595  typename BasicJsonType::object_t::iterator object_iterator {};
3597  typename BasicJsonType::array_t::iterator array_iterator {};
3599  primitive_iterator_t primitive_iterator {};
3600 };
3601 
3602 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy;
3603 
3623 template<typename BasicJsonType>
3624 class iter_impl : public std::iterator<std::random_access_iterator_tag, BasicJsonType>
3625 {
3627  friend iter_impl<typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value, typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type, const BasicJsonType>::type>;
3628  friend BasicJsonType;
3629  friend iteration_proxy<iter_impl>;
3630 
3631  using object_t = typename BasicJsonType::object_t;
3632  using array_t = typename BasicJsonType::array_t;
3633  // make sure BasicJsonType is basic_json or const basic_json
3634  static_assert(is_basic_json<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>::value,
3635  "iter_impl only accepts (const) basic_json");
3636 
3637  public:
3639  using value_type = typename BasicJsonType::value_type;
3641  using difference_type = typename BasicJsonType::difference_type;
3643  using pointer = typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
3644  typename BasicJsonType::const_pointer,
3645  typename BasicJsonType::pointer>::type;
3647  using reference =
3648  typename std::conditional<std::is_const<BasicJsonType>::value,
3649  typename BasicJsonType::const_reference,
3650  typename BasicJsonType::reference>::type;
3652  using iterator_category = std::bidirectional_iterator_tag;
3653 
3655  iter_impl() = default;
3656 
3663  explicit iter_impl(pointer object) noexcept : m_object(object)
3664  {
3665  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3666 
3667  switch (m_object->m_type)
3668  {
3669  case value_t::object:
3670  {
3671  m_it.object_iterator = typename object_t::iterator();
3672  break;
3673  }
3674 
3675  case value_t::array:
3676  {
3677  m_it.array_iterator = typename array_t::iterator();
3678  break;
3679  }
3680 
3681  default:
3682  {
3683  m_it.primitive_iterator = primitive_iterator_t();
3684  break;
3685  }
3686  }
3687  }
3688 
3703  iter_impl(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
3704  : m_object(other.m_object), m_it(other.m_it) {}
3705 
3712  iter_impl& operator=(const iter_impl<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type>& other) noexcept
3713  {
3714  m_object = other.m_object;
3715  m_it = other.m_it;
3716  return *this;
3717  }
3718 
3719  private:
3724  void set_begin() noexcept
3725  {
3726  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3727 
3728  switch (m_object->m_type)
3729  {
3730  case value_t::object:
3731  {
3732  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->begin();
3733  break;
3734  }
3735 
3736  case value_t::array:
3737  {
3738  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->begin();
3739  break;
3740  }
3741 
3742  case value_t::null:
3743  {
3744  // set to end so begin()==end() is true: null is empty
3745  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
3746  break;
3747  }
3748 
3749  default:
3750  {
3751  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_begin();
3752  break;
3753  }
3754  }
3755  }
3756 
3761  void set_end() noexcept
3762  {
3763  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3764 
3765  switch (m_object->m_type)
3766  {
3767  case value_t::object:
3768  {
3769  m_it.object_iterator = m_object->m_value.object->end();
3770  break;
3771  }
3772 
3773  case value_t::array:
3774  {
3775  m_it.array_iterator = m_object->m_value.array->end();
3776  break;
3777  }
3778 
3779  default:
3780  {
3781  m_it.primitive_iterator.set_end();
3782  break;
3783  }
3784  }
3785  }
3786 
3787  public:
3792  reference operator*() const
3793  {
3794  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3795 
3796  switch (m_object->m_type)
3797  {
3798  case value_t::object:
3799  {
3800  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
3801  return m_it.object_iterator->second;
3802  }
3803 
3804  case value_t::array:
3805  {
3806  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
3807  return *m_it.array_iterator;
3808  }
3809 
3810  case value_t::null:
3811  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3812 
3813  default:
3814  {
3815  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
3816  {
3817  return *m_object;
3818  }
3819 
3820  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3821  }
3822  }
3823  }
3824 
3829  pointer operator->() const
3830  {
3831  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3832 
3833  switch (m_object->m_type)
3834  {
3835  case value_t::object:
3836  {
3837  assert(m_it.object_iterator != m_object->m_value.object->end());
3838  return &(m_it.object_iterator->second);
3839  }
3840 
3841  case value_t::array:
3842  {
3843  assert(m_it.array_iterator != m_object->m_value.array->end());
3844  return &*m_it.array_iterator;
3845  }
3846 
3847  default:
3848  {
3849  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
3850  {
3851  return m_object;
3852  }
3853 
3854  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
3855  }
3856  }
3857  }
3858 
3863  iter_impl operator++(int)
3864  {
3865  auto result = *this;
3866  ++(*this);
3867  return result;
3868  }
3869 
3874  iter_impl& operator++()
3875  {
3876  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3877 
3878  switch (m_object->m_type)
3879  {
3880  case value_t::object:
3881  {
3882  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, 1);
3883  break;
3884  }
3885 
3886  case value_t::array:
3887  {
3888  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, 1);
3889  break;
3890  }
3891 
3892  default:
3893  {
3894  ++m_it.primitive_iterator;
3895  break;
3896  }
3897  }
3898 
3899  return *this;
3900  }
3901 
3906  iter_impl operator--(int)
3907  {
3908  auto result = *this;
3909  --(*this);
3910  return result;
3911  }
3912 
3917  iter_impl& operator--()
3918  {
3919  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3920 
3921  switch (m_object->m_type)
3922  {
3923  case value_t::object:
3924  {
3925  std::advance(m_it.object_iterator, -1);
3926  break;
3927  }
3928 
3929  case value_t::array:
3930  {
3931  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, -1);
3932  break;
3933  }
3934 
3935  default:
3936  {
3937  --m_it.primitive_iterator;
3938  break;
3939  }
3940  }
3941 
3942  return *this;
3943  }
3944 
3949  bool operator==(const iter_impl& other) const
3950  {
3951  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
3952  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
3953  {
3954  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
3955  }
3956 
3957  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3958 
3959  switch (m_object->m_type)
3960  {
3961  case value_t::object:
3962  return (m_it.object_iterator == other.m_it.object_iterator);
3963 
3964  case value_t::array:
3965  return (m_it.array_iterator == other.m_it.array_iterator);
3966 
3967  default:
3968  return (m_it.primitive_iterator == other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
3969  }
3970  }
3971 
3976  bool operator!=(const iter_impl& other) const
3977  {
3978  return not operator==(other);
3979  }
3980 
3985  bool operator<(const iter_impl& other) const
3986  {
3987  // if objects are not the same, the comparison is undefined
3988  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(m_object != other.m_object))
3989  {
3990  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(212, "cannot compare iterators of different containers"));
3991  }
3992 
3993  assert(m_object != nullptr);
3994 
3995  switch (m_object->m_type)
3996  {
3997  case value_t::object:
3998  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(213, "cannot compare order of object iterators"));
3999 
4000  case value_t::array:
4001  return (m_it.array_iterator < other.m_it.array_iterator);
4002 
4003  default:
4004  return (m_it.primitive_iterator < other.m_it.primitive_iterator);
4005  }
4006  }
4007 
4012  bool operator<=(const iter_impl& other) const
4013  {
4014  return not other.operator < (*this);
4015  }
4016 
4021  bool operator>(const iter_impl& other) const
4022  {
4023  return not operator<=(other);
4024  }
4025 
4030  bool operator>=(const iter_impl& other) const
4031  {
4032  return not operator<(other);
4033  }
4034 
4039  iter_impl& operator+=(difference_type i)
4040  {
4041  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4042 
4043  switch (m_object->m_type)
4044  {
4045  case value_t::object:
4046  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
4047 
4048  case value_t::array:
4049  {
4050  std::advance(m_it.array_iterator, i);
4051  break;
4052  }
4053 
4054  default:
4055  {
4056  m_it.primitive_iterator += i;
4057  break;
4058  }
4059  }
4060 
4061  return *this;
4062  }
4063 
4068  iter_impl& operator-=(difference_type i)
4069  {
4070  return operator+=(-i);
4071  }
4072 
4077  iter_impl operator+(difference_type i) const
4078  {
4079  auto result = *this;
4080  result += i;
4081  return result;
4082  }
4083 
4088  friend iter_impl operator+(difference_type i, const iter_impl& it)
4089  {
4090  auto result = it;
4091  result += i;
4092  return result;
4093  }
4094 
4099  iter_impl operator-(difference_type i) const
4100  {
4101  auto result = *this;
4102  result -= i;
4103  return result;
4104  }
4105 
4110  difference_type operator-(const iter_impl& other) const
4111  {
4112  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4113 
4114  switch (m_object->m_type)
4115  {
4116  case value_t::object:
4117  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(209, "cannot use offsets with object iterators"));
4118 
4119  case value_t::array:
4120  return m_it.array_iterator - other.m_it.array_iterator;
4121 
4122  default:
4123  return m_it.primitive_iterator - other.m_it.primitive_iterator;
4124  }
4125  }
4126 
4131  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
4132  {
4133  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4134 
4135  switch (m_object->m_type)
4136  {
4137  case value_t::object:
4138  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(208, "cannot use operator[] for object iterators"));
4139 
4140  case value_t::array:
4141  return *std::next(m_it.array_iterator, n);
4142 
4143  case value_t::null:
4144  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
4145 
4146  default:
4147  {
4148  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_it.primitive_iterator.get_value() == -n))
4149  {
4150  return *m_object;
4151  }
4152 
4153  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(214, "cannot get value"));
4154  }
4155  }
4156  }
4157 
4162  typename object_t::key_type key() const
4163  {
4164  assert(m_object != nullptr);
4165 
4166  if (JSON_LIKELY(m_object->is_object()))
4167  {
4168  return m_it.object_iterator->first;
4169  }
4170 
4171  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(207, "cannot use key() for non-object iterators"));
4172  }
4173 
4178  reference value() const
4179  {
4180  return operator*();
4181  }
4182 
4183  private:
4185  pointer m_object = nullptr;
4187  internal_iterator<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type> m_it = {};
4188 };
4189 
4191 template<typename IteratorType> class iteration_proxy
4192 {
4193  private:
4195  class iteration_proxy_internal
4196  {
4197  private:
4199  IteratorType anchor;
4201  std::size_t array_index = 0;
4202 
4203  public:
4204  explicit iteration_proxy_internal(IteratorType it) noexcept : anchor(it) {}
4205 
4207  iteration_proxy_internal& operator*()
4208  {
4209  return *this;
4210  }
4211 
4213  iteration_proxy_internal& operator++()
4214  {
4215  ++anchor;
4216  ++array_index;
4217 
4218  return *this;
4219  }
4220 
4222  bool operator!=(const iteration_proxy_internal& o) const noexcept
4223  {
4224  return anchor != o.anchor;
4225  }
4226 
4228  std::string key() const
4229  {
4230  assert(anchor.m_object != nullptr);
4231 
4232  switch (anchor.m_object->type())
4233  {
4234  // use integer array index as key
4235  case value_t::array:
4236  return std::to_string(array_index);
4237 
4238  // use key from the object
4239  case value_t::object:
4240  return anchor.key();
4241 
4242  // use an empty key for all primitive types
4243  default:
4244  return "";
4245  }
4246  }
4247 
4249  typename IteratorType::reference value() const
4250  {
4251  return anchor.value();
4252  }
4253  };
4254 
4256  typename IteratorType::reference container;
4257 
4258  public:
4260  explicit iteration_proxy(typename IteratorType::reference cont)
4261  : container(cont) {}
4262 
4264  iteration_proxy_internal begin() noexcept
4265  {
4266  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.begin());
4267  }
4268 
4270  iteration_proxy_internal end() noexcept
4271  {
4272  return iteration_proxy_internal(container.end());
4273  }
4274 };
4275 
4294 template<typename Base>
4295 class json_reverse_iterator : public std::reverse_iterator<Base>
4296 {
4297  public:
4298  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
4300  using base_iterator = std::reverse_iterator<Base>;
4302  using reference = typename Base::reference;
4303 
4305  json_reverse_iterator(const typename base_iterator::iterator_type& it) noexcept
4306  : base_iterator(it) {}
4307 
4309  json_reverse_iterator(const base_iterator& it) noexcept : base_iterator(it) {}
4310 
4312  json_reverse_iterator operator++(int)
4313  {
4314  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator++(1));
4315  }
4316 
4318  json_reverse_iterator& operator++()
4319  {
4320  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator++());
4321  }
4322 
4324  json_reverse_iterator operator--(int)
4325  {
4326  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator--(1));
4327  }
4328 
4330  json_reverse_iterator& operator--()
4331  {
4332  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator--());
4333  }
4334 
4336  json_reverse_iterator& operator+=(difference_type i)
4337  {
4338  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator&>(base_iterator::operator+=(i));
4339  }
4340 
4342  json_reverse_iterator operator+(difference_type i) const
4343  {
4344  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator+(i));
4345  }
4346 
4348  json_reverse_iterator operator-(difference_type i) const
4349  {
4350  return static_cast<json_reverse_iterator>(base_iterator::operator-(i));
4351  }
4352 
4354  difference_type operator-(const json_reverse_iterator& other) const
4355  {
4356  return base_iterator(*this) - base_iterator(other);
4357  }
4358 
4360  reference operator[](difference_type n) const
4361  {
4362  return *(this->operator+(n));
4363  }
4364 
4366  auto key() const -> decltype(std::declval<Base>().key())
4367  {
4368  auto it = --this->base();
4369  return it.key();
4370  }
4371 
4373  reference value() const
4374  {
4375  auto it = --this->base();
4376  return it.operator * ();
4377  }
4378 };
4379 
4381 // output adapters //
4383 
4385 template<typename CharType> struct output_adapter_protocol
4386 {
4387  virtual void write_character(CharType c) = 0;
4388  virtual void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) = 0;
4389  virtual ~output_adapter_protocol() = default;
4390 };
4391 
4393 template<typename CharType>
4394 using output_adapter_t = std::shared_ptr<output_adapter_protocol<CharType>>;
4395 
4397 template<typename CharType>
4398 class output_vector_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4399 {
4400  public:
4401  explicit output_vector_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec) : v(vec) {}
4402 
4403  void write_character(CharType c) override
4404  {
4405  v.push_back(c);
4406  }
4407 
4408  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4409  {
4410  std::copy(s, s + length, std::back_inserter(v));
4411  }
4412 
4413  private:
4414  std::vector<CharType>& v;
4415 };
4416 
4418 template<typename CharType>
4419 class output_stream_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4420 {
4421  public:
4422  explicit output_stream_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s) : stream(s) {}
4423 
4424  void write_character(CharType c) override
4425  {
4426  stream.put(c);
4427  }
4428 
4429  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4430  {
4431  stream.write(s, static_cast<std::streamsize>(length));
4432  }
4433 
4434  private:
4435  std::basic_ostream<CharType>& stream;
4436 };
4437 
4439 template<typename CharType>
4440 class output_string_adapter : public output_adapter_protocol<CharType>
4441 {
4442  public:
4443  explicit output_string_adapter(std::basic_string<CharType>& s) : str(s) {}
4444 
4445  void write_character(CharType c) override
4446  {
4447  str.push_back(c);
4448  }
4449 
4450  void write_characters(const CharType* s, std::size_t length) override
4451  {
4452  str.append(s, length);
4453  }
4454 
4455  private:
4456  std::basic_string<CharType>& str;
4457 };
4458 
4459 template<typename CharType>
4460 class output_adapter
4461 {
4462  public:
4463  output_adapter(std::vector<CharType>& vec)
4464  : oa(std::make_shared<output_vector_adapter<CharType>>(vec)) {}
4465 
4466  output_adapter(std::basic_ostream<CharType>& s)
4467  : oa(std::make_shared<output_stream_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
4468 
4469  output_adapter(std::basic_string<CharType>& s)
4470  : oa(std::make_shared<output_string_adapter<CharType>>(s)) {}
4471 
4472  operator output_adapter_t<CharType>()
4473  {
4474  return oa;
4475  }
4476 
4477  private:
4478  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
4479 };
4480 
4482 // binary reader and writer //
4484 
4488 template<typename BasicJsonType>
4489 class binary_reader
4490 {
4491  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
4492  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
4493 
4494  public:
4500  explicit binary_reader(input_adapter_t adapter) : ia(std::move(adapter))
4501  {
4502  assert(ia);
4503  }
4504 
4515  BasicJsonType parse_cbor(const bool strict)
4516  {
4517  const auto res = parse_cbor_internal();
4518  if (strict)
4519  {
4520  get();
4521  check_eof(true);
4522  }
4523  return res;
4524  }
4525 
4536  BasicJsonType parse_msgpack(const bool strict)
4537  {
4538  const auto res = parse_msgpack_internal();
4539  if (strict)
4540  {
4541  get();
4542  check_eof(true);
4543  }
4544  return res;
4545  }
4546 
4554  static constexpr bool little_endianess(int num = 1) noexcept
4555  {
4556  return (*reinterpret_cast<char*>(&num) == 1);
4557  }
4558 
4559  private:
4565  BasicJsonType parse_cbor_internal(const bool get_char = true)
4566  {
4567  switch (get_char ? get() : current)
4568  {
4569  // EOF
4570  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
4571  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
4572 
4573  // Integer 0x00..0x17 (0..23)
4574  case 0x00:
4575  case 0x01:
4576  case 0x02:
4577  case 0x03:
4578  case 0x04:
4579  case 0x05:
4580  case 0x06:
4581  case 0x07:
4582  case 0x08:
4583  case 0x09:
4584  case 0x0a:
4585  case 0x0b:
4586  case 0x0c:
4587  case 0x0d:
4588  case 0x0e:
4589  case 0x0f:
4590  case 0x10:
4591  case 0x11:
4592  case 0x12:
4593  case 0x13:
4594  case 0x14:
4595  case 0x15:
4596  case 0x16:
4597  case 0x17:
4598  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
4599 
4600  case 0x18: // Unsigned integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
4601  return get_number<uint8_t>();
4602 
4603  case 0x19: // Unsigned integer (two-byte uint16_t follows)
4604  return get_number<uint16_t>();
4605 
4606  case 0x1a: // Unsigned integer (four-byte uint32_t follows)
4607  return get_number<uint32_t>();
4608 
4609  case 0x1b: // Unsigned integer (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
4610  return get_number<uint64_t>();
4611 
4612  // Negative integer -1-0x00..-1-0x17 (-1..-24)
4613  case 0x20:
4614  case 0x21:
4615  case 0x22:
4616  case 0x23:
4617  case 0x24:
4618  case 0x25:
4619  case 0x26:
4620  case 0x27:
4621  case 0x28:
4622  case 0x29:
4623  case 0x2a:
4624  case 0x2b:
4625  case 0x2c:
4626  case 0x2d:
4627  case 0x2e:
4628  case 0x2f:
4629  case 0x30:
4630  case 0x31:
4631  case 0x32:
4632  case 0x33:
4633  case 0x34:
4634  case 0x35:
4635  case 0x36:
4636  case 0x37:
4637  return static_cast<int8_t>(0x20 - 1 - current);
4638 
4639  case 0x38: // Negative integer (one-byte uint8_t follows)
4640  {
4641  // must be uint8_t !
4642  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint8_t>();
4643  }
4644 
4645  case 0x39: // Negative integer -1-n (two-byte uint16_t follows)
4646  {
4647  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint16_t>();
4648  }
4649 
4650  case 0x3a: // Negative integer -1-n (four-byte uint32_t follows)
4651  {
4652  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) - get_number<uint32_t>();
4653  }
4654 
4655  case 0x3b: // Negative integer -1-n (eight-byte uint64_t follows)
4656  {
4657  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(-1) -
4658  static_cast<number_integer_t>(get_number<uint64_t>());
4659  }
4660 
4661  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
4662  case 0x60:
4663  case 0x61:
4664  case 0x62:
4665  case 0x63:
4666  case 0x64:
4667  case 0x65:
4668  case 0x66:
4669  case 0x67:
4670  case 0x68:
4671  case 0x69:
4672  case 0x6a:
4673  case 0x6b:
4674  case 0x6c:
4675  case 0x6d:
4676  case 0x6e:
4677  case 0x6f:
4678  case 0x70:
4679  case 0x71:
4680  case 0x72:
4681  case 0x73:
4682  case 0x74:
4683  case 0x75:
4684  case 0x76:
4685  case 0x77:
4686  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4687  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4688  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4689  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4690  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
4691  {
4692  return get_cbor_string();
4693  }
4694 
4695  // array (0x00..0x17 data items follow)
4696  case 0x80:
4697  case 0x81:
4698  case 0x82:
4699  case 0x83:
4700  case 0x84:
4701  case 0x85:
4702  case 0x86:
4703  case 0x87:
4704  case 0x88:
4705  case 0x89:
4706  case 0x8a:
4707  case 0x8b:
4708  case 0x8c:
4709  case 0x8d:
4710  case 0x8e:
4711  case 0x8f:
4712  case 0x90:
4713  case 0x91:
4714  case 0x92:
4715  case 0x93:
4716  case 0x94:
4717  case 0x95:
4718  case 0x96:
4719  case 0x97:
4720  {
4721  return get_cbor_array(current & 0x1f);
4722  }
4723 
4724  case 0x98: // array (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4725  {
4726  return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint8_t>());
4727  }
4728 
4729  case 0x99: // array (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4730  {
4731  return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint16_t>());
4732  }
4733 
4734  case 0x9a: // array (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4735  {
4736  return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint32_t>());
4737  }
4738 
4739  case 0x9b: // array (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4740  {
4741  return get_cbor_array(get_number<uint64_t>());
4742  }
4743 
4744  case 0x9f: // array (indefinite length)
4745  {
4746  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
4747  while (get() != 0xff)
4748  {
4749  result.push_back(parse_cbor_internal(false));
4750  }
4751  return result;
4752  }
4753 
4754  // map (0x00..0x17 pairs of data items follow)
4755  case 0xa0:
4756  case 0xa1:
4757  case 0xa2:
4758  case 0xa3:
4759  case 0xa4:
4760  case 0xa5:
4761  case 0xa6:
4762  case 0xa7:
4763  case 0xa8:
4764  case 0xa9:
4765  case 0xaa:
4766  case 0xab:
4767  case 0xac:
4768  case 0xad:
4769  case 0xae:
4770  case 0xaf:
4771  case 0xb0:
4772  case 0xb1:
4773  case 0xb2:
4774  case 0xb3:
4775  case 0xb4:
4776  case 0xb5:
4777  case 0xb6:
4778  case 0xb7:
4779  {
4780  return get_cbor_object(current & 0x1f);
4781  }
4782 
4783  case 0xb8: // map (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
4784  {
4785  return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint8_t>());
4786  }
4787 
4788  case 0xb9: // map (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
4789  {
4790  return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint16_t>());
4791  }
4792 
4793  case 0xba: // map (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
4794  {
4795  return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint32_t>());
4796  }
4797 
4798  case 0xbb: // map (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
4799  {
4800  return get_cbor_object(get_number<uint64_t>());
4801  }
4802 
4803  case 0xbf: // map (indefinite length)
4804  {
4805  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
4806  while (get() != 0xff)
4807  {
4808  auto key = get_cbor_string();
4809  result[key] = parse_cbor_internal();
4810  }
4811  return result;
4812  }
4813 
4814  case 0xf4: // false
4815  {
4816  return false;
4817  }
4818 
4819  case 0xf5: // true
4820  {
4821  return true;
4822  }
4823 
4824  case 0xf6: // null
4825  {
4826  return value_t::null;
4827  }
4828 
4829  case 0xf9: // Half-Precision Float (two-byte IEEE 754)
4830  {
4831  const int byte1 = get();
4832  check_eof();
4833  const int byte2 = get();
4834  check_eof();
4835 
4836  // code from RFC 7049, Appendix D, Figure 3:
4837  // As half-precision floating-point numbers were only added
4838  // to IEEE 754 in 2008, today's programming platforms often
4839  // still only have limited support for them. It is very
4840  // easy to include at least decoding support for them even
4841  // without such support. An example of a small decoder for
4842  // half-precision floating-point numbers in the C language
4843  // is shown in Fig. 3.
4844  const int half = (byte1 << 8) + byte2;
4845  const int exp = (half >> 10) & 0x1f;
4846  const int mant = half & 0x3ff;
4847  double val;
4848  if (exp == 0)
4849  {
4850  val = std::ldexp(mant, -24);
4851  }
4852  else if (exp != 31)
4853  {
4854  val = std::ldexp(mant + 1024, exp - 25);
4855  }
4856  else
4857  {
4858  val = (mant == 0) ? std::numeric_limits<double>::infinity()
4859  : std::numeric_limits<double>::quiet_NaN();
4860  }
4861  return (half & 0x8000) != 0 ? -val : val;
4862  }
4863 
4864  case 0xfa: // Single-Precision Float (four-byte IEEE 754)
4865  {
4866  return get_number<float>();
4867  }
4868 
4869  case 0xfb: // Double-Precision Float (eight-byte IEEE 754)
4870  {
4871  return get_number<double>();
4872  }
4873 
4874  default: // anything else (0xFF is handled inside the other types)
4875  {
4876  std::stringstream ss;
4877  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
4878  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read, "error reading CBOR; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
4879  }
4880  }
4881  }
4882 
4883  BasicJsonType parse_msgpack_internal()
4884  {
4885  switch (get())
4886  {
4887  // EOF
4888  case std::char_traits<char>::eof():
4889  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
4890 
4891  // positive fixint
4892  case 0x00:
4893  case 0x01:
4894  case 0x02:
4895  case 0x03:
4896  case 0x04:
4897  case 0x05:
4898  case 0x06:
4899  case 0x07:
4900  case 0x08:
4901  case 0x09:
4902  case 0x0a:
4903  case 0x0b:
4904  case 0x0c:
4905  case 0x0d:
4906  case 0x0e:
4907  case 0x0f:
4908  case 0x10:
4909  case 0x11:
4910  case 0x12:
4911  case 0x13:
4912  case 0x14:
4913  case 0x15:
4914  case 0x16:
4915  case 0x17:
4916  case 0x18:
4917  case 0x19:
4918  case 0x1a:
4919  case 0x1b:
4920  case 0x1c:
4921  case 0x1d:
4922  case 0x1e:
4923  case 0x1f:
4924  case 0x20:
4925  case 0x21:
4926  case 0x22:
4927  case 0x23:
4928  case 0x24:
4929  case 0x25:
4930  case 0x26:
4931  case 0x27:
4932  case 0x28:
4933  case 0x29:
4934  case 0x2a:
4935  case 0x2b:
4936  case 0x2c:
4937  case 0x2d:
4938  case 0x2e:
4939  case 0x2f:
4940  case 0x30:
4941  case 0x31:
4942  case 0x32:
4943  case 0x33:
4944  case 0x34:
4945  case 0x35:
4946  case 0x36:
4947  case 0x37:
4948  case 0x38:
4949  case 0x39:
4950  case 0x3a:
4951  case 0x3b:
4952  case 0x3c:
4953  case 0x3d:
4954  case 0x3e:
4955  case 0x3f:
4956  case 0x40:
4957  case 0x41:
4958  case 0x42:
4959  case 0x43:
4960  case 0x44:
4961  case 0x45:
4962  case 0x46:
4963  case 0x47:
4964  case 0x48:
4965  case 0x49:
4966  case 0x4a:
4967  case 0x4b:
4968  case 0x4c:
4969  case 0x4d:
4970  case 0x4e:
4971  case 0x4f:
4972  case 0x50:
4973  case 0x51:
4974  case 0x52:
4975  case 0x53:
4976  case 0x54:
4977  case 0x55:
4978  case 0x56:
4979  case 0x57:
4980  case 0x58:
4981  case 0x59:
4982  case 0x5a:
4983  case 0x5b:
4984  case 0x5c:
4985  case 0x5d:
4986  case 0x5e:
4987  case 0x5f:
4988  case 0x60:
4989  case 0x61:
4990  case 0x62:
4991  case 0x63:
4992  case 0x64:
4993  case 0x65:
4994  case 0x66:
4995  case 0x67:
4996  case 0x68:
4997  case 0x69:
4998  case 0x6a:
4999  case 0x6b:
5000  case 0x6c:
5001  case 0x6d:
5002  case 0x6e:
5003  case 0x6f:
5004  case 0x70:
5005  case 0x71:
5006  case 0x72:
5007  case 0x73:
5008  case 0x74:
5009  case 0x75:
5010  case 0x76:
5011  case 0x77:
5012  case 0x78:
5013  case 0x79:
5014  case 0x7a:
5015  case 0x7b:
5016  case 0x7c:
5017  case 0x7d:
5018  case 0x7e:
5019  case 0x7f:
5020  return static_cast<number_unsigned_t>(current);
5021 
5022  // fixmap
5023  case 0x80:
5024  case 0x81:
5025  case 0x82:
5026  case 0x83:
5027  case 0x84:
5028  case 0x85:
5029  case 0x86:
5030  case 0x87:
5031  case 0x88:
5032  case 0x89:
5033  case 0x8a:
5034  case 0x8b:
5035  case 0x8c:
5036  case 0x8d:
5037  case 0x8e:
5038  case 0x8f:
5039  {
5040  return get_msgpack_object(current & 0x0f);
5041  }
5042 
5043  // fixarray
5044  case 0x90:
5045  case 0x91:
5046  case 0x92:
5047  case 0x93:
5048  case 0x94:
5049  case 0x95:
5050  case 0x96:
5051  case 0x97:
5052  case 0x98:
5053  case 0x99:
5054  case 0x9a:
5055  case 0x9b:
5056  case 0x9c:
5057  case 0x9d:
5058  case 0x9e:
5059  case 0x9f:
5060  {
5061  return get_msgpack_array(current & 0x0f);
5062  }
5063 
5064  // fixstr
5065  case 0xa0:
5066  case 0xa1:
5067  case 0xa2:
5068  case 0xa3:
5069  case 0xa4:
5070  case 0xa5:
5071  case 0xa6:
5072  case 0xa7:
5073  case 0xa8:
5074  case 0xa9:
5075  case 0xaa:
5076  case 0xab:
5077  case 0xac:
5078  case 0xad:
5079  case 0xae:
5080  case 0xaf:
5081  case 0xb0:
5082  case 0xb1:
5083  case 0xb2:
5084  case 0xb3:
5085  case 0xb4:
5086  case 0xb5:
5087  case 0xb6:
5088  case 0xb7:
5089  case 0xb8:
5090  case 0xb9:
5091  case 0xba:
5092  case 0xbb:
5093  case 0xbc:
5094  case 0xbd:
5095  case 0xbe:
5096  case 0xbf:
5097  return get_msgpack_string();
5098 
5099  case 0xc0: // nil
5100  return value_t::null;
5101 
5102  case 0xc2: // false
5103  return false;
5104 
5105  case 0xc3: // true
5106  return true;
5107 
5108  case 0xca: // float 32
5109  return get_number<float>();
5110 
5111  case 0xcb: // float 64
5112  return get_number<double>();
5113 
5114  case 0xcc: // uint 8
5115  return get_number<uint8_t>();
5116 
5117  case 0xcd: // uint 16
5118  return get_number<uint16_t>();
5119 
5120  case 0xce: // uint 32
5121  return get_number<uint32_t>();
5122 
5123  case 0xcf: // uint 64
5124  return get_number<uint64_t>();
5125 
5126  case 0xd0: // int 8
5127  return get_number<int8_t>();
5128 
5129  case 0xd1: // int 16
5130  return get_number<int16_t>();
5131 
5132  case 0xd2: // int 32
5133  return get_number<int32_t>();
5134 
5135  case 0xd3: // int 64
5136  return get_number<int64_t>();
5137 
5138  case 0xd9: // str 8
5139  case 0xda: // str 16
5140  case 0xdb: // str 32
5141  return get_msgpack_string();
5142 
5143  case 0xdc: // array 16
5144  {
5145  return get_msgpack_array(get_number<uint16_t>());
5146  }
5147 
5148  case 0xdd: // array 32
5149  {
5150  return get_msgpack_array(get_number<uint32_t>());
5151  }
5152 
5153  case 0xde: // map 16
5154  {
5155  return get_msgpack_object(get_number<uint16_t>());
5156  }
5157 
5158  case 0xdf: // map 32
5159  {
5160  return get_msgpack_object(get_number<uint32_t>());
5161  }
5162 
5163  // positive fixint
5164  case 0xe0:
5165  case 0xe1:
5166  case 0xe2:
5167  case 0xe3:
5168  case 0xe4:
5169  case 0xe5:
5170  case 0xe6:
5171  case 0xe7:
5172  case 0xe8:
5173  case 0xe9:
5174  case 0xea:
5175  case 0xeb:
5176  case 0xec:
5177  case 0xed:
5178  case 0xee:
5179  case 0xef:
5180  case 0xf0:
5181  case 0xf1:
5182  case 0xf2:
5183  case 0xf3:
5184  case 0xf4:
5185  case 0xf5:
5186  case 0xf6:
5187  case 0xf7:
5188  case 0xf8:
5189  case 0xf9:
5190  case 0xfa:
5191  case 0xfb:
5192  case 0xfc:
5193  case 0xfd:
5194  case 0xfe:
5195  case 0xff:
5196  return static_cast<int8_t>(current);
5197 
5198  default: // anything else
5199  {
5200  std::stringstream ss;
5201  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5202  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(112, chars_read,
5203  "error reading MessagePack; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5204  }
5205  }
5206  }
5207 
5217  int get()
5218  {
5219  ++chars_read;
5220  return (current = ia->get_character());
5221  }
5222 
5223  /*
5224  @brief read a number from the input
5225 
5226  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
5227 
5228  @return number of type @a NumberType
5229 
5230  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because
5231  bytes in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big
5232  endian) and therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
5233 
5234  @throw parse_error.110 if input has less than `sizeof(NumberType)` bytes
5235  */
5236  template<typename NumberType> NumberType get_number()
5237  {
5238  // step 1: read input into array with system's byte order
5239  std::array<uint8_t, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
5240  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < sizeof(NumberType); ++i)
5241  {
5242  get();
5243  check_eof();
5244 
5245  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
5246  if (is_little_endian)
5247  {
5248  vec[sizeof(NumberType) - i - 1] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current);
5249  }
5250  else
5251  {
5252  vec[i] = static_cast<uint8_t>(current); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
5253  }
5254  }
5255 
5256  // step 2: convert array into number of type T and return
5257  NumberType result;
5258  std::memcpy(&result, vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
5259  return result;
5260  }
5261 
5275  template<typename NumberType>
5276  std::string get_string(const NumberType len)
5277  {
5278  std::string result;
5279  std::generate_n(std::back_inserter(result), len, [this]()
5280  {
5281  get();
5282  check_eof();
5283  return current;
5284  });
5285  return result;
5286  }
5287 
5300  std::string get_cbor_string()
5301  {
5302  check_eof();
5303 
5304  switch (current)
5305  {
5306  // UTF-8 string (0x00..0x17 bytes follow)
5307  case 0x60:
5308  case 0x61:
5309  case 0x62:
5310  case 0x63:
5311  case 0x64:
5312  case 0x65:
5313  case 0x66:
5314  case 0x67:
5315  case 0x68:
5316  case 0x69:
5317  case 0x6a:
5318  case 0x6b:
5319  case 0x6c:
5320  case 0x6d:
5321  case 0x6e:
5322  case 0x6f:
5323  case 0x70:
5324  case 0x71:
5325  case 0x72:
5326  case 0x73:
5327  case 0x74:
5328  case 0x75:
5329  case 0x76:
5330  case 0x77:
5331  {
5332  return get_string(current & 0x1f);
5333  }
5334 
5335  case 0x78: // UTF-8 string (one-byte uint8_t for n follows)
5336  {
5337  return get_string(get_number<uint8_t>());
5338  }
5339 
5340  case 0x79: // UTF-8 string (two-byte uint16_t for n follow)
5341  {
5342  return get_string(get_number<uint16_t>());
5343  }
5344 
5345  case 0x7a: // UTF-8 string (four-byte uint32_t for n follow)
5346  {
5347  return get_string(get_number<uint32_t>());
5348  }
5349 
5350  case 0x7b: // UTF-8 string (eight-byte uint64_t for n follow)
5351  {
5352  return get_string(get_number<uint64_t>());
5353  }
5354 
5355  case 0x7f: // UTF-8 string (indefinite length)
5356  {
5357  std::string result;
5358  while (get() != 0xff)
5359  {
5360  check_eof();
5361  result.push_back(static_cast<char>(current));
5362  }
5363  return result;
5364  }
5365 
5366  default:
5367  {
5368  std::stringstream ss;
5369  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5370  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read, "expected a CBOR string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5371  }
5372  }
5373  }
5374 
5375  template<typename NumberType>
5376  BasicJsonType get_cbor_array(const NumberType len)
5377  {
5378  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
5379  std::generate_n(std::back_inserter(*result.m_value.array), len, [this]()
5380  {
5381  return parse_cbor_internal();
5382  });
5383  return result;
5384  }
5385 
5386  template<typename NumberType>
5387  BasicJsonType get_cbor_object(const NumberType len)
5388  {
5389  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
5390  std::generate_n(std::inserter(*result.m_value.object,
5391  result.m_value.object->end()),
5392  len, [this]()
5393  {
5394  get();
5395  auto key = get_cbor_string();
5396  auto val = parse_cbor_internal();
5397  return std::make_pair(std::move(key), std::move(val));
5398  });
5399  return result;
5400  }
5401 
5413  std::string get_msgpack_string()
5414  {
5415  check_eof();
5416 
5417  switch (current)
5418  {
5419  // fixstr
5420  case 0xa0:
5421  case 0xa1:
5422  case 0xa2:
5423  case 0xa3:
5424  case 0xa4:
5425  case 0xa5:
5426  case 0xa6:
5427  case 0xa7:
5428  case 0xa8:
5429  case 0xa9:
5430  case 0xaa:
5431  case 0xab:
5432  case 0xac:
5433  case 0xad:
5434  case 0xae:
5435  case 0xaf:
5436  case 0xb0:
5437  case 0xb1:
5438  case 0xb2:
5439  case 0xb3:
5440  case 0xb4:
5441  case 0xb5:
5442  case 0xb6:
5443  case 0xb7:
5444  case 0xb8:
5445  case 0xb9:
5446  case 0xba:
5447  case 0xbb:
5448  case 0xbc:
5449  case 0xbd:
5450  case 0xbe:
5451  case 0xbf:
5452  {
5453  return get_string(current & 0x1f);
5454  }
5455 
5456  case 0xd9: // str 8
5457  {
5458  return get_string(get_number<uint8_t>());
5459  }
5460 
5461  case 0xda: // str 16
5462  {
5463  return get_string(get_number<uint16_t>());
5464  }
5465 
5466  case 0xdb: // str 32
5467  {
5468  return get_string(get_number<uint32_t>());
5469  }
5470 
5471  default:
5472  {
5473  std::stringstream ss;
5474  ss << std::setw(2) << std::setfill('0') << std::hex << current;
5475  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(113, chars_read,
5476  "expected a MessagePack string; last byte: 0x" + ss.str()));
5477  }
5478  }
5479  }
5480 
5481  template<typename NumberType>
5482  BasicJsonType get_msgpack_array(const NumberType len)
5483  {
5484  BasicJsonType result = value_t::array;
5485  std::generate_n(std::back_inserter(*result.m_value.array), len, [this]()
5486  {
5487  return parse_msgpack_internal();
5488  });
5489  return result;
5490  }
5491 
5492  template<typename NumberType>
5493  BasicJsonType get_msgpack_object(const NumberType len)
5494  {
5495  BasicJsonType result = value_t::object;
5496  std::generate_n(std::inserter(*result.m_value.object,
5497  result.m_value.object->end()),
5498  len, [this]()
5499  {
5500  get();
5501  auto key = get_msgpack_string();
5502  auto val = parse_msgpack_internal();
5503  return std::make_pair(std::move(key), std::move(val));
5504  });
5505  return result;
5506  }
5507 
5512  void check_eof(const bool expect_eof = false) const
5513  {
5514  if (expect_eof)
5515  {
5516  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current != std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
5517  {
5518  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "expected end of input"));
5519  }
5520  }
5521  else
5522  {
5523  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(current == std::char_traits<char>::eof()))
5524  {
5525  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(110, chars_read, "unexpected end of input"));
5526  }
5527  }
5528  }
5529 
5530  private:
5532  input_adapter_t ia = nullptr;
5533 
5535  int current = std::char_traits<char>::eof();
5536 
5538  std::size_t chars_read = 0;
5539 
5541  const bool is_little_endian = little_endianess();
5542 };
5543 
5547 template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
5548 class binary_writer
5549 {
5550  public:
5556  explicit binary_writer(output_adapter_t<CharType> adapter) : oa(adapter)
5557  {
5558  assert(oa);
5559  }
5560 
5564  void write_cbor(const BasicJsonType& j)
5565  {
5566  switch (j.type())
5567  {
5568  case value_t::null:
5569  {
5570  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xf6));
5571  break;
5572  }
5573 
5574  case value_t::boolean:
5575  {
5576  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
5577  ? static_cast<CharType>(0xf5)
5578  : static_cast<CharType>(0xf4));
5579  break;
5580  }
5581 
5582  case value_t::number_integer:
5583  {
5584  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
5585  {
5586  // CBOR does not differentiate between positive signed
5587  // integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used the
5588  // code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
5589  if (j.m_value.number_integer <= 0x17)
5590  {
5591  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5592  }
5593  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5594  {
5595  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x18));
5596  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5597  }
5598  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5599  {
5600  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x19));
5601  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5602  }
5603  else if (j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5604  {
5605  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1a));
5606  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5607  }
5608  else
5609  {
5610  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1b));
5611  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5612  }
5613  }
5614  else
5615  {
5616  // The conversions below encode the sign in the first
5617  // byte, and the value is converted to a positive number.
5618  const auto positive_number = -1 - j.m_value.number_integer;
5619  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -24)
5620  {
5621  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x20 + positive_number));
5622  }
5623  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5624  {
5625  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x38));
5626  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(positive_number));
5627  }
5628  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5629  {
5630  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x39));
5631  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(positive_number));
5632  }
5633  else if (positive_number <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5634  {
5635  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x3a));
5636  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(positive_number));
5637  }
5638  else
5639  {
5640  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x3b));
5641  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(positive_number));
5642  }
5643  }
5644  break;
5645  }
5646 
5647  case value_t::number_unsigned:
5648  {
5649  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= 0x17)
5650  {
5651  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5652  }
5653  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5654  {
5655  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x18));
5656  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5657  }
5658  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5659  {
5660  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x19));
5661  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5662  }
5663  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5664  {
5665  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1a));
5666  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5667  }
5668  else
5669  {
5670  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x1b));
5671  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_unsigned));
5672  }
5673  break;
5674  }
5675 
5676  case value_t::number_float: // Double-Precision Float
5677  {
5678  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xfb));
5679  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
5680  break;
5681  }
5682 
5683  case value_t::string:
5684  {
5685  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
5686  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
5687  if (N <= 0x17)
5688  {
5689  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x60 + N));
5690  }
5691  else if (N <= 0xff)
5692  {
5693  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x78));
5694  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5695  }
5696  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5697  {
5698  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x79));
5699  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5700  }
5701  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5702  {
5703  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x7a));
5704  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5705  }
5706  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5707  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5708  {
5709  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x7b));
5710  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5711  }
5712  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5713 
5714  // step 2: write the string
5715  oa->write_characters(
5716  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
5717  j.m_value.string->size());
5718  break;
5719  }
5720 
5721  case value_t::array:
5722  {
5723  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
5724  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
5725  if (N <= 0x17)
5726  {
5727  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 + N));
5728  }
5729  else if (N <= 0xff)
5730  {
5731  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x98));
5732  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5733  }
5734  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5735  {
5736  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x99));
5737  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5738  }
5739  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5740  {
5741  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x9a));
5742  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5743  }
5744  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5745  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5746  {
5747  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0x9b));
5748  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5749  }
5750  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5751 
5752  // step 2: write each element
5753  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
5754  {
5755  write_cbor(el);
5756  }
5757  break;
5758  }
5759 
5760  case value_t::object:
5761  {
5762  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
5763  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
5764  if (N <= 0x17)
5765  {
5766  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 + N));
5767  }
5768  else if (N <= 0xff)
5769  {
5770  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xb8));
5771  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5772  }
5773  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5774  {
5775  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xb9));
5776  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5777  }
5778  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5779  {
5780  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xba));
5781  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5782  }
5783  // LCOV_EXCL_START
5784  else if (N <= 0xffffffffffffffff)
5785  {
5786  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xbb));
5787  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(N));
5788  }
5789  // LCOV_EXCL_STOP
5790 
5791  // step 2: write each element
5792  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
5793  {
5794  write_cbor(el.first);
5795  write_cbor(el.second);
5796  }
5797  break;
5798  }
5799 
5800  default:
5801  break;
5802  }
5803  }
5804 
5808  void write_msgpack(const BasicJsonType& j)
5809  {
5810  switch (j.type())
5811  {
5812  case value_t::null: // nil
5813  {
5814  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xc0));
5815  break;
5816  }
5817 
5818  case value_t::boolean: // true and false
5819  {
5820  oa->write_character(j.m_value.boolean
5821  ? static_cast<CharType>(0xc3)
5822  : static_cast<CharType>(0xc2));
5823  break;
5824  }
5825 
5826  case value_t::number_integer:
5827  {
5828  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= 0)
5829  {
5830  // MessagePack does not differentiate between positive
5831  // signed integers and unsigned integers. Therefore, we used
5832  // the code from the value_t::number_unsigned case here.
5833  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
5834  {
5835  // positive fixnum
5836  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5837  }
5838  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5839  {
5840  // uint 8
5841  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcc));
5842  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5843  }
5844  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5845  {
5846  // uint 16
5847  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcd));
5848  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5849  }
5850  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5851  {
5852  // uint 32
5853  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xce));
5854  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5855  }
5856  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
5857  {
5858  // uint 64
5859  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcf));
5860  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5861  }
5862  }
5863  else
5864  {
5865  if (j.m_value.number_integer >= -32)
5866  {
5867  // negative fixnum
5868  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5869  }
5870  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::min)() and
5871  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int8_t>::max)())
5872  {
5873  // int 8
5874  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd0));
5875  write_number(static_cast<int8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5876  }
5877  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::min)() and
5878  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int16_t>::max)())
5879  {
5880  // int 16
5881  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd1));
5882  write_number(static_cast<int16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5883  }
5884  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::min)() and
5885  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int32_t>::max)())
5886  {
5887  // int 32
5888  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd2));
5889  write_number(static_cast<int32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5890  }
5891  else if (j.m_value.number_integer >= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::min)() and
5892  j.m_value.number_integer <= (std::numeric_limits<int64_t>::max)())
5893  {
5894  // int 64
5895  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd3));
5896  write_number(static_cast<int64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5897  }
5898  }
5899  break;
5900  }
5901 
5902  case value_t::number_unsigned:
5903  {
5904  if (j.m_value.number_unsigned < 128)
5905  {
5906  // positive fixnum
5907  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5908  }
5909  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint8_t>::max)())
5910  {
5911  // uint 8
5912  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcc));
5913  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5914  }
5915  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint16_t>::max)())
5916  {
5917  // uint 16
5918  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcd));
5919  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5920  }
5921  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint32_t>::max)())
5922  {
5923  // uint 32
5924  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xce));
5925  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5926  }
5927  else if (j.m_value.number_unsigned <= (std::numeric_limits<uint64_t>::max)())
5928  {
5929  // uint 64
5930  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcf));
5931  write_number(static_cast<uint64_t>(j.m_value.number_integer));
5932  }
5933  break;
5934  }
5935 
5936  case value_t::number_float: // float 64
5937  {
5938  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xcb));
5939  write_number(j.m_value.number_float);
5940  break;
5941  }
5942 
5943  case value_t::string:
5944  {
5945  // step 1: write control byte and the string length
5946  const auto N = j.m_value.string->size();
5947  if (N <= 31)
5948  {
5949  // fixstr
5950  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0xa0 | N));
5951  }
5952  else if (N <= 255)
5953  {
5954  // str 8
5955  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xd9));
5956  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(N));
5957  }
5958  else if (N <= 65535)
5959  {
5960  // str 16
5961  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xda));
5962  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5963  }
5964  else if (N <= 4294967295)
5965  {
5966  // str 32
5967  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdb));
5968  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5969  }
5970 
5971  // step 2: write the string
5972  oa->write_characters(
5973  reinterpret_cast<const CharType*>(j.m_value.string->c_str()),
5974  j.m_value.string->size());
5975  break;
5976  }
5977 
5978  case value_t::array:
5979  {
5980  // step 1: write control byte and the array size
5981  const auto N = j.m_value.array->size();
5982  if (N <= 15)
5983  {
5984  // fixarray
5985  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x90 | N));
5986  }
5987  else if (N <= 0xffff)
5988  {
5989  // array 16
5990  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdc));
5991  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
5992  }
5993  else if (N <= 0xffffffff)
5994  {
5995  // array 32
5996  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdd));
5997  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
5998  }
5999 
6000  // step 2: write each element
6001  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.array)
6002  {
6003  write_msgpack(el);
6004  }
6005  break;
6006  }
6007 
6008  case value_t::object:
6009  {
6010  // step 1: write control byte and the object size
6011  const auto N = j.m_value.object->size();
6012  if (N <= 15)
6013  {
6014  // fixmap
6015  write_number(static_cast<uint8_t>(0x80 | (N & 0xf)));
6016  }
6017  else if (N <= 65535)
6018  {
6019  // map 16
6020  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xde));
6021  write_number(static_cast<uint16_t>(N));
6022  }
6023  else if (N <= 4294967295)
6024  {
6025  // map 32
6026  oa->write_character(static_cast<CharType>(0xdf));
6027  write_number(static_cast<uint32_t>(N));
6028  }
6029 
6030  // step 2: write each element
6031  for (const auto& el : *j.m_value.object)
6032  {
6033  write_msgpack(el.first);
6034  write_msgpack(el.second);
6035  }
6036  break;
6037  }
6038 
6039  default:
6040  break;
6041  }
6042  }
6043 
6044  private:
6045  /*
6046  @brief write a number to output input
6047 
6048  @param[in] n number of type @a NumberType
6049  @tparam NumberType the type of the number
6050 
6051  @note This function needs to respect the system's endianess, because bytes
6052  in CBOR and MessagePack are stored in network order (big endian) and
6053  therefore need reordering on little endian systems.
6054  */
6055  template<typename NumberType> void write_number(NumberType n)
6056  {
6057  // step 1: write number to array of length NumberType
6058  std::array<CharType, sizeof(NumberType)> vec;
6059  std::memcpy(vec.data(), &n, sizeof(NumberType));
6060 
6061  // step 2: write array to output (with possible reordering)
6062  if (is_little_endian)
6063  {
6064  // reverse byte order prior to conversion if necessary
6065  std::reverse(vec.begin(), vec.end());
6066  }
6067 
6068  oa->write_characters(vec.data(), sizeof(NumberType));
6069  }
6070 
6071  private:
6073  const bool is_little_endian = binary_reader<BasicJsonType>::little_endianess();
6074 
6076  output_adapter_t<CharType> oa = nullptr;
6077 };
6078 
6080 // serialization //
6082 
6083 template<typename BasicJsonType>
6084 class serializer
6085 {
6086  using string_t = typename BasicJsonType::string_t;
6087  using number_float_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_float_t;
6088  using number_integer_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_integer_t;
6089  using number_unsigned_t = typename BasicJsonType::number_unsigned_t;
6090  public:
6095  serializer(output_adapter_t<char> s, const char ichar)
6096  : o(std::move(s)), loc(std::localeconv()),
6097  thousands_sep(loc->thousands_sep == nullptr ? '\0' : loc->thousands_sep[0]),
6098  decimal_point(loc->decimal_point == nullptr ? '\0' : loc->decimal_point[0]),
6099  indent_char(ichar), indent_string(512, indent_char) {}
6100 
6101  // delete because of pointer members
6102  serializer(const serializer&) = delete;
6103  serializer& operator=(const serializer&) = delete;
6104 
6122  void dump(const BasicJsonType& val, const bool pretty_print,
6123  const bool ensure_ascii,
6124  const unsigned int indent_step,
6125  const unsigned int current_indent = 0)
6126  {
6127  switch (val.m_type)
6128  {
6129  case value_t::object:
6130  {
6131  if (val.m_value.object->empty())
6132  {
6133  o->write_characters("{}", 2);
6134  return;
6135  }
6136 
6137  if (pretty_print)
6138  {
6139  o->write_characters("{\n", 2);
6140 
6141  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6142  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6143  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(indent_string.size() < new_indent))
6144  {
6145  indent_string.resize(indent_string.size() * 2, ' ');
6146  }
6147 
6148  // first n-1 elements
6149  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6150  for (std::size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6151  {
6152  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6153  o->write_character('\"');
6154  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6155  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6156  dump(i->second, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6157  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6158  }
6159 
6160  // last element
6161  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6162  assert(std::next(i) == val.m_value.object->cend());
6163  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6164  o->write_character('\"');
6165  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6166  o->write_characters("\": ", 3);
6167  dump(i->second, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6168 
6169  o->write_character('\n');
6170  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6171  o->write_character('}');
6172  }
6173  else
6174  {
6175  o->write_character('{');
6176 
6177  // first n-1 elements
6178  auto i = val.m_value.object->cbegin();
6179  for (std::size_t cnt = 0; cnt < val.m_value.object->size() - 1; ++cnt, ++i)
6180  {
6181  o->write_character('\"');
6182  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6183  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6184  dump(i->second, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6185  o->write_character(',');
6186  }
6187 
6188  // last element
6189  assert(i != val.m_value.object->cend());
6190  assert(std::next(i) == val.m_value.object->cend());
6191  o->write_character('\"');
6192  dump_escaped(i->first, ensure_ascii);
6193  o->write_characters("\":", 2);
6194  dump(i->second, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6195 
6196  o->write_character('}');
6197  }
6198 
6199  return;
6200  }
6201 
6202  case value_t::array:
6203  {
6204  if (val.m_value.array->empty())
6205  {
6206  o->write_characters("[]", 2);
6207  return;
6208  }
6209 
6210  if (pretty_print)
6211  {
6212  o->write_characters("[\n", 2);
6213 
6214  // variable to hold indentation for recursive calls
6215  const auto new_indent = current_indent + indent_step;
6216  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(indent_string.size() < new_indent))
6217  {
6218  indent_string.resize(indent_string.size() * 2, ' ');
6219  }
6220 
6221  // first n-1 elements
6222  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin();
6223  i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6224  {
6225  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6226  dump(*i, true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6227  o->write_characters(",\n", 2);
6228  }
6229 
6230  // last element
6231  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6232  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), new_indent);
6233  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), true, ensure_ascii, indent_step, new_indent);
6234 
6235  o->write_character('\n');
6236  o->write_characters(indent_string.c_str(), current_indent);
6237  o->write_character(']');
6238  }
6239  else
6240  {
6241  o->write_character('[');
6242 
6243  // first n-1 elements
6244  for (auto i = val.m_value.array->cbegin();
6245  i != val.m_value.array->cend() - 1; ++i)
6246  {
6247  dump(*i, false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6248  o->write_character(',');
6249  }
6250 
6251  // last element
6252  assert(not val.m_value.array->empty());
6253  dump(val.m_value.array->back(), false, ensure_ascii, indent_step, current_indent);
6254 
6255  o->write_character(']');
6256  }
6257 
6258  return;
6259  }
6260 
6261  case value_t::string:
6262  {
6263  o->write_character('\"');
6264  dump_escaped(*val.m_value.string, ensure_ascii);
6265  o->write_character('\"');
6266  return;
6267  }
6268 
6269  case value_t::boolean:
6270  {
6271  if (val.m_value.boolean)
6272  {
6273  o->write_characters("true", 4);
6274  }
6275  else
6276  {
6277  o->write_characters("false", 5);
6278  }
6279  return;
6280  }
6281 
6282  case value_t::number_integer:
6283  {
6284  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_integer);
6285  return;
6286  }
6287 
6288  case value_t::number_unsigned:
6289  {
6290  dump_integer(val.m_value.number_unsigned);
6291  return;
6292  }
6293 
6294  case value_t::number_float:
6295  {
6296  dump_float(val.m_value.number_float);
6297  return;
6298  }
6299 
6300  case value_t::discarded:
6301  {
6302  o->write_characters("<discarded>", 11);
6303  return;
6304  }
6305 
6306  case value_t::null:
6307  {
6308  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6309  return;
6310  }
6311  }
6312  }
6313 
6314  private:
6321  static constexpr std::size_t bytes_following(const uint8_t u)
6322  {
6323  return ((0 <= u and u <= 127) ? 0
6324  : ((192 <= u and u <= 223) ? 1
6325  : ((224 <= u and u <= 239) ? 2
6326  : ((240 <= u and u <= 247) ? 3 : std::string::npos))));
6327  }
6328 
6339  static std::size_t extra_space(const string_t& s,
6340  const bool ensure_ascii) noexcept
6341  {
6342  std::size_t res = 0;
6343 
6344  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i)
6345  {
6346  switch (s[i])
6347  {
6348  // control characters that can be escaped with a backslash
6349  case '"':
6350  case '\\':
6351  case '\b':
6352  case '\f':
6353  case '\n':
6354  case '\r':
6355  case '\t':
6356  {
6357  // from c (1 byte) to \x (2 bytes)
6358  res += 1;
6359  break;
6360  }
6361 
6362  // control characters that need \uxxxx escaping
6363  case 0x00:
6364  case 0x01:
6365  case 0x02:
6366  case 0x03:
6367  case 0x04:
6368  case 0x05:
6369  case 0x06:
6370  case 0x07:
6371  case 0x0b:
6372  case 0x0e:
6373  case 0x0f:
6374  case 0x10:
6375  case 0x11:
6376  case 0x12:
6377  case 0x13:
6378  case 0x14:
6379  case 0x15:
6380  case 0x16:
6381  case 0x17:
6382  case 0x18:
6383  case 0x19:
6384  case 0x1a:
6385  case 0x1b:
6386  case 0x1c:
6387  case 0x1d:
6388  case 0x1e:
6389  case 0x1f:
6390  {
6391  // from c (1 byte) to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
6392  res += 5;
6393  break;
6394  }
6395 
6396  default:
6397  {
6398  if (ensure_ascii and (s[i] & 0x80 or s[i] == 0x7F))
6399  {
6400  const auto bytes = bytes_following(static_cast<uint8_t>(s[i]));
6401  if (bytes == std::string::npos)
6402  {
6403  // invalid characters are treated as is, so no
6404  // additional space will be used
6405  break;
6406  }
6407 
6408  if (bytes == 3)
6409  {
6410  // codepoints that need 4 bytes (i.e., 3 additional
6411  // bytes) in UTF-8 need a surrogate pair when \u
6412  // escaping is used: from 4 bytes to \uxxxx\uxxxx
6413  // (12 bytes)
6414  res += (12 - bytes - 1);
6415  }
6416  else
6417  {
6418  // from x bytes to \uxxxx (6 bytes)
6419  res += (6 - bytes - 1);
6420  }
6421 
6422  // skip the additional bytes
6423  i += bytes;
6424  }
6425  break;
6426  }
6427  }
6428  }
6429 
6430  return res;
6431  }
6432 
6433  static void escape_codepoint(int codepoint, string_t& result, std::size_t& pos)
6434  {
6435  // expecting a proper codepoint
6436  assert(0x00 <= codepoint and codepoint <= 0x10FFFF);
6437 
6438  // the last written character was the backslash before the 'u'
6439  assert(result[pos] == '\\');
6440 
6441  // write the 'u'
6442  result[++pos] = 'u';
6443 
6444  // convert a number 0..15 to its hex representation (0..f)
6445  static const std::array<char, 16> hexify =
6446  {
6447  {
6448  '0', '1', '2', '3', '4', '5', '6', '7',
6449  '8', '9', 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f'
6450  }
6451  };
6452 
6453  if (codepoint < 0x10000)
6454  {
6455  // codepoints U+0000..U+FFFF can be represented as \uxxxx.
6456  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 12) & 0x0F];
6457  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 8) & 0x0F];
6458  result[++pos] = hexify[(codepoint >> 4) & 0x0F];
6459  result[++pos] = hexify[codepoint & 0x0F];
6460  }
6461  else
6462  {
6463  // codepoints U+10000..U+10FFFF need a surrogate pair to be
6464  // represented as \uxxxx\uxxxx.
6465  // http://www.unicode.org/faq/utf_bom.html#utf16-4
6466  codepoint -= 0x10000;
6467  const int high_surrogate = 0xD800 | ((codepoint >> 10) & 0x3FF);
6468  const int low_surrogate = 0xDC00 | (codepoint & 0x3FF);
6469  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 12) & 0x0F];
6470  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 8) & 0x0F];
6471  result[++pos] = hexify[(high_surrogate >> 4) & 0x0F];
6472  result[++pos] = hexify[high_surrogate & 0x0F];
6473  ++pos; // backslash is already in output
6474  result[++pos] = 'u';
6475  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 12) & 0x0F];
6476  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 8) & 0x0F];
6477  result[++pos] = hexify[(low_surrogate >> 4) & 0x0F];
6478  result[++pos] = hexify[low_surrogate & 0x0F];
6479  }
6480 
6481  ++pos;
6482  }
6483 
6498  void dump_escaped(const string_t& s, const bool ensure_ascii) const
6499  {
6500  const auto space = extra_space(s, ensure_ascii);
6501  if (space == 0)
6502  {
6503  o->write_characters(s.c_str(), s.size());
6504  return;
6505  }
6506 
6507  // create a result string of necessary size
6508  string_t result(s.size() + space, '\\');
6509  std::size_t pos = 0;
6510 
6511  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < s.size(); ++i)
6512  {
6513  switch (s[i])
6514  {
6515  case '"': // quotation mark (0x22)
6516  {
6517  result[pos + 1] = '"';
6518  pos += 2;
6519  break;
6520  }
6521 
6522  case '\\': // reverse solidus (0x5c)
6523  {
6524  // nothing to change
6525  pos += 2;
6526  break;
6527  }
6528 
6529  case '\b': // backspace (0x08)
6530  {
6531  result[pos + 1] = 'b';
6532  pos += 2;
6533  break;
6534  }
6535 
6536  case '\f': // formfeed (0x0c)
6537  {
6538  result[pos + 1] = 'f';
6539  pos += 2;
6540  break;
6541  }
6542 
6543  case '\n': // newline (0x0a)
6544  {
6545  result[pos + 1] = 'n';
6546  pos += 2;
6547  break;
6548  }
6549 
6550  case '\r': // carriage return (0x0d)
6551  {
6552  result[pos + 1] = 'r';
6553  pos += 2;
6554  break;
6555  }
6556 
6557  case '\t': // horizontal tab (0x09)
6558  {
6559  result[pos + 1] = 't';
6560  pos += 2;
6561  break;
6562  }
6563 
6564  default:
6565  {
6566  // escape control characters (0x00..0x1F) or, if
6567  // ensure_ascii parameter is used, non-ASCII characters
6568  if ((0x00 <= s[i] and s[i] <= 0x1F) or
6569  (ensure_ascii and (s[i] & 0x80 or s[i] == 0x7F)))
6570  {
6571  const auto bytes = bytes_following(static_cast<uint8_t>(s[i]));
6572  if (bytes == std::string::npos)
6573  {
6574  // copy invalid character as is
6575  result[pos++] = s[i];
6576  break;
6577  }
6578 
6579  // check that the additional bytes are present
6580  assert(i + bytes < s.size());
6581 
6582  // to use\uxxxx escaping, we first need to caluclate
6583  // the codepoint from the UTF-8 bytes
6584  int codepoint = 0;
6585 
6586  assert(0 <= bytes and bytes <= 3);
6587  switch (bytes)
6588  {
6589  case 0:
6590  {
6591  codepoint = s[i] & 0xFF;
6592  break;
6593  }
6594 
6595  case 1:
6596  {
6597  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0x3F) << 6)
6598  + (s[i + 1] & 0x7F);
6599  break;
6600  }
6601 
6602  case 2:
6603  {
6604  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0x1F) << 12)
6605  + ((s[i + 1] & 0x7F) << 6)
6606  + (s[i + 2] & 0x7F);
6607  break;
6608  }
6609 
6610  case 3:
6611  {
6612  codepoint = ((s[i] & 0xF) << 18)
6613  + ((s[i + 1] & 0x7F) << 12)
6614  + ((s[i + 2] & 0x7F) << 6)
6615  + (s[i + 3] & 0x7F);
6616  break;
6617  }
6618 
6619  default:
6620  break; // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
6621  }
6622 
6623  escape_codepoint(codepoint, result, pos);
6624  i += bytes;
6625  }
6626  else
6627  {
6628  // all other characters are added as-is
6629  result[pos++] = s[i];
6630  }
6631  break;
6632  }
6633  }
6634  }
6635 
6636  assert(pos == result.size());
6637  o->write_characters(result.c_str(), result.size());
6638  }
6639 
6649  template <
6650  typename NumberType,
6651  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<NumberType, number_unsigned_t>::value or
6652  std::is_same<NumberType, number_integer_t>::value,
6653  int> = 0 >
6654  void dump_integer(NumberType x)
6655  {
6656  // special case for "0"
6657  if (x == 0)
6658  {
6659  o->write_character('0');
6660  return;
6661  }
6662 
6663  const bool is_negative = x < 0;
6664  std::size_t i = 0;
6665 
6666  // spare 1 byte for '\0'
6667  while (x != 0 and i < number_buffer.size() - 1)
6668  {
6669  const auto digit = std::labs(static_cast<long>(x % 10));
6670  number_buffer[i++] = static_cast<char>('0' + digit);
6671  x /= 10;
6672  }
6673 
6674  // make sure the number has been processed completely
6675  assert(x == 0);
6676 
6677  if (is_negative)
6678  {
6679  // make sure there is capacity for the '-'
6680  assert(i < number_buffer.size() - 2);
6681  number_buffer[i++] = '-';
6682  }
6683 
6684  std::reverse(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + i);
6685  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), i);
6686  }
6687 
6696  void dump_float(number_float_t x)
6697  {
6698  // NaN / inf
6699  if (not std::isfinite(x) or std::isnan(x))
6700  {
6701  o->write_characters("null", 4);
6702  return;
6703  }
6704 
6705  // special case for 0.0 and -0.0
6706  if (x == 0)
6707  {
6708  if (std::signbit(x))
6709  {
6710  o->write_characters("-0.0", 4);
6711  }
6712  else
6713  {
6714  o->write_characters("0.0", 3);
6715  }
6716  return;
6717  }
6718 
6719  // get number of digits for a text -> float -> text round-trip
6720  static constexpr auto d = std::numeric_limits<number_float_t>::digits10;
6721 
6722  // the actual conversion
6723  std::ptrdiff_t len = snprintf(number_buffer.data(), number_buffer.size(), "%.*g", d, x);
6724 
6725  // negative value indicates an error
6726  assert(len > 0);
6727  // check if buffer was large enough
6728  assert(static_cast<std::size_t>(len) < number_buffer.size());
6729 
6730  // erase thousands separator
6731  if (thousands_sep != '\0')
6732  {
6733  const auto end = std::remove(number_buffer.begin(),
6734  number_buffer.begin() + len, thousands_sep);
6735  std::fill(end, number_buffer.end(), '\0');
6736  assert((end - number_buffer.begin()) <= len);
6737  len = (end - number_buffer.begin());
6738  }
6739 
6740  // convert decimal point to '.'
6741  if (decimal_point != '\0' and decimal_point != '.')
6742  {
6743  const auto dec_pos = std::find(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.end(), decimal_point);
6744  if (dec_pos != number_buffer.end())
6745  {
6746  *dec_pos = '.';
6747  }
6748  }
6749 
6750  o->write_characters(number_buffer.data(), static_cast<std::size_t>(len));
6751 
6752  // determine if need to append ".0"
6753  const bool value_is_int_like =
6754  std::none_of(number_buffer.begin(), number_buffer.begin() + len + 1,
6755  [](char c)
6756  {
6757  return (c == '.' or c == 'e');
6758  });
6759 
6760  if (value_is_int_like)
6761  {
6762  o->write_characters(".0", 2);
6763  }
6764  }
6765 
6766  private:
6768  output_adapter_t<char> o = nullptr;
6769 
6771  std::array<char, 64> number_buffer{{}};
6772 
6774  const std::lconv* loc = nullptr;
6776  const char thousands_sep = '\0';
6778  const char decimal_point = '\0';
6779 
6781  const char indent_char;
6782 
6784  string_t indent_string;
6785 };
6786 
6787 template<typename BasicJsonType>
6788 class json_ref
6789 {
6790  public:
6791  using value_type = BasicJsonType;
6792 
6793  json_ref(value_type&& value)
6794  : owned_value(std::move(value)),
6795  value_ref(&owned_value),
6796  is_rvalue(true)
6797  {}
6798 
6799  json_ref(const value_type& value)
6800  : value_ref(const_cast<value_type*>(&value)),
6801  is_rvalue(false)
6802  {}
6803 
6804  json_ref(std::initializer_list<json_ref> init)
6805  : owned_value(init),
6806  value_ref(&owned_value),
6807  is_rvalue(true)
6808  {}
6809 
6810  template <class... Args>
6811  json_ref(Args... args)
6812  : owned_value(std::forward<Args>(args)...),
6813  value_ref(&owned_value),
6814  is_rvalue(true)
6815  {}
6816 
6817  // class should be movable only
6818  json_ref(json_ref&&) = default;
6819  json_ref(const json_ref&) = delete;
6820  json_ref& operator=(const json_ref&) = delete;
6821 
6822  value_type moved_or_copied() const
6823  {
6824  if (is_rvalue)
6825  {
6826  return std::move(*value_ref);
6827  }
6828  return *value_ref;
6829  }
6830 
6831  value_type const& operator*() const
6832  {
6833  return *static_cast<value_type const*>(value_ref);
6834  }
6835 
6836  value_type const* operator->() const
6837  {
6838  return static_cast<value_type const*>(value_ref);
6839  }
6840 
6841  private:
6842  mutable value_type owned_value = nullptr;
6843  value_type* value_ref = nullptr;
6844  const bool is_rvalue;
6845 };
6846 
6847 } // namespace detail
6848 
6850 namespace
6851 {
6852 constexpr const auto& to_json = detail::static_const<detail::to_json_fn>::value;
6853 constexpr const auto& from_json = detail::static_const<detail::from_json_fn>::value;
6854 }
6855 
6856 
6864 template<typename, typename>
6865 struct adl_serializer
6866 {
6876  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
6877  static void from_json(BasicJsonType&& j, ValueType& val) noexcept(
6878  noexcept(::nlohmann::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val)))
6879  {
6880  ::nlohmann::from_json(std::forward<BasicJsonType>(j), val);
6881  }
6882 
6892  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename ValueType>
6893  static void to_json(BasicJsonType& j, ValueType&& val) noexcept(
6894  noexcept(::nlohmann::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val))))
6895  {
6896  ::nlohmann::to_json(j, std::forward<ValueType>(val));
6897  }
6898 };
6899 
6911 class json_pointer
6912 {
6914  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
6915  friend class basic_json;
6916 
6917  public:
6939  explicit json_pointer(const std::string& s = "") : reference_tokens(split(s)) {}
6940 
6956  std::string to_string() const noexcept
6957  {
6958  return std::accumulate(reference_tokens.begin(), reference_tokens.end(),
6959  std::string{},
6960  [](const std::string & a, const std::string & b)
6961  {
6962  return a + "/" + escape(b);
6963  });
6964  }
6965 
6967  operator std::string() const
6968  {
6969  return to_string();
6970  }
6971 
6972  private:
6977  std::string pop_back()
6978  {
6979  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(is_root()))
6980  {
6981  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
6982  }
6983 
6984  auto last = reference_tokens.back();
6985  reference_tokens.pop_back();
6986  return last;
6987  }
6988 
6990  bool is_root() const
6991  {
6992  return reference_tokens.empty();
6993  }
6994 
6995  json_pointer top() const
6996  {
6997  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(is_root()))
6998  {
6999  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(405, "JSON pointer has no parent"));
7000  }
7001 
7002  json_pointer result = *this;
7003  result.reference_tokens = {reference_tokens[0]};
7004  return result;
7005  }
7006 
7007 
7016  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7017  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_and_create(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& j) const;
7018 
7038  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7039  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_unchecked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7040 
7047  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7048  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_checked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7049 
7063  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7064  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_unchecked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7065 
7072  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
