7073  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& get_checked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const;
7074 
7084  static std::vector<std::string> split(const std::string& reference_string)
7085  {
7086  std::vector<std::string> result;
7087 
7088  // special case: empty reference string -> no reference tokens
7089  if (reference_string.empty())
7090  {
7091  return result;
7092  }
7093 
7094  // check if nonempty reference string begins with slash
7095  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_string[0] != '/'))
7096  {
7097  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(107, 1,
7098  "JSON pointer must be empty or begin with '/' - was: '" +
7099  reference_string + "'"));
7100  }
7101 
7102  // extract the reference tokens:
7103  // - slash: position of the last read slash (or end of string)
7104  // - start: position after the previous slash
7105  for (
7106  // search for the first slash after the first character
7107  std::size_t slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', 1),
7108  // set the beginning of the first reference token
7109  start = 1;
7110  // we can stop if start == string::npos+1 = 0
7111  start != 0;
7112  // set the beginning of the next reference token
7113  // (will eventually be 0 if slash == std::string::npos)
7114  start = slash + 1,
7115  // find next slash
7116  slash = reference_string.find_first_of('/', start))
7117  {
7118  // use the text between the beginning of the reference token
7119  // (start) and the last slash (slash).
7120  auto reference_token = reference_string.substr(start, slash - start);
7121 
7122  // check reference tokens are properly escaped
7123  for (std::size_t pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~');
7124  pos != std::string::npos;
7125  pos = reference_token.find_first_of('~', pos + 1))
7126  {
7127  assert(reference_token[pos] == '~');
7128 
7129  // ~ must be followed by 0 or 1
7130  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos == reference_token.size() - 1 or
7131  (reference_token[pos + 1] != '0' and
7132  reference_token[pos + 1] != '1')))
7133  {
7134  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(108, 0, "escape character '~' must be followed with '0' or '1'"));
7135  }
7136  }
7137 
7138  // finally, store the reference token
7139  unescape(reference_token);
7140  result.push_back(reference_token);
7141  }
7142 
7143  return result;
7144  }
7145 
7159  static void replace_substring(std::string& s, const std::string& f,
7160  const std::string& t)
7161  {
7162  assert(not f.empty());
7163  for (auto pos = s.find(f); // find first occurrence of f
7164  pos != std::string::npos; // make sure f was found
7165  s.replace(pos, f.size(), t), // replace with t, and
7166  pos = s.find(f, pos + t.size())) // find next occurrence of f
7167  {}
7168  }
7169 
7171  static std::string escape(std::string s)
7172  {
7173  replace_substring(s, "~", "~0");
7174  replace_substring(s, "/", "~1");
7175  return s;
7176  }
7177 
7179  static void unescape(std::string& s)
7180  {
7181  replace_substring(s, "~1", "/");
7182  replace_substring(s, "~0", "~");
7183  }
7184 
7192  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7193  static void flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
7194  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value,
7195  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& result);
7196 
7207  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7208  static NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
7209  unflatten(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value);
7210 
7211  friend bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs,
7212  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept;
7213 
7214  friend bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs,
7215  json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept;
7216 
7218  std::vector<std::string> reference_tokens;
7219 };
7220 
7302 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
7303 class basic_json
7304 {
7305  private:
7306  template<detail::value_t> friend struct detail::external_constructor;
7307  friend ::nlohmann::json_pointer;
7308  friend ::nlohmann::detail::parser<basic_json>;
7309  friend ::nlohmann::detail::serializer<basic_json>;
7310  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7311  friend class ::nlohmann::detail::iter_impl;
7312  template<typename BasicJsonType, typename CharType>
7313  friend class ::nlohmann::detail::binary_writer;
7314  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7315  friend class ::nlohmann::detail::binary_reader;
7316 
7318  using basic_json_t = NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL;
7319 
7320  // convenience aliases for types residing in namespace detail;
7321  using lexer = ::nlohmann::detail::lexer<basic_json>;
7322  using parser = ::nlohmann::detail::parser<basic_json>;
7323 
7324  using primitive_iterator_t = ::nlohmann::detail::primitive_iterator_t;
7325  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7326  using internal_iterator = ::nlohmann::detail::internal_iterator<BasicJsonType>;
7327  template<typename BasicJsonType>
7328  using iter_impl = ::nlohmann::detail::iter_impl<BasicJsonType>;
7329  template<typename Iterator>
7330  using iteration_proxy = ::nlohmann::detail::iteration_proxy<Iterator>;
7331  template<typename Base> using json_reverse_iterator = ::nlohmann::detail::json_reverse_iterator<Base>;
7332 
7333  template<typename CharType>
7334  using output_adapter_t = ::nlohmann::detail::output_adapter_t<CharType>;
7335 
7336  using binary_reader = ::nlohmann::detail::binary_reader<basic_json>;
7337  template<typename CharType> using binary_writer = ::nlohmann::detail::binary_writer<basic_json, CharType>;
7338 
7339  using serializer = ::nlohmann::detail::serializer<basic_json>;
7340 
7341  public:
7342  using value_t = detail::value_t;
7343  // forward declarations
7344  using json_pointer = ::nlohmann::json_pointer;
7345  template<typename T, typename SFINAE>
7346  using json_serializer = JSONSerializer<T, SFINAE>;
7347 
7348  using initializer_list_t = std::initializer_list<detail::json_ref<basic_json>>;
7349 
7351  // exceptions //
7353 
7357 
7359  using exception = detail::exception;
7361  using parse_error = detail::parse_error;
7363  using invalid_iterator = detail::invalid_iterator;
7365  using type_error = detail::type_error;
7367  using out_of_range = detail::out_of_range;
7369  using other_error = detail::other_error;
7370 
7372 
7373 
7375  // container types //
7377 
7382 
7384  using value_type = basic_json;
7385 
7387  using reference = value_type&;
7389  using const_reference = const value_type&;
7390 
7392  using difference_type = std::ptrdiff_t;
7394  using size_type = std::size_t;
7395 
7397  using allocator_type = AllocatorType<basic_json>;
7398 
7400  using pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::pointer;
7402  using const_pointer = typename std::allocator_traits<allocator_type>::const_pointer;
7403 
7405  using iterator = iter_impl<basic_json>;
7407  using const_iterator = iter_impl<const basic_json>;
7409  using reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::iterator>;
7411  using const_reverse_iterator = json_reverse_iterator<typename basic_json::const_iterator>;
7412 
7414 
7415 
7419  static allocator_type get_allocator()
7420  {
7421  return allocator_type();
7422  }
7423 
7450  static basic_json meta()
7451  {
7452  basic_json result;
7453 
7454  result["copyright"] = "(C) 2013-2017 Niels Lohmann";
7455  result["name"] = "JSON for Modern C++";
7456  result["url"] = "https://github.com/nlohmann/json";
7457  result["version"] =
7458  {
7459  {"string", "2.1.1"}, {"major", 2}, {"minor", 1}, {"patch", 1}
7460  };
7461 
7462 #ifdef _WIN32
7463  result["platform"] = "win32";
7464 #elif defined __linux__
7465  result["platform"] = "linux";
7466 #elif defined __APPLE__
7467  result["platform"] = "apple";
7468 #elif defined __unix__
7469  result["platform"] = "unix";
7470 #else
7471  result["platform"] = "unknown";
7472 #endif
7473 
7474 #if defined(__ICC) || defined(__INTEL_COMPILER)
7475  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "icc"}, {"version", __INTEL_COMPILER}};
7476 #elif defined(__clang__)
7477  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "clang"}, {"version", __clang_version__}};
7478 #elif defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
7479  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "gcc"}, {"version", std::to_string(__GNUC__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_MINOR__) + "." + std::to_string(__GNUC_PATCHLEVEL__)}};
7480 #elif defined(__HP_cc) || defined(__HP_aCC)
7481  result["compiler"] = "hp"
7482 #elif defined(__IBMCPP__)
7483  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "ilecpp"}, {"version", __IBMCPP__}};
7484 #elif defined(_MSC_VER)
7485  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "msvc"}, {"version", _MSC_VER}};
7486 #elif defined(__PGI)
7487  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "pgcpp"}, {"version", __PGI}};
7488 #elif defined(__SUNPRO_CC)
7489  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "sunpro"}, {"version", __SUNPRO_CC}};
7490 #else
7491  result["compiler"] = {{"family", "unknown"}, {"version", "unknown"}};
7492 #endif
7493 
7494 #ifdef __cplusplus
7495  result["compiler"]["c++"] = std::to_string(__cplusplus);
7496 #else
7497  result["compiler"]["c++"] = "unknown";
7498 #endif
7499  return result;
7500  }
7501 
7502 
7504  // JSON value data types //
7506 
7511 
7595  using object_t = ObjectType<StringType,
7596  basic_json,
7597  std::less<StringType>,
7598  AllocatorType<std::pair<const StringType,
7599  basic_json>>>;
7600 
7645  using array_t = ArrayType<basic_json, AllocatorType<basic_json>>;
7646 
7698  using string_t = StringType;
7699 
7724  using boolean_t = BooleanType;
7725 
7796  using number_integer_t = NumberIntegerType;
7797 
7867  using number_unsigned_t = NumberUnsignedType;
7868 
7935  using number_float_t = NumberFloatType;
7936 
7938 
7939  private:
7940 
7942  template<typename T, typename... Args>
7943  static T* create(Args&& ... args)
7944  {
7945  AllocatorType<T> alloc;
7946  auto deleter = [&](T * object)
7947  {
7948  alloc.deallocate(object, 1);
7949  };
7950  std::unique_ptr<T, decltype(deleter)> object(alloc.allocate(1), deleter);
7951  alloc.construct(object.get(), std::forward<Args>(args)...);
7952  assert(object != nullptr);
7953  return object.release();
7954  }
7955 
7957  // JSON value storage //
7959 
7984  union json_value
7985  {
7987  object_t* object;
7989  array_t* array;
7991  string_t* string;
7993  boolean_t boolean;
7995  number_integer_t number_integer;
7997  number_unsigned_t number_unsigned;
7999  number_float_t number_float;
8000 
8002  json_value() = default;
8004  json_value(boolean_t v) noexcept : boolean(v) {}
8006  json_value(number_integer_t v) noexcept : number_integer(v) {}
8008  json_value(number_unsigned_t v) noexcept : number_unsigned(v) {}
8010  json_value(number_float_t v) noexcept : number_float(v) {}
8012  json_value(value_t t)
8013  {
8014  switch (t)
8015  {
8016  case value_t::object:
8017  {
8018  object = create<object_t>();
8019  break;
8020  }
8021 
8022  case value_t::array:
8023  {
8024  array = create<array_t>();
8025  break;
8026  }
8027 
8028  case value_t::string:
8029  {
8030  string = create<string_t>("");
8031  break;
8032  }
8033 
8034  case value_t::boolean:
8035  {
8036  boolean = boolean_t(false);
8037  break;
8038  }
8039 
8040  case value_t::number_integer:
8041  {
8042  number_integer = number_integer_t(0);
8043  break;
8044  }
8045 
8046  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8047  {
8048  number_unsigned = number_unsigned_t(0);
8049  break;
8050  }
8051 
8052  case value_t::number_float:
8053  {
8054  number_float = number_float_t(0.0);
8055  break;
8056  }
8057 
8058  case value_t::null:
8059  {
8060  break;
8061  }
8062 
8063  default:
8064  {
8065  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(t == value_t::null))
8066  {
8067  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(500, "961c151d2e87f2686a955a9be24d316f1362bf21 2.1.1")); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
8068  }
8069  break;
8070  }
8071  }
8072  }
8073 
8075  json_value(const string_t& value)
8076  {
8077  string = create<string_t>(value);
8078  }
8079 
8081  json_value(string_t&& value)
8082  {
8083  string = create<string_t>(std::move(value));
8084  }
8085 
8087  json_value(const object_t& value)
8088  {
8089  object = create<object_t>(value);
8090  }
8091 
8093  json_value(object_t&& value)
8094  {
8095  object = create<object_t>(std::move(value));
8096  }
8097 
8099  json_value(const array_t& value)
8100  {
8101  array = create<array_t>(value);
8102  }
8103 
8105  json_value(array_t&& value)
8106  {
8107  array = create<array_t>(std::move(value));
8108  }
8109 
8110  void destroy(value_t t)
8111  {
8112  switch (t)
8113  {
8114  case value_t::object:
8115  {
8116  AllocatorType<object_t> alloc;
8117  alloc.destroy(object);
8118  alloc.deallocate(object, 1);
8119  break;
8120  }
8121 
8122  case value_t::array:
8123  {
8124  AllocatorType<array_t> alloc;
8125  alloc.destroy(array);
8126  alloc.deallocate(array, 1);
8127  break;
8128  }
8129 
8130  case value_t::string:
8131  {
8132  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
8133  alloc.destroy(string);
8134  alloc.deallocate(string, 1);
8135  break;
8136  }
8137 
8138  default:
8139  {
8140  break;
8141  }
8142  }
8143  }
8144  };
8145 
8155  void assert_invariant() const
8156  {
8157  assert(m_type != value_t::object or m_value.object != nullptr);
8158  assert(m_type != value_t::array or m_value.array != nullptr);
8159  assert(m_type != value_t::string or m_value.string != nullptr);
8160  }
8161 
8162  public:
8164  // JSON parser callback //
8166 
8167  using parse_event_t = typename parser::parse_event_t;
8168 
8221  using parser_callback_t = typename parser::parser_callback_t;
8222 
8223 
8225  // constructors //
8227 
8232 
8262  basic_json(const value_t v)
8263  : m_type(v), m_value(v)
8264  {
8265  assert_invariant();
8266  }
8267 
8286  basic_json(std::nullptr_t = nullptr) noexcept
8287  : basic_json(value_t::null)
8288  {
8289  assert_invariant();
8290  }
8291 
8348  template<typename CompatibleType, typename U = detail::uncvref_t<CompatibleType>,
8349  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_base_of<std::istream, U>::value and
8350  not std::is_same<U, basic_json_t>::value and
8351  not detail::is_basic_json_nested_type<
8352  basic_json_t, U>::value and
8353  detail::has_to_json<basic_json, U>::value,
8354  int> = 0>
8355  basic_json(CompatibleType && val) noexcept(noexcept(JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(
8356  std::declval<basic_json_t&>(), std::forward<CompatibleType>(val))))
8357  {
8358  JSONSerializer<U>::to_json(*this, std::forward<CompatibleType>(val));
8359  assert_invariant();
8360  }
8361 
8436  basic_json(initializer_list_t init,
8437  bool type_deduction = true,
8438  value_t manual_type = value_t::array)
8439  {
8440  // check if each element is an array with two elements whose first
8441  // element is a string
8442  bool is_an_object = std::all_of(init.begin(), init.end(),
8443  [](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
8444  {
8445  return (element_ref->is_array() and element_ref->size() == 2 and (*element_ref)[0].is_string());
8446  });
8447 
8448  // adjust type if type deduction is not wanted
8449  if (not type_deduction)
8450  {
8451  // if array is wanted, do not create an object though possible
8452  if (manual_type == value_t::array)
8453  {
8454  is_an_object = false;
8455  }
8456 
8457  // if object is wanted but impossible, throw an exception
8458  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(manual_type == value_t::object and not is_an_object))
8459  {
8460  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(301, "cannot create object from initializer list"));
8461  }
8462  }
8463 
8464  if (is_an_object)
8465  {
8466  // the initializer list is a list of pairs -> create object
8467  m_type = value_t::object;
8468  m_value = value_t::object;
8469 
8470  std::for_each(init.begin(), init.end(), [this](const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& element_ref)
8471  {
8472  auto element = element_ref.moved_or_copied();
8473  m_value.object->emplace(
8474  std::move(*((*element.m_value.array)[0].m_value.string)),
8475  std::move((*element.m_value.array)[1]));
8476  });
8477  }
8478  else
8479  {
8480  // the initializer list describes an array -> create array
8481  m_type = value_t::array;
8482  m_value.array = create<array_t>(init.begin(), init.end());
8483  }
8484 
8485  assert_invariant();
8486  }
8487 
8525  static basic_json array(initializer_list_t init = {})
8526  {
8527  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::array);
8528  }
8529 
8568  static basic_json object(initializer_list_t init = {})
8569  {
8570  return basic_json(init, false, value_t::object);
8571  }
8572 
8595  basic_json(size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
8596  : m_type(value_t::array)
8597  {
8598  m_value.array = create<array_t>(cnt, val);
8599  assert_invariant();
8600  }
8601 
8657  template<class InputIT, typename std::enable_if<
8658  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
8659  std::is_same<InputIT, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type = 0>
8660  basic_json(InputIT first, InputIT last)
8661  {
8662  assert(first.m_object != nullptr);
8663  assert(last.m_object != nullptr);
8664 
8665  // make sure iterator fits the current value
8666  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
8667  {
8668  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(201, "iterators are not compatible"));
8669  }
8670 
8671  // copy type from first iterator
8672  m_type = first.m_object->m_type;
8673 
8674  // check if iterator range is complete for primitive values
8675  switch (m_type)
8676  {
8677  case value_t::boolean:
8678  case value_t::number_float:
8679  case value_t::number_integer:
8680  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8681  case value_t::string:
8682  {
8683  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
8684  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
8685  {
8686  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
8687  }
8688  break;
8689  }
8690 
8691  default:
8692  break;
8693  }
8694 
8695  switch (m_type)
8696  {
8697  case value_t::number_integer:
8698  {
8699  m_value.number_integer = first.m_object->m_value.number_integer;
8700  break;
8701  }
8702 
8703  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8704  {
8705  m_value.number_unsigned = first.m_object->m_value.number_unsigned;
8706  break;
8707  }
8708 
8709  case value_t::number_float:
8710  {
8711  m_value.number_float = first.m_object->m_value.number_float;
8712  break;
8713  }
8714 
8715  case value_t::boolean:
8716  {
8717  m_value.boolean = first.m_object->m_value.boolean;
8718  break;
8719  }
8720 
8721  case value_t::string:
8722  {
8723  m_value = *first.m_object->m_value.string;
8724  break;
8725  }
8726 
8727  case value_t::object:
8728  {
8729  m_value.object = create<object_t>(first.m_it.object_iterator,
8730  last.m_it.object_iterator);
8731  break;
8732  }
8733 
8734  case value_t::array:
8735  {
8736  m_value.array = create<array_t>(first.m_it.array_iterator,
8737  last.m_it.array_iterator);
8738  break;
8739  }
8740 
8741  default:
8742  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(206, "cannot construct with iterators from " +
8743  std::string(first.m_object->type_name())));
8744  }
8745 
8746  assert_invariant();
8747  }
8748 
8749 
8751  // other constructors and destructor //
8753 
8755  basic_json(const detail::json_ref<basic_json>& ref)
8756  : basic_json(ref.moved_or_copied())
8757  {}
8758 
8784  basic_json(const basic_json& other)
8785  : m_type(other.m_type)
8786  {
8787  // check of passed value is valid
8788  other.assert_invariant();
8789 
8790  switch (m_type)
8791  {
8792  case value_t::object:
8793  {
8794  m_value = *other.m_value.object;
8795  break;
8796  }
8797 
8798  case value_t::array:
8799  {
8800  m_value = *other.m_value.array;
8801  break;
8802  }
8803 
8804  case value_t::string:
8805  {
8806  m_value = *other.m_value.string;
8807  break;
8808  }
8809 
8810  case value_t::boolean:
8811  {
8812  m_value = other.m_value.boolean;
8813  break;
8814  }
8815 
8816  case value_t::number_integer:
8817  {
8818  m_value = other.m_value.number_integer;
8819  break;
8820  }
8821 
8822  case value_t::number_unsigned:
8823  {
8824  m_value = other.m_value.number_unsigned;
8825  break;
8826  }
8827 
8828  case value_t::number_float:
8829  {
8830  m_value = other.m_value.number_float;
8831  break;
8832  }
8833 
8834  default:
8835  break;
8836  }
8837 
8838  assert_invariant();
8839  }
8840 
8867  basic_json(basic_json&& other) noexcept
8868  : m_type(std::move(other.m_type)),
8869  m_value(std::move(other.m_value))
8870  {
8871  // check that passed value is valid
8872  other.assert_invariant();
8873 
8874  // invalidate payload
8875  other.m_type = value_t::null;
8876  other.m_value = {};
8877 
8878  assert_invariant();
8879  }
8880 
8904  reference& operator=(basic_json other) noexcept (
8905  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
8906  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
8907  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
8908  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
8909  )
8910  {
8911  // check that passed value is valid
8912  other.assert_invariant();
8913 
8914  using std::swap;
8915  swap(m_type, other.m_type);
8916  swap(m_value, other.m_value);
8917 
8918  assert_invariant();
8919  return *this;
8920  }
8921 
8937  ~basic_json()
8938  {
8939  assert_invariant();
8940  m_value.destroy(m_type);
8941  }
8942 
8944 
8945  public:
8947  // object inspection //
8949 
8953 
8987  string_t dump(const int indent = -1, const char indent_char = ' ',
8988  const bool ensure_ascii = false) const
8989  {
8990  string_t result;
8991  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(result), indent_char);
8992 
8993  if (indent >= 0)
8994  {
8995  s.dump(*this, true, ensure_ascii, static_cast<unsigned int>(indent));
8996  }
8997  else
8998  {
8999  s.dump(*this, false, ensure_ascii, 0);
9000  }
9001 
9002  return result;
9003  }
9004 
9037  constexpr value_t type() const noexcept
9038  {
9039  return m_type;
9040  }
9041 
9067  constexpr bool is_primitive() const noexcept
9068  {
9069  return is_null() or is_string() or is_boolean() or is_number();
9070  }
9071 
9094  constexpr bool is_structured() const noexcept
9095  {
9096  return is_array() or is_object();
9097  }
9098 
9116  constexpr bool is_null() const noexcept
9117  {
9118  return (m_type == value_t::null);
9119  }
9120 
9138  constexpr bool is_boolean() const noexcept
9139  {
9140  return (m_type == value_t::boolean);
9141  }
9142 
9168  constexpr bool is_number() const noexcept
9169  {
9170  return is_number_integer() or is_number_float();
9171  }
9172 
9197  constexpr bool is_number_integer() const noexcept
9198  {
9199  return (m_type == value_t::number_integer or m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
9200  }
9201 
9225  constexpr bool is_number_unsigned() const noexcept
9226  {
9227  return (m_type == value_t::number_unsigned);
9228  }
9229 
9253  constexpr bool is_number_float() const noexcept
9254  {
9255  return (m_type == value_t::number_float);
9256  }
9257 
9275  constexpr bool is_object() const noexcept
9276  {
9277  return (m_type == value_t::object);
9278  }
9279 
9297  constexpr bool is_array() const noexcept
9298  {
9299  return (m_type == value_t::array);
9300  }
9301 
9319  constexpr bool is_string() const noexcept
9320  {
9321  return (m_type == value_t::string);
9322  }
9323 
9346  constexpr bool is_discarded() const noexcept
9347  {
9348  return (m_type == value_t::discarded);
9349  }
9350 
9372  constexpr operator value_t() const noexcept
9373  {
9374  return m_type;
9375  }
9376 
9378 
9379  private:
9381  // value access //
9383 
9385  boolean_t get_impl(boolean_t* /*unused*/) const
9386  {
9387  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_boolean()))
9388  {
9389  return m_value.boolean;
9390  }
9391 
9392  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(302, "type must be boolean, but is " + std::string(type_name())));
9393  }
9394 
9396  object_t* get_impl_ptr(object_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9397  {
9398  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
9399  }
9400 
9402  constexpr const object_t* get_impl_ptr(const object_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9403  {
9404  return is_object() ? m_value.object : nullptr;
9405  }
9406 
9408  array_t* get_impl_ptr(array_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9409  {
9410  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
9411  }
9412 
9414  constexpr const array_t* get_impl_ptr(const array_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9415  {
9416  return is_array() ? m_value.array : nullptr;
9417  }
9418 
9420  string_t* get_impl_ptr(string_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9421  {
9422  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
9423  }
9424 
9426  constexpr const string_t* get_impl_ptr(const string_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9427  {
9428  return is_string() ? m_value.string : nullptr;
9429  }
9430 
9432  boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(boolean_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9433  {
9434  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
9435  }
9436 
9438  constexpr const boolean_t* get_impl_ptr(const boolean_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9439  {
9440  return is_boolean() ? &m_value.boolean : nullptr;
9441  }
9442 
9444  number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(number_integer_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9445  {
9446  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
9447  }
9448 
9450  constexpr const number_integer_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_integer_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9451  {
9452  return is_number_integer() ? &m_value.number_integer : nullptr;
9453  }
9454 
9456  number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9457  {
9458  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
9459  }
9460 
9462  constexpr const number_unsigned_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_unsigned_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9463  {
9464  return is_number_unsigned() ? &m_value.number_unsigned : nullptr;
9465  }
9466 
9468  number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(number_float_t* /*unused*/) noexcept
9469  {
9470  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
9471  }
9472 
9474  constexpr const number_float_t* get_impl_ptr(const number_float_t* /*unused*/) const noexcept
9475  {
9476  return is_number_float() ? &m_value.number_float : nullptr;
9477  }
9478 
9490  template<typename ReferenceType, typename ThisType>
9491  static ReferenceType get_ref_impl(ThisType& obj)
9492  {
9493  // delegate the call to get_ptr<>()
9494  auto ptr = obj.template get_ptr<typename std::add_pointer<ReferenceType>::type>();
9495 
9496  if (JSON_LIKELY(ptr != nullptr))
9497  {
9498  return *ptr;
9499  }
9500 
9501  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(303, "incompatible ReferenceType for get_ref, actual type is " + std::string(obj.type_name())));
9502  }
9503 
9504  public:
9508 
9523  template <
9524  typename BasicJsonType,
9525  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_same<typename std::remove_const<BasicJsonType>::type,
9526  basic_json_t>::value,
9527  int> = 0 >
9528  basic_json get() const
9529  {
9530  return *this;
9531  }
9532 
9572  template <
9573  typename ValueTypeCV,
9574  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
9575  detail::enable_if_t <
9576  not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9577  detail::has_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9578  not detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value,
9579  int > = 0 >
9580  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
9581  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>(), std::declval<ValueType&>())))
9582  {
9583  // we cannot static_assert on ValueTypeCV being non-const, because
9584  // there is support for get<const basic_json_t>(), which is why we
9585  // still need the uncvref
9586  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
9587  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
9588  static_assert(std::is_default_constructible<ValueType>::value,
9589  "types must be DefaultConstructible when used with get()");
9590 
9591  ValueType ret;
9592  JSONSerializer<ValueType>::from_json(*this, ret);
9593  return ret;
9594  }
9595 
9627  template <
9628  typename ValueTypeCV,
9629  typename ValueType = detail::uncvref_t<ValueTypeCV>,
9630  detail::enable_if_t<not std::is_same<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value and
9631  detail::has_non_default_from_json<basic_json_t,
9632  ValueType>::value, int> = 0 >
9633  ValueType get() const noexcept(noexcept(
9634  JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(std::declval<const basic_json_t&>())))
9635  {
9636  static_assert(not std::is_reference<ValueTypeCV>::value,
9637  "get() cannot be used with reference types, you might want to use get_ref()");
9638  return JSONSerializer<ValueTypeCV>::from_json(*this);
9639  }
9640 
9668  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9669  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9670  PointerType get() noexcept
9671  {
9672  // delegate the call to get_ptr
9673  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
9674  }
9675 
9680  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9681  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9682  constexpr const PointerType get() const noexcept
9683  {
9684  // delegate the call to get_ptr
9685  return get_ptr<PointerType>();
9686  }
9687 
9714  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9715  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9716  PointerType get_ptr() noexcept
9717  {
9718  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
9719  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
9720  std::remove_pointer<typename
9721  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
9722  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
9723  static_assert(
9724  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
9725  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
9726  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
9727  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
9728  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
9729  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
9730  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
9731  , "incompatible pointer type");
9732 
9733  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>()
9734  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<PointerType>(nullptr));
9735  }
9736 
9741  template<typename PointerType, typename std::enable_if<
9742  std::is_pointer<PointerType>::value and
9743  std::is_const<typename std::remove_pointer<PointerType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
9744  constexpr const PointerType get_ptr() const noexcept
9745  {
9746  // get the type of the PointerType (remove pointer and const)
9747  using pointee_t = typename std::remove_const<typename
9748  std::remove_pointer<typename
9749  std::remove_const<PointerType>::type>::type>::type;
9750  // make sure the type matches the allowed types
9751  static_assert(
9752  std::is_same<object_t, pointee_t>::value
9753  or std::is_same<array_t, pointee_t>::value
9754  or std::is_same<string_t, pointee_t>::value
9755  or std::is_same<boolean_t, pointee_t>::value
9756  or std::is_same<number_integer_t, pointee_t>::value
9757  or std::is_same<number_unsigned_t, pointee_t>::value
9758  or std::is_same<number_float_t, pointee_t>::value
9759  , "incompatible pointer type");
9760 
9761  // delegate the call to get_impl_ptr<>() const
9762  return get_impl_ptr(static_cast<const PointerType>(nullptr));
9763  }
9764 
9791  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
9792  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value, int>::type = 0>
9793  ReferenceType get_ref()
9794  {
9795  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
9796  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
9797  }
9798 
9803  template<typename ReferenceType, typename std::enable_if<
9804  std::is_reference<ReferenceType>::value and
9805  std::is_const<typename std::remove_reference<ReferenceType>::type>::value, int>::type = 0>
9806  ReferenceType get_ref() const
9807  {
9808  // delegate call to get_ref_impl
9809  return get_ref_impl<ReferenceType>(*this);
9810  }
9811 
9841  template < typename ValueType, typename std::enable_if <
9842  not std::is_pointer<ValueType>::value and
9843  not std::is_same<ValueType, detail::json_ref<basic_json>>::value and
9844  not std::is_same<ValueType, typename string_t::value_type>::value
9845 #ifndef _MSC_VER // fix for issue #167 operator<< ambiguity under VS2015
9846  and not std::is_same<ValueType, std::initializer_list<typename string_t::value_type>>::value
9847 #endif
9848 #if (defined(__cplusplus) && __cplusplus >= 201703L) || (defined(_MSC_VER) && _MSC_VER >1900 && defined(_HAS_CXX17) && _HAS_CXX17 == 1) // fix for issue #464
9849  and not std::is_same<ValueType, typename std::string_view>::value
9850 #endif
9851  , int >::type = 0 >
9852  operator ValueType() const
9853  {
9854  // delegate the call to get<>() const
9855  return get<ValueType>();
9856  }
9857 
9859 
9860 
9862  // element access //
9864 
9868 
9895  reference at(size_type idx)
9896  {
9897  // at only works for arrays
9898  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
9899  {
9900  JSON_TRY
9901  {
9902  return m_value.array->at(idx);
9903  }
9904  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
9905  {
9906  // create better exception explanation
9907  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
9908  }
9909  }
9910  else
9911  {
9912  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
9913  }
9914  }
9915 
9942  const_reference at(size_type idx) const
9943  {
9944  // at only works for arrays
9945  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
9946  {
9947  JSON_TRY
9948  {
9949  return m_value.array->at(idx);
9950  }
9951  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
9952  {
9953  // create better exception explanation
9954  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
9955  }
9956  }
9957  else
9958  {
9959  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
9960  }
9961  }
9962 
9993  reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
9994  {
9995  // at only works for objects
9996  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
9997  {
9998  JSON_TRY
9999  {
10000  return m_value.object->at(key);
10001  }
10002  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
10003  {
10004  // create better exception explanation
10005  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
10006  }
10007  }
10008  else
10009  {
10010  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10011  }
10012  }
10013 
10044  const_reference at(const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
10045  {
10046  // at only works for objects
10047  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10048  {
10049  JSON_TRY
10050  {
10051  return m_value.object->at(key);
10052  }
10053  JSON_CATCH (std::out_of_range&)
10054  {
10055  // create better exception explanation
10056  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + key + "' not found"));
10057  }
10058  }
10059  else
10060  {
10061  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(304, "cannot use at() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10062  }
10063  }
10064 
10090  reference operator[](size_type idx)
10091  {
10092  // implicitly convert null value to an empty array
10093  if (is_null())
10094  {
10095  m_type = value_t::array;
10096  m_value.array = create<array_t>();
10097  assert_invariant();
10098  }
10099 
10100  // operator[] only works for arrays
10101  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10102  {
10103  // fill up array with null values if given idx is outside range
10104  if (idx >= m_value.array->size())
10105  {
10106  m_value.array->insert(m_value.array->end(),
10107  idx - m_value.array->size() + 1,
10108  basic_json());
10109  }
10110 
10111  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
10112  }
10113 
10114  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10115  }
10116 
10136  const_reference operator[](size_type idx) const
10137  {
10138  // const operator[] only works for arrays
10139  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10140  {
10141  return m_value.array->operator[](idx);
10142  }
10143 
10144  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10145  }
10146 
10174  reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key)
10175  {
10176  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
10177  if (is_null())
10178  {
10179  m_type = value_t::object;
10180  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
10181  assert_invariant();
10182  }
10183 
10184  // operator[] only works for objects
10185  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10186  {
10187  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
10188  }
10189 
10190  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10191  }
10192 
10223  const_reference operator[](const typename object_t::key_type& key) const
10224  {
10225  // const operator[] only works for objects
10226  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10227  {
10228  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
10229  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
10230  }
10231 
10232  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10233  }
10234 
10262  template<typename T>
10263  reference operator[](T* key)
10264  {
10265  // implicitly convert null to object
10266  if (is_null())
10267  {
10268  m_type = value_t::object;
10269  m_value = value_t::object;
10270  assert_invariant();
10271  }
10272 
10273  // at only works for objects
10274  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10275  {
10276  return m_value.object->operator[](key);
10277  }
10278 
10279  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10280  }
10281 
10312  template<typename T>
10313  const_reference operator[](T* key) const
10314  {
10315  // at only works for objects
10316  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10317  {
10318  assert(m_value.object->find(key) != m_value.object->end());
10319  return m_value.object->find(key)->second;
10320  }
10321 
10322  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(305, "cannot use operator[] with " + std::string(type_name())));
10323  }
10324 
10373  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
10374  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
10375  ValueType value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const ValueType& default_value) const
10376  {
10377  // at only works for objects
10378  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10379  {
10380  // if key is found, return value and given default value otherwise
10381  const auto it = find(key);
10382  if (it != end())
10383  {
10384  return *it;
10385  }
10386 
10387  return default_value;
10388  }
10389 
10390  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10391  }
10392 
10397  string_t value(const typename object_t::key_type& key, const char* default_value) const
10398  {
10399  return value(key, string_t(default_value));
10400  }
10401 
10443  template<class ValueType, typename std::enable_if<
10444  std::is_convertible<basic_json_t, ValueType>::value, int>::type = 0>
10445  ValueType value(const json_pointer& ptr, const ValueType& default_value) const
10446  {
10447  // at only works for objects
10448  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10449  {
10450  // if pointer resolves a value, return it or use default value
10451  JSON_TRY
10452  {
10453  return ptr.get_checked(this);
10454  }
10455  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
10456  {
10457  return default_value;
10458  }
10459  }
10460 
10461  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(306, "cannot use value() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10462  }
10463 
10468  string_t value(const json_pointer& ptr, const char* default_value) const
10469  {
10470  return value(ptr, string_t(default_value));
10471  }
10472 
10498  reference front()
10499  {
10500  return *begin();
10501  }
10502 
10506  const_reference front() const
10507  {
10508  return *cbegin();
10509  }
10510 
10542  reference back()
10543  {
10544  auto tmp = end();
10545  --tmp;
10546  return *tmp;
10547  }
10548 
10552  const_reference back() const
10553  {
10554  auto tmp = cend();
10555  --tmp;
10556  return *tmp;
10557  }
10558 
10605  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
10606  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
10607  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
10608  = 0>
10609  IteratorType erase(IteratorType pos)
10610  {
10611  // make sure iterator fits the current value
10612  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != pos.m_object))
10613  {
10614  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
10615  }
10616 
10617  IteratorType result = end();
10618 
10619  switch (m_type)
10620  {
10621  case value_t::boolean:
10622  case value_t::number_float:
10623  case value_t::number_integer:
10624  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10625  case value_t::string:
10626  {
10627  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not pos.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()))
10628  {
10629  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(205, "iterator out of range"));
10630  }
10631 
10632  if (is_string())
10633  {
10634  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
10635  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
10636  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
10637  m_value.string = nullptr;
10638  }
10639 
10640  m_type = value_t::null;
10641  assert_invariant();
10642  break;
10643  }
10644 
10645  case value_t::object:
10646  {
10647  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(pos.m_it.object_iterator);
10648  break;
10649  }
10650 
10651  case value_t::array:
10652  {
10653  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(pos.m_it.array_iterator);
10654  break;
10655  }
10656 
10657  default:
10658  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10659  }
10660 
10661  return result;
10662  }
10663 
10710  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
10711  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::iterator>::value or
10712  std::is_same<IteratorType, typename basic_json_t::const_iterator>::value, int>::type
10713  = 0>
10714  IteratorType erase(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
10715  {
10716  // make sure iterator fits the current value
10717  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(this != first.m_object or this != last.m_object))
10718  {
10719  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(203, "iterators do not fit current value"));
10720  }
10721 
10722  IteratorType result = end();
10723 
10724  switch (m_type)
10725  {
10726  case value_t::boolean:
10727  case value_t::number_float:
10728  case value_t::number_integer:
10729  case value_t::number_unsigned:
10730  case value_t::string:
10731  {
10732  if (JSON_LIKELY(not first.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_begin()
10733  or not last.m_it.primitive_iterator.is_end()))
10734  {
10735  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(204, "iterators out of range"));
10736  }
10737 
10738  if (is_string())
10739  {
10740  AllocatorType<string_t> alloc;
10741  alloc.destroy(m_value.string);
10742  alloc.deallocate(m_value.string, 1);
10743  m_value.string = nullptr;
10744  }
10745 
10746  m_type = value_t::null;
10747  assert_invariant();
10748  break;
10749  }
10750 
10751  case value_t::object:
10752  {
10753  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->erase(first.m_it.object_iterator,
10754  last.m_it.object_iterator);
10755  break;
10756  }
10757 
10758  case value_t::array:
10759  {
10760  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->erase(first.m_it.array_iterator,
10761  last.m_it.array_iterator);
10762  break;
10763  }
10764 
10765  default:
10766  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10767  }
10768 
10769  return result;
10770  }
10771 
10801  size_type erase(const typename object_t::key_type& key)
10802  {
10803  // this erase only works for objects
10804  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
10805  {
10806  return m_value.object->erase(key);
10807  }
10808 
10809  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10810  }
10811 
10836  void erase(const size_type idx)
10837  {
10838  // this erase only works for arrays
10839  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
10840  {
10841  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(idx >= size()))
10842  {
10843  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
10844  }
10845 
10846  m_value.array->erase(m_value.array->begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx));
10847  }
10848  else
10849  {
10850  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(307, "cannot use erase() with " + std::string(type_name())));
10851  }
10852  }
10853 
10855 
10856 
10858  // lookup //
10860 
10863 
10886  iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key)
10887  {
10888  auto result = end();
10889 
10890  if (is_object())
10891  {
10892  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
10893  }
10894 
10895  return result;
10896  }
10897 
10902  const_iterator find(typename object_t::key_type key) const
10903  {
10904  auto result = cend();
10905 
10906  if (is_object())
10907  {
10908  result.m_it.object_iterator = m_value.object->find(key);
10909  }
10910 
10911  return result;
10912  }
10913 
10935  size_type count(typename object_t::key_type key) const
10936  {
10937  // return 0 for all nonobject types
10938  return is_object() ? m_value.object->count(key) : 0;
10939  }
