10943 
10945  // iterators //
10947 
10950 
10975  iterator begin() noexcept
10976  {
10977  iterator result(this);
10978  result.set_begin();
10979  return result;
10980  }
10981 
10985  const_iterator begin() const noexcept
10986  {
10987  return cbegin();
10988  }
10989 
11015  const_iterator cbegin() const noexcept
11016  {
11017  const_iterator result(this);
11018  result.set_begin();
11019  return result;
11020  }
11021 
11046  iterator end() noexcept
11047  {
11048  iterator result(this);
11049  result.set_end();
11050  return result;
11051  }
11052 
11056  const_iterator end() const noexcept
11057  {
11058  return cend();
11059  }
11060 
11086  const_iterator cend() const noexcept
11087  {
11088  const_iterator result(this);
11089  result.set_end();
11090  return result;
11091  }
11092 
11116  reverse_iterator rbegin() noexcept
11117  {
11118  return reverse_iterator(end());
11119  }
11120 
11124  const_reverse_iterator rbegin() const noexcept
11125  {
11126  return crbegin();
11127  }
11128 
11153  reverse_iterator rend() noexcept
11154  {
11155  return reverse_iterator(begin());
11156  }
11157 
11161  const_reverse_iterator rend() const noexcept
11162  {
11163  return crend();
11164  }
11165 
11190  const_reverse_iterator crbegin() const noexcept
11191  {
11192  return const_reverse_iterator(cend());
11193  }
11194 
11219  const_reverse_iterator crend() const noexcept
11220  {
11221  return const_reverse_iterator(cbegin());
11222  }
11223 
11224  public:
11238  static iteration_proxy<iterator> iterator_wrapper(reference cont)
11239  {
11240  return iteration_proxy<iterator>(cont);
11241  }
11242 
11246  static iteration_proxy<const_iterator> iterator_wrapper(const_reference cont)
11247  {
11248  return iteration_proxy<const_iterator>(cont);
11249  }
11250 
11252 
11253 
11255  // capacity //
11257 
11260 
11302  bool empty() const noexcept
11303  {
11304  switch (m_type)
11305  {
11306  case value_t::null:
11307  {
11308  // null values are empty
11309  return true;
11310  }
11311 
11312  case value_t::array:
11313  {
11314  // delegate call to array_t::empty()
11315  return m_value.array->empty();
11316  }
11317 
11318  case value_t::object:
11319  {
11320  // delegate call to object_t::empty()
11321  return m_value.object->empty();
11322  }
11323 
11324  default:
11325  {
11326  // all other types are nonempty
11327  return false;
11328  }
11329  }
11330  }
11331 
11374  size_type size() const noexcept
11375  {
11376  switch (m_type)
11377  {
11378  case value_t::null:
11379  {
11380  // null values are empty
11381  return 0;
11382  }
11383 
11384  case value_t::array:
11385  {
11386  // delegate call to array_t::size()
11387  return m_value.array->size();
11388  }
11389 
11390  case value_t::object:
11391  {
11392  // delegate call to object_t::size()
11393  return m_value.object->size();
11394  }
11395 
11396  default:
11397  {
11398  // all other types have size 1
11399  return 1;
11400  }
11401  }
11402  }
11403 
11444  size_type max_size() const noexcept
11445  {
11446  switch (m_type)
11447  {
11448  case value_t::array:
11449  {
11450  // delegate call to array_t::max_size()
11451  return m_value.array->max_size();
11452  }
11453 
11454  case value_t::object:
11455  {
11456  // delegate call to object_t::max_size()
11457  return m_value.object->max_size();
11458  }
11459 
11460  default:
11461  {
11462  // all other types have max_size() == size()
11463  return size();
11464  }
11465  }
11466  }
11467 
11469 
11470 
11472  // modifiers //
11474 
11477 
11514  void clear() noexcept
11515  {
11516  switch (m_type)
11517  {
11518  case value_t::number_integer:
11519  {
11520  m_value.number_integer = 0;
11521  break;
11522  }
11523 
11524  case value_t::number_unsigned:
11525  {
11526  m_value.number_unsigned = 0;
11527  break;
11528  }
11529 
11530  case value_t::number_float:
11531  {
11532  m_value.number_float = 0.0;
11533  break;
11534  }
11535 
11536  case value_t::boolean:
11537  {
11538  m_value.boolean = false;
11539  break;
11540  }
11541 
11542  case value_t::string:
11543  {
11544  m_value.string->clear();
11545  break;
11546  }
11547 
11548  case value_t::array:
11549  {
11550  m_value.array->clear();
11551  break;
11552  }
11553 
11554  case value_t::object:
11555  {
11556  m_value.object->clear();
11557  break;
11558  }
11559 
11560  default:
11561  break;
11562  }
11563  }
11564 
11585  void push_back(basic_json&& val)
11586  {
11587  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
11588  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11589  {
11590  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11591  }
11592 
11593  // transform null object into an array
11594  if (is_null())
11595  {
11596  m_type = value_t::array;
11597  m_value = value_t::array;
11598  assert_invariant();
11599  }
11600 
11601  // add element to array (move semantics)
11602  m_value.array->push_back(std::move(val));
11603  // invalidate object
11604  val.m_type = value_t::null;
11605  }
11606 
11611  reference operator+=(basic_json&& val)
11612  {
11613  push_back(std::move(val));
11614  return *this;
11615  }
11616 
11621  void push_back(const basic_json& val)
11622  {
11623  // push_back only works for null objects or arrays
11624  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11625  {
11626  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11627  }
11628 
11629  // transform null object into an array
11630  if (is_null())
11631  {
11632  m_type = value_t::array;
11633  m_value = value_t::array;
11634  assert_invariant();
11635  }
11636 
11637  // add element to array
11638  m_value.array->push_back(val);
11639  }
11640 
11645  reference operator+=(const basic_json& val)
11646  {
11647  push_back(val);
11648  return *this;
11649  }
11650 
11671  void push_back(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
11672  {
11673  // push_back only works for null objects or objects
11674  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
11675  {
11676  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(308, "cannot use push_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11677  }
11678 
11679  // transform null object into an object
11680  if (is_null())
11681  {
11682  m_type = value_t::object;
11683  m_value = value_t::object;
11684  assert_invariant();
11685  }
11686 
11687  // add element to array
11688  m_value.object->insert(val);
11689  }
11690 
11695  reference operator+=(const typename object_t::value_type& val)
11696  {
11697  push_back(val);
11698  return *this;
11699  }
11700 
11726  void push_back(initializer_list_t init)
11727  {
11728  if (is_object() and init.size() == 2 and (*init.begin())->is_string())
11729  {
11730  basic_json&& key = init.begin()->moved_or_copied();
11731  push_back(typename object_t::value_type(
11732  std::move(key.get_ref<string_t&>()), (init.begin() + 1)->moved_or_copied()));
11733  }
11734  else
11735  {
11736  push_back(basic_json(init));
11737  }
11738  }
11739 
11744  reference operator+=(initializer_list_t init)
11745  {
11746  push_back(init);
11747  return *this;
11748  }
11749 
11771  template<class... Args>
11772  void emplace_back(Args&& ... args)
11773  {
11774  // emplace_back only works for null objects or arrays
11775  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_array())))
11776  {
11777  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace_back() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11778  }
11779 
11780  // transform null object into an array
11781  if (is_null())
11782  {
11783  m_type = value_t::array;
11784  m_value = value_t::array;
11785  assert_invariant();
11786  }
11787 
11788  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
11789  m_value.array->emplace_back(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11790  }
11791 
11819  template<class... Args>
11820  std::pair<iterator, bool> emplace(Args&& ... args)
11821  {
11822  // emplace only works for null objects or arrays
11823  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not(is_null() or is_object())))
11824  {
11825  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(311, "cannot use emplace() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11826  }
11827 
11828  // transform null object into an object
11829  if (is_null())
11830  {
11831  m_type = value_t::object;
11832  m_value = value_t::object;
11833  assert_invariant();
11834  }
11835 
11836  // add element to array (perfect forwarding)
11837  auto res = m_value.object->emplace(std::forward<Args>(args)...);
11838  // create result iterator and set iterator to the result of emplace
11839  auto it = begin();
11840  it.m_it.object_iterator = res.first;
11841 
11842  // return pair of iterator and boolean
11843  return {it, res.second};
11844  }
11845 
11868  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const basic_json& val)
11869  {
11870  // insert only works for arrays
11871  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
11872  {
11873  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11874  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11875  {
11876  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11877  }
11878 
11879  // insert to array and return iterator
11880  iterator result(this);
11881  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, val);
11882  return result;
11883  }
11884 
11885  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11886  }
11887 
11892  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, basic_json&& val)
11893  {
11894  return insert(pos, val);
11895  }
11896 
11921  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, size_type cnt, const basic_json& val)
11922  {
11923  // insert only works for arrays
11924  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
11925  {
11926  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11927  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11928  {
11929  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11930  }
11931 
11932  // insert to array and return iterator
11933  iterator result(this);
11934  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, cnt, val);
11935  return result;
11936  }
11937 
11938  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11939  }
11940 
11971  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
11972  {
11973  // insert only works for arrays
11974  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
11975  {
11976  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
11977  }
11978 
11979  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
11980  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
11981  {
11982  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
11983  }
11984 
11985  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
11986  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
11987  {
11988  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
11989  }
11990 
11991  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object == this or last.m_object == this))
11992  {
11993  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(211, "passed iterators may not belong to container"));
11994  }
11995 
11996  // insert to array and return iterator
11997  iterator result(this);
11998  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(
11999  pos.m_it.array_iterator,
12000  first.m_it.array_iterator,
12001  last.m_it.array_iterator);
12002  return result;
12003  }
12004 
12029  iterator insert(const_iterator pos, initializer_list_t ilist)
12030  {
12031  // insert only works for arrays
12032  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_array()))
12033  {
12034  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12035  }
12036 
12037  // check if iterator pos fits to this JSON value
12038  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(pos.m_object != this))
12039  {
12040  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterator does not fit current value"));
12041  }
12042 
12043  // insert to array and return iterator
12044  iterator result(this);
12045  result.m_it.array_iterator = m_value.array->insert(pos.m_it.array_iterator, ilist.begin(), ilist.end());
12046  return result;
12047  }
12048 
12072  void insert(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
12073  {
12074  // insert only works for objects
12075  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
12076  {
12077  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(309, "cannot use insert() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12078  }
12079 
12080  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
12081  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
12082  {
12083  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
12084  }
12085 
12086  // passed iterators must belong to objects
12087  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()
12088  or not last.m_object->is_object()))
12089  {
12090  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
12091  }
12092 
12093  m_value.object->insert(first.m_it.object_iterator, last.m_it.object_iterator);
12094  }
12095 
12115  void update(const_reference j)
12116  {
12117  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
12118  if (is_null())
12119  {
12120  m_type = value_t::object;
12121  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
12122  assert_invariant();
12123  }
12124 
12125  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
12126  {
12127  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12128  }
12129  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not j.is_object()))
12130  {
12131  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(j.type_name())));
12132  }
12133 
12134  for (auto it = j.begin(); it != j.end(); ++it)
12135  {
12136  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
12137  }
12138  }
12139 
12166  void update(const_iterator first, const_iterator last)
12167  {
12168  // implicitly convert null value to an empty object
12169  if (is_null())
12170  {
12171  m_type = value_t::object;
12172  m_value.object = create<object_t>();
12173  assert_invariant();
12174  }
12175 
12176  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not is_object()))
12177  {
12178  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(312, "cannot use update() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12179  }
12180 
12181  // check if range iterators belong to the same JSON object
12182  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(first.m_object != last.m_object))
12183  {
12184  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(210, "iterators do not fit"));
12185  }
12186 
12187  // passed iterators must belong to objects
12188  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not first.m_object->is_object()
12189  or not first.m_object->is_object()))
12190  {
12191  JSON_THROW(invalid_iterator::create(202, "iterators first and last must point to objects"));
12192  }
12193 
12194  for (auto it = first; it != last; ++it)
12195  {
12196  m_value.object->operator[](it.key()) = it.value();
12197  }
12198  }
12199 
12217  void swap(reference other) noexcept (
12218  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<value_t>::value and
12219  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<value_t>::value and
12220  std::is_nothrow_move_constructible<json_value>::value and
12221  std::is_nothrow_move_assignable<json_value>::value
12222  )
12223  {
12224  std::swap(m_type, other.m_type);
12225  std::swap(m_value, other.m_value);
12226  assert_invariant();
12227  }
12228 
12249  void swap(array_t& other)
12250  {
12251  // swap only works for arrays
12252  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_array()))
12253  {
12254  std::swap(*(m_value.array), other);
12255  }
12256  else
12257  {
12258  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12259  }
12260  }
12261 
12282  void swap(object_t& other)
12283  {
12284  // swap only works for objects
12285  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_object()))
12286  {
12287  std::swap(*(m_value.object), other);
12288  }
12289  else
12290  {
12291  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12292  }
12293  }
12294 
12315  void swap(string_t& other)
12316  {
12317  // swap only works for strings
12318  if (JSON_LIKELY(is_string()))
12319  {
12320  std::swap(*(m_value.string), other);
12321  }
12322  else
12323  {
12324  JSON_THROW(type_error::create(310, "cannot use swap() with " + std::string(type_name())));
12325  }
12326  }
12327 
12329 
12330  public:
12332  // lexicographical comparison operators //
12334 
12337 
12377  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12378  {
12379  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
12380  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
12381 
12382  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
12383  {
12384  switch (lhs_type)
12385  {
12386  case value_t::array:
12387  return (*lhs.m_value.array == *rhs.m_value.array);
12388 
12389  case value_t::object:
12390  return (*lhs.m_value.object == *rhs.m_value.object);
12391 
12392  case value_t::null:
12393  return true;
12394 
12395  case value_t::string:
12396  return (*lhs.m_value.string == *rhs.m_value.string);
12397 
12398  case value_t::boolean:
12399  return (lhs.m_value.boolean == rhs.m_value.boolean);
12400 
12401  case value_t::number_integer:
12402  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12403 
12404  case value_t::number_unsigned:
12405  return (lhs.m_value.number_unsigned == rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12406 
12407  case value_t::number_float:
12408  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12409 
12410  default:
12411  return false;
12412  }
12413  }
12414  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12415  {
12416  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12417  }
12418  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12419  {
12420  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer));
12421  }
12422  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12423  {
12424  return (static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_float);
12425  }
12426  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12427  {
12428  return (lhs.m_value.number_float == static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
12429  }
12430  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12431  {
12432  return (static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) == rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12433  }
12434  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12435  {
12436  return (lhs.m_value.number_integer == static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned));
12437  }
12438 
12439  return false;
12440  }
12441 
12446  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12447  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12448  friend bool operator==(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12449  {
12450  return (lhs == basic_json(rhs));
12451  }
12452 
12457  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12458  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12459  friend bool operator==(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12460  {
12461  return (basic_json(lhs) == rhs);
12462  }
12463 
12482  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12483  {
12484  return not (lhs == rhs);
12485  }
12486 
12491  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12492  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12493  friend bool operator!=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12494  {
12495  return (lhs != basic_json(rhs));
12496  }
12497 
12502  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12503  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12504  friend bool operator!=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12505  {
12506  return (basic_json(lhs) != rhs);
12507  }
12508 
12535  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12536  {
12537  const auto lhs_type = lhs.type();
12538  const auto rhs_type = rhs.type();
12539 
12540  if (lhs_type == rhs_type)
12541  {
12542  switch (lhs_type)
12543  {
12544  case value_t::array:
12545  return (*lhs.m_value.array) < (*rhs.m_value.array);
12546 
12547  case value_t::object:
12548  return *lhs.m_value.object < *rhs.m_value.object;
12549 
12550  case value_t::null:
12551  return false;
12552 
12553  case value_t::string:
12554  return *lhs.m_value.string < *rhs.m_value.string;
12555 
12556  case value_t::boolean:
12557  return lhs.m_value.boolean < rhs.m_value.boolean;
12558 
12559  case value_t::number_integer:
12560  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
12561 
12562  case value_t::number_unsigned:
12563  return lhs.m_value.number_unsigned < rhs.m_value.number_unsigned;
12564 
12565  case value_t::number_float:
12566  return lhs.m_value.number_float < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12567 
12568  default:
12569  return false;
12570  }
12571  }
12572  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12573  {
12574  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_integer) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12575  }
12576  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12577  {
12578  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_integer);
12579  }
12580  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_float)
12581  {
12582  return static_cast<number_float_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_float;
12583  }
12584  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_float and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12585  {
12586  return lhs.m_value.number_float < static_cast<number_float_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12587  }
12588  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_integer and rhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned)
12589  {
12590  return lhs.m_value.number_integer < static_cast<number_integer_t>(rhs.m_value.number_unsigned);
12591  }
12592  else if (lhs_type == value_t::number_unsigned and rhs_type == value_t::number_integer)
12593  {
12594  return static_cast<number_integer_t>(lhs.m_value.number_unsigned) < rhs.m_value.number_integer;
12595  }
12596 
12597  // We only reach this line if we cannot compare values. In that case,
12598  // we compare types. Note we have to call the operator explicitly,
12599  // because MSVC has problems otherwise.
12600  return operator<(lhs_type, rhs_type);
12601  }
12602 
12607  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12608  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12609  friend bool operator<(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12610  {
12611  return (lhs < basic_json(rhs));
12612  }
12613 
12618  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12619  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12620  friend bool operator<(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12621  {
12622  return (basic_json(lhs) < rhs);
12623  }
12624 
12644  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12645  {
12646  return not (rhs < lhs);
12647  }
12648 
12653  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12654  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12655  friend bool operator<=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12656  {
12657  return (lhs <= basic_json(rhs));
12658  }
12659 
12664  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12665  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12666  friend bool operator<=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12667  {
12668  return (basic_json(lhs) <= rhs);
12669  }
12670 
12690  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12691  {
12692  return not (lhs <= rhs);
12693  }
12694 
12699  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12700  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12701  friend bool operator>(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12702  {
12703  return (lhs > basic_json(rhs));
12704  }
12705 
12710  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12711  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12712  friend bool operator>(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12713  {
12714  return (basic_json(lhs) > rhs);
12715  }
12716 
12736  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12737  {
12738  return not (lhs < rhs);
12739  }
12740 
12745  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12746  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12747  friend bool operator>=(const_reference lhs, const ScalarType rhs) noexcept
12748  {
12749  return (lhs >= basic_json(rhs));
12750  }
12751 
12756  template<typename ScalarType, typename std::enable_if<
12757  std::is_scalar<ScalarType>::value, int>::type = 0>
12758  friend bool operator>=(const ScalarType lhs, const_reference rhs) noexcept
12759  {
12760  return (basic_json(lhs) >= rhs);
12761  }
12762 
12764 
12766  // serialization //
12768 
12771 
12800  friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& o, const basic_json& j)
12801  {
12802  // read width member and use it as indentation parameter if nonzero
12803  const bool pretty_print = (o.width() > 0);
12804  const auto indentation = (pretty_print ? o.width() : 0);
12805 
12806  // reset width to 0 for subsequent calls to this stream
12807  o.width(0);
12808 
12809  // do the actual serialization
12810  serializer s(detail::output_adapter<char>(o), o.fill());
12811  s.dump(j, pretty_print, false, static_cast<unsigned int>(indentation));
12812  return o;
12813  }
12814 
12822  JSON_DEPRECATED
12823  friend std::ostream& operator>>(const basic_json& j, std::ostream& o)
12824  {
12825  return o << j;
12826  }
12827 
12829 
12830 
12832  // deserialization //
12834 
12837 
12900  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter i,
12901  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12902  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12903  {
12904  basic_json result;
12905  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12906  return result;
12907  }
12908 
12912  static basic_json parse(detail::input_adapter& i,
12913  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12914  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12915  {
12916  basic_json result;
12917  parser(i, cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12918  return result;
12919  }
12920 
12921  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter i)
12922  {
12923  return parser(i).accept(true);
12924  }
12925 
12926  static bool accept(detail::input_adapter& i)
12927  {
12928  return parser(i).accept(true);
12929  }
12930 
12976  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
12977  std::is_base_of<
12978  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
12979  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
12980  static basic_json parse(IteratorType first, IteratorType last,
12981  const parser_callback_t cb = nullptr,
12982  const bool allow_exceptions = true)
12983  {
12984  basic_json result;
12985  parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last), cb, allow_exceptions).parse(true, result);
12986  return result;
12987  }
12988 
12989  template<class IteratorType, typename std::enable_if<
12990  std::is_base_of<
12991  std::random_access_iterator_tag,
12992  typename std::iterator_traits<IteratorType>::iterator_category>::value, int>::type = 0>
12993  static bool accept(IteratorType first, IteratorType last)
12994  {
12995  return parser(detail::input_adapter(first, last)).accept(true);
12996  }
12997 
13005  JSON_DEPRECATED
13006  friend std::istream& operator<<(basic_json& j, std::istream& i)
13007  {
13008  return operator>>(i, j);
13009  }
13010 
13036  friend std::istream& operator>>(std::istream& i, basic_json& j)
13037  {
13038  parser(detail::input_adapter(i)).parse(false, j);
13039  return i;
13040  }
13041 
13043 
13045  // convenience functions //
13047 
13078  const char* type_name() const noexcept
13079  {
13080  {
13081  switch (m_type)
13082  {
13083  case value_t::null:
13084  return "null";
13085  case value_t::object:
13086  return "object";
13087  case value_t::array:
13088  return "array";
13089  case value_t::string:
13090  return "string";
13091  case value_t::boolean:
13092  return "boolean";
13093  case value_t::discarded:
13094  return "discarded";
13095  default:
13096  return "number";
13097  }
13098  }
13099  }
13100 
13101 
13102  private:
13104  // member variables //
13106 
13108  value_t m_type = value_t::null;
13109 
13111  json_value m_value = {};
13112 
13114  // binary serialization/deserialization //
13116 
13119 
13120  public:
13207  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_cbor(const basic_json& j)
13208  {
13209  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
13210  to_cbor(j, result);
13211  return result;
13212  }
13213 
13214  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
13215  {
13216  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_cbor(j);
13217  }
13218 
13219  static void to_cbor(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
13220  {
13221  binary_writer<char>(o).write_cbor(j);
13222  }
13223 
13302  static std::vector<uint8_t> to_msgpack(const basic_json& j)
13303  {
13304  std::vector<uint8_t> result;
13305  to_msgpack(j, result);
13306  return result;
13307  }
13308 
13309  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<uint8_t> o)
13310  {
13311  binary_writer<uint8_t>(o).write_msgpack(j);
13312  }
13313 
13314  static void to_msgpack(const basic_json& j, detail::output_adapter<char> o)
13315  {
13316  binary_writer<char>(o).write_msgpack(j);
13317  }
13318 
13410  static basic_json from_cbor(detail::input_adapter i,
13411  const bool strict = true)
13412  {
13413  return binary_reader(i).parse_cbor(strict);
13414  }
13415 
13419  template<typename A1, typename A2,
13420  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
13421  static basic_json from_cbor(A1 && a1, A2 && a2, const bool strict = true)
13422  {
13423  return binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).parse_cbor(strict);
13424  }
13425 
13497  static basic_json from_msgpack(detail::input_adapter i,
13498  const bool strict = true)
13499  {
13500  return binary_reader(i).parse_msgpack(strict);
13501  }
13502 
13506  template<typename A1, typename A2,
13507  detail::enable_if_t<std::is_constructible<detail::input_adapter, A1, A2>::value, int> = 0>
13508  static basic_json from_msgpack(A1 && a1, A2 && a2, const bool strict = true)
13509  {
13510  return binary_reader(detail::input_adapter(std::forward<A1>(a1), std::forward<A2>(a2))).parse_msgpack(strict);
13511  }
13512 
13514 
13516  // JSON Pointer support //
13518 
13521 
13555  reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr)
13556  {
13557  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13558  }
13559 
13583  const_reference operator[](const json_pointer& ptr) const
13584  {
13585  return ptr.get_unchecked(this);
13586  }
13587 
13623  reference at(const json_pointer& ptr)
13624  {
13625  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13626  }
13627 
13663  const_reference at(const json_pointer& ptr) const
13664  {
13665  return ptr.get_checked(this);
13666  }
13667 
13690  basic_json flatten() const
13691  {
13692  basic_json result(value_t::object);
13693  json_pointer::flatten("", *this, result);
13694  return result;
13695  }
13696 
13727  basic_json unflatten() const
13728  {
13729  return json_pointer::unflatten(*this);
13730  }
13731 
13733 
13735  // JSON Patch functions //
13737 
13740 
13788  basic_json patch(const basic_json& json_patch) const
13789  {
13790  // make a working copy to apply the patch to
13791  basic_json result = *this;
13792 
13793  // the valid JSON Patch operations
13794  enum class patch_operations {add, remove, replace, move, copy, test, invalid};
13795 
13796  const auto get_op = [](const std::string & op)
13797  {
13798  if (op == "add")
13799  {
13800  return patch_operations::add;
13801  }
13802  if (op == "remove")
13803  {
13804  return patch_operations::remove;
13805  }
13806  if (op == "replace")
13807  {
13808  return patch_operations::replace;
13809  }
13810  if (op == "move")
13811  {
13812  return patch_operations::move;
13813  }
13814  if (op == "copy")
13815  {
13816  return patch_operations::copy;
13817  }
13818  if (op == "test")
13819  {
13820  return patch_operations::test;
13821  }
13822 
13823  return patch_operations::invalid;
13824  };
13825 
13826  // wrapper for "add" operation; add value at ptr
13827  const auto operation_add = [&result](json_pointer & ptr, basic_json val)
13828  {
13829  // adding to the root of the target document means replacing it
13830  if (ptr.is_root())
13831  {
13832  result = val;
13833  }
13834  else
13835  {
13836  // make sure the top element of the pointer exists
13837  json_pointer top_pointer = ptr.top();
13838  if (top_pointer != ptr)
13839  {
13840  result.at(top_pointer);
13841  }
13842 
13843  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
13844  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
13845  basic_json& parent = result[ptr];
13846 
13847  switch (parent.m_type)
13848  {
13849  case value_t::null:
13850  case value_t::object:
13851  {
13852  // use operator[] to add value
13853  parent[last_path] = val;
13854  break;
13855  }
13856 
13857  case value_t::array:
13858  {
13859  if (last_path == "-")
13860  {
13861  // special case: append to back
13862  parent.push_back(val);
13863  }
13864  else
13865  {
13866  const auto idx = std::stoi(last_path);
13867  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(static_cast<size_type>(idx) > parent.size()))
13868  {
13869  // avoid undefined behavior
13870  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(401, "array index " + std::to_string(idx) + " is out of range"));
13871  }
13872  else
13873  {
13874  // default case: insert add offset
13875  parent.insert(parent.begin() + static_cast<difference_type>(idx), val);
13876  }
13877  }
13878  break;
13879  }
13880 
13881  default:
13882  {
13883  // if there exists a parent it cannot be primitive
13884  assert(false); // LCOV_EXCL_LINE
13885  }
13886  }
13887  }
13888  };
13889 
13890  // wrapper for "remove" operation; remove value at ptr
13891  const auto operation_remove = [&result](json_pointer & ptr)
13892  {
13893  // get reference to parent of JSON pointer ptr
13894  const auto last_path = ptr.pop_back();
13895  basic_json& parent = result.at(ptr);
13896 
13897  // remove child
13898  if (parent.is_object())
13899  {
13900  // perform range check
13901  auto it = parent.find(last_path);
13902  if (JSON_LIKELY(it != parent.end()))
13903  {
13904  parent.erase(it);
13905  }
13906  else
13907  {
13908  JSON_THROW(out_of_range::create(403, "key '" + last_path + "' not found"));
13909  }
13910  }
13911  else if (parent.is_array())
13912  {
13913  // note erase performs range check
13914  parent.erase(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(last_path)));
13915  }
13916  };
13917 
13918  // type check: top level value must be an array
13919  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not json_patch.is_array()))
13920  {
13921  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
13922  }
13923 
13924  // iterate and apply the operations
13925  for (const auto& val : json_patch)
13926  {
13927  // wrapper to get a value for an operation
13928  const auto get_value = [&val](const std::string & op,
13929  const std::string & member,
13930  bool string_type) -> basic_json&
13931  {
13932  // find value
13933  auto it = val.m_value.object->find(member);
13934 
13935  // context-sensitive error message
13936  const auto error_msg = (op == "op") ? "operation" : "operation '" + op + "'";
13937 
13938  // check if desired value is present
13939  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(it == val.m_value.object->end()))
13940  {
13941  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have member '" + member + "'"));
13942  }
13943 
13944  // check if result is of type string
13945  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(string_type and not it->second.is_string()))
13946  {
13947  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, error_msg + " must have string member '" + member + "'"));
13948  }
13949 
13950  // no error: return value
13951  return it->second;
13952  };
13953 
13954  // type check: every element of the array must be an object
13955  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not val.is_object()))
13956  {
13957  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(104, 0, "JSON patch must be an array of objects"));
13958  }
13959 
13960  // collect mandatory members
13961  const std::string op = get_value("op", "op", true);
13962  const std::string path = get_value(op, "path", true);
13963  json_pointer ptr(path);
13964 
13965  switch (get_op(op))
13966  {
13967  case patch_operations::add:
13968  {
13969  operation_add(ptr, get_value("add", "value", false));
13970  break;
13971  }
13972 
13973  case patch_operations::remove:
13974  {
13975  operation_remove(ptr);
13976  break;
13977  }
13978 
13979  case patch_operations::replace:
13980  {
13981  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
13982  result.at(ptr) = get_value("replace", "value", false);
13983  break;
13984  }
13985 
13986  case patch_operations::move:
13987  {
13988  const std::string from_path = get_value("move", "from", true);
13989  json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
13990 
13991  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
13992  basic_json v = result.at(from_ptr);
13993 
13994  // The move operation is functionally identical to a
13995  // "remove" operation on the "from" location, followed
13996  // immediately by an "add" operation at the target
13997  // location with the value that was just removed.
13998  operation_remove(from_ptr);
13999  operation_add(ptr, v);
14000  break;
14001  }
14002 
14003  case patch_operations::copy:
14004  {
14005  const std::string from_path = get_value("copy", "from", true);
14006  const json_pointer from_ptr(from_path);
14007 
14008  // the "from" location must exist - use at()
14009  result[ptr] = result.at(from_ptr);
14010  break;
14011  }
14012 
14013  case patch_operations::test:
14014  {
14015  bool success = false;
14016  JSON_TRY
14017  {
14018  // check if "value" matches the one at "path"
14019  // the "path" location must exist - use at()
14020  success = (result.at(ptr) == get_value("test", "value", false));
14021  }
14022  JSON_CATCH (out_of_range&)
14023  {
14024  // ignore out of range errors: success remains false
14025  }
14026 
14027  // throw an exception if test fails
14028  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not success))
14029  {
14030  JSON_THROW(other_error::create(501, "unsuccessful: " + val.dump()));
14031  }
14032 
14033  break;
14034  }
14035 
14036  case patch_operations::invalid:
14037  {
14038  // op must be "add", "remove", "replace", "move", "copy", or
14039  // "test"
14040  JSON_THROW(parse_error::create(105, 0, "operation value '" + op + "' is invalid"));
14041  }
14042  }
14043  }
14044 
14045  return result;
14046  }
14047 
14080  static basic_json diff(const basic_json& source, const basic_json& target,
14081  const std::string& path = "")
14082  {
14083  // the patch
14084  basic_json result(value_t::array);
14085 
14086  // if the values are the same, return empty patch
14087  if (source == target)
14088  {
14089  return result;
14090  }
14091 
14092  if (source.type() != target.type())
14093  {
14094  // different types: replace value
14095  result.push_back(
14096  {
14097  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
14098  });
14099  }
14100  else
14101  {
14102  switch (source.type())
14103  {
14104  case value_t::array:
14105  {
14106  // first pass: traverse common elements
14107  std::size_t i = 0;
14108  while (i < source.size() and i < target.size())
14109  {
14110  // recursive call to compare array values at index i
14111  auto temp_diff = diff(source[i], target[i], path + "/" + std::to_string(i));
14112  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
14113  ++i;
14114  }
14115 
14116  // i now reached the end of at least one array
14117  // in a second pass, traverse the remaining elements
14118 
14119  // remove my remaining elements
14120  const auto end_index = static_cast<difference_type>(result.size());
14121  while (i < source.size())
14122  {
14123  // add operations in reverse order to avoid invalid
14124  // indices
14125  result.insert(result.begin() + end_index, object(
14126  {
14127  {"op", "remove"},
14128  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)}
14129  }));
14130  ++i;
14131  }
14132 
14133  // add other remaining elements
14134  while (i < target.size())
14135  {
14136  result.push_back(
14137  {
14138  {"op", "add"},
14139  {"path", path + "/" + std::to_string(i)},
14140  {"value", target[i]}
14141  });
14142  ++i;
14143  }
14144 
14145  break;
14146  }
14147 
14148  case value_t::object:
14149  {
14150  // first pass: traverse this object's elements
14151  for (auto it = source.begin(); it != source.end(); ++it)
14152  {
14153  // escape the key name to be used in a JSON patch
14154  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
14155 
14156  if (target.find(it.key()) != target.end())
14157  {
14158  // recursive call to compare object values at key it
14159  auto temp_diff = diff(it.value(), target[it.key()], path + "/" + key);
14160  result.insert(result.end(), temp_diff.begin(), temp_diff.end());
14161  }
14162  else
14163  {
14164  // found a key that is not in o -> remove it
14165  result.push_back(object(
14166  {
14167  {"op", "remove"}, {"path", path + "/" + key}
14168  }));
14169  }
14170  }
14171 
14172  // second pass: traverse other object's elements
14173  for (auto it = target.begin(); it != target.end(); ++it)
14174  {
14175  if (source.find(it.key()) == source.end())
14176  {
14177  // found a key that is not in this -> add it
14178  const auto key = json_pointer::escape(it.key());
14179  result.push_back(
14180  {
14181  {"op", "add"}, {"path", path + "/" + key},
14182  {"value", it.value()}
14183  });
14184  }
14185  }
14186 
14187  break;
14188  }
14189 
14190  default:
14191  {
14192  // both primitive type: replace value
14193  result.push_back(
14194  {
14195  {"op", "replace"}, {"path", path}, {"value", target}
14196  });
14197  break;
14198  }
14199  }
14200  }
14201 
14202  return result;
14203  }
14204 
14206 };
14207 
14209 // presets //
14211 
14220 using json = basic_json<>;
14221 
14223 // json_pointer //
14225 
14226 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14227 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14228 json_pointer::get_and_create(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& j) const
14229 {
14230  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14231  auto result = &j;
14232 
14233  // in case no reference tokens exist, return a reference to the JSON value
14234  // j which will be overwritten by a primitive value
14235  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14236  {
14237  switch (result->m_type)
14238  {
14239  case detail::value_t::null:
14240  {
14241  if (reference_token == "0")
14242  {
14243  // start a new array if reference token is 0
14244  result = &result->operator[](0);
14245  }
14246  else
14247  {
14248  // start a new object otherwise
14249  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
14250  }
14251  break;
14252  }
14253 
14254  case detail::value_t::object:
14255  {
14256  // create an entry in the object
14257  result = &result->operator[](reference_token);
14258  break;
14259  }
14260 
14261  case detail::value_t::array:
14262  {
14263  // create an entry in the array
14264  JSON_TRY
14265  {
14266  result = &result->operator[](static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14267  }
14268  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14269  {
14270  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14271  }
14272  break;
14273  }
14274 
14275  /*
14276  The following code is only reached if there exists a reference
14277  token _and_ the current value is primitive. In this case, we have
14278  an error situation, because primitive values may only occur as
14279  single value; that is, with an empty list of reference tokens.
14280  */
14281  default:
14282  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(313, "invalid value to unflatten"));
14283  }
14284  }
14285 
14286  return *result;
14287 }
14288 
14289 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14290 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14291 json_pointer::get_unchecked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14292 {
14293  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14294  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14295  {
14296  // convert null values to arrays or objects before continuing
14297  if (ptr->m_type == detail::value_t::null)
14298  {
14299  // check if reference token is a number
14300  const bool nums =
14301  std::all_of(reference_token.begin(), reference_token.end(),
14302  [](const char x)
14303  {
14304  return (x >= '0' and x <= '9');
14305  });
14306 
14307  // change value to array for numbers or "-" or to object otherwise
14308  *ptr = (nums or reference_token == "-")
14309  ? detail::value_t::array
14310  : detail::value_t::object;
14311  }
14312 
14313  switch (ptr->m_type)
14314  {
14315  case detail::value_t::object:
14316  {
14317  // use unchecked object access
14318  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
14319  break;
14320  }
14321 
14322  case detail::value_t::array:
14323  {
14324  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14325  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14326  {
14327  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14328  "array index '" + reference_token +
14329  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14330  }
14331 
14332  if (reference_token == "-")
14333  {
14334  // explicitly treat "-" as index beyond the end
14335  ptr = &ptr->operator[](ptr->m_value.array->size());
14336  }
14337  else
14338  {
14339  // convert array index to number; unchecked access
14340  JSON_TRY
14341  {
14342  ptr = &ptr->operator[](
14343  static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14344  }
14345  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14346  {
14347  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14348  }
14349  }
14350  break;
14351  }
14352 
14353  default:
14354  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14355  }
14356  }
14357 
14358  return *ptr;
14359 }
14360 
14361 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14362 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14363 json_pointer::get_checked(NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14364 {
14365  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14366  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14367  {
14368  switch (ptr->m_type)
14369  {
14370  case detail::value_t::object:
14371  {
14372  // note: at performs range check
14373  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
14374  break;
14375  }
14376 
14377  case detail::value_t::array:
14378  {
14379  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14380  {
14381  // "-" always fails the range check
14382  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14383  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14384  ") is out of range"));
14385  }
14386 
14387  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14388  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14389  {
14390  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14391  "array index '" + reference_token +
14392  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14393  }
14394 
14395  // note: at performs range check
14396  JSON_TRY
14397  {
14398  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14399  }
14400  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14401  {
14402  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14403  }
14404  break;
14405  }
14406 
14407  default:
14408  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14409  }
14410  }
14411 
14412  return *ptr;
14413 }
14414 
14415 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14416 const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14417 json_pointer::get_unchecked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14418 {
14419  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14420  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14421  {
14422  switch (ptr->m_type)
14423  {
14424  case detail::value_t::object:
14425  {
14426  // use unchecked object access
14427  ptr = &ptr->operator[](reference_token);
14428  break;
14429  }
14430 
14431  case detail::value_t::array:
14432  {
14433  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14434  {
14435  // "-" cannot be used for const access
14436  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14437  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14438  ") is out of range"));
14439  }
14440 
14441  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14442  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14443  {
14444  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14445  "array index '" + reference_token +
14446  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14447  }
14448 
14449  // use unchecked array access
14450  JSON_TRY
14451  {
14452  ptr = &ptr->operator[](
14453  static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14454  }
14455  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14456  {
14457  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14458  }
14459  break;
14460  }
14461 
14462  default:
14463  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14464  }
14465  }
14466 
14467  return *ptr;
14468 }
14469 
14470 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14471 const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL&
14472 json_pointer::get_checked(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL* ptr) const
14473 {
14474  using size_type = typename NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL::size_type;
14475  for (const auto& reference_token : reference_tokens)
14476  {
14477  switch (ptr->m_type)
14478  {
14479  case detail::value_t::object:
14480  {
14481  // note: at performs range check
14482  ptr = &ptr->at(reference_token);
14483  break;
14484  }
14485 
14486  case detail::value_t::array:
14487  {
14488  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token == "-"))
14489  {
14490  // "-" always fails the range check
14491  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(402,
14492  "array index '-' (" + std::to_string(ptr->m_value.array->size()) +
14493  ") is out of range"));
14494  }
14495 
14496  // error condition (cf. RFC 6901, Sect. 4)
14497  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(reference_token.size() > 1 and reference_token[0] == '0'))
14498  {
14499  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(106, 0,
14500  "array index '" + reference_token +
14501  "' must not begin with '0'"));
14502  }
14503 
14504  // note: at performs range check
14505  JSON_TRY
14506  {
14507  ptr = &ptr->at(static_cast<size_type>(std::stoi(reference_token)));
14508  }
14509  JSON_CATCH(std::invalid_argument&)
14510  {
14511  JSON_THROW(detail::parse_error::create(109, 0, "array index '" + reference_token + "' is not a number"));
14512  }
14513  break;
14514  }
14515 
14516  default:
14517  JSON_THROW(detail::out_of_range::create(404, "unresolved reference token '" + reference_token + "'"));
14518  }
14519  }
14520 
14521  return *ptr;
14522 }
14523 
14524 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14525 void json_pointer::flatten(const std::string& reference_string,
14526  const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value,
14527  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& result)
14528 {
14529  switch (value.m_type)
14530  {
14531  case detail::value_t::array:
14532  {
14533  if (value.m_value.array->empty())
14534  {
14535  // flatten empty array as null
14536  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
14537  }
14538  else
14539  {
14540  // iterate array and use index as reference string
14541  for (std::size_t i = 0; i < value.m_value.array->size(); ++i)
14542  {
14543  flatten(reference_string + "/" + std::to_string(i),
14544  value.m_value.array->operator[](i), result);
14545  }
14546  }
14547  break;
14548  }
14549 
14550  case detail::value_t::object:
14551  {
14552  if (value.m_value.object->empty())
14553  {
14554  // flatten empty object as null
14555  result[reference_string] = nullptr;
14556  }
14557  else
14558  {
14559  // iterate object and use keys as reference string
14560  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
14561  {
14562  flatten(reference_string + "/" + escape(element.first), element.second, result);
14563  }
14564  }
14565  break;
14566  }
14567 
14568  default:
14569  {
14570  // add primitive value with its reference string
14571  result[reference_string] = value;
14572  break;
14573  }
14574  }
14575 }
14576 
14577 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14578 NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
14579 json_pointer::unflatten(const NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL& value)
14580 {
14581  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not value.is_object()))
14582  {
14583  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(314, "only objects can be unflattened"));
14584  }
14585 
14586  NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL result;
14587 
14588  // iterate the JSON object values
14589  for (const auto& element : *value.m_value.object)
14590  {
14591  if (JSON_UNLIKELY(not element.second.is_primitive()))
14592  {
14593  JSON_THROW(detail::type_error::create(315, "values in object must be primitive"));
14594  }
14595 
14596  // assign value to reference pointed to by JSON pointer; Note that if
14597  // the JSON pointer is "" (i.e., points to the whole value), function
14598  // get_and_create returns a reference to result itself. An assignment
14599  // will then create a primitive value.
14600  json_pointer(element.first).get_and_create(result) = element.second;
14601  }
14602 
14603  return result;
14604 }
14605 
14606 inline bool operator==(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
14607 {
14608  return (lhs.reference_tokens == rhs.reference_tokens);
14609 }
14610 
14611 inline bool operator!=(json_pointer const& lhs, json_pointer const& rhs) noexcept
14612 {
14613  return not (lhs == rhs);
14614 }
14615 } // namespace nlohmann
14616 
14617 
14619 // nonmember support //
14621 
14622 // specialization of std::swap, and std::hash
14623 namespace std
14624 {
14630 template<>
14631 inline void swap(nlohmann::json& j1,
14632  nlohmann::json& j2) noexcept(
14633  is_nothrow_move_constructible<nlohmann::json>::value and
14634  is_nothrow_move_assignable<nlohmann::json>::value
14635  )
14636 {
14637  j1.swap(j2);
14638 }
14639 
14641 template<>
14642 struct hash<nlohmann::json>
14643 {
14649  std::size_t operator()(const nlohmann::json& j) const
14650  {
14651  // a naive hashing via the string representation
14652  const auto& h = hash<nlohmann::json::string_t>();
14653  return h(j.dump());
14654  }
14655 };
14656 
14660 template<>
14661 struct less< ::nlohmann::detail::value_t>
14662 {
14667  bool operator()(nlohmann::detail::value_t lhs,
14668  nlohmann::detail::value_t rhs) const noexcept
14669  {
14670  return nlohmann::detail::operator<(lhs, rhs);
14671  }
14672 };
14673 
14674 } // namespace std
14675 
14689 inline nlohmann::json operator "" _json(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14690 {
14691  return nlohmann::json::parse(s, s + n);
14692 }
14693 
14707 inline nlohmann::json::json_pointer operator "" _json_pointer(const char* s, std::size_t n)
14708 {
14709  return nlohmann::json::json_pointer(std::string(s, n));
14710 }

14712 // restore GCC/clang diagnostic settings
14713 #if defined(__clang__) || defined(__GNUC__) || defined(__GNUG__)
14714  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
14715 #endif
14716 #if defined(__clang__)
14717  #pragma GCC diagnostic pop
14718 #endif
14719

14722 #undef JSON_THROW
14723 #undef JSON_TRY
14724 #undef JSON_LIKELY
14725 #undef JSON_UNLIKELY
14726 #undef JSON_DEPRECATED
14727 #undef NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL_DECLARATION
14728 #undef NLOHMANN_BASIC_JSON_TPL
14729 
14730 #endif
